films.title: FLAMES
films.synopsis: In the flourishing yet caste laden farmlands of Haryana, India, a mute migrant farmworker is forced to embark on a harrowing journey for survival when his 10-year-old son is accused of a murder.
films.cast: Vikram Kochhar, Garvit Mudgil, Kalavati Amma, Vajid Ali, Aslam Khan, Kalicharan
films.awardsWon: IFFK (Indian Cinema Now), Jogja Netpac Asian FF (Competition).
films.awardsNominated: Jogja Netpac Asian FF (Competition), IFFK  (Indian Cinema Now).

films.title: INSIDE AMIR
films.synopsis: Inside Amir follows a young man on the verge of emigration who must decide whether to leave or stay. His only companion is his bicycle. The film explores his relationships, anxieties, and inner struggles in the city he is tied to.
films.producer: Amir Azizi, Elham Azizi, Ali Azizi
films.cast: Amirhossein Hosseini, Nader Pourmahin, Hadis Nazari, Nariman Farrokhi, Pirouz Nemati, Sohrab Mahdavi, Delaram Kamareh, Elham Azizi, Sajjad Hamidian
films.awardsWon: The Giornate degli Autori (Venice Days) Award at the 82nd Venice IFF.
films.awardsNominated: Asia Pacific Screen Awards (Nominated- Best Director), opened Mannheim-Heidelberg, screened at Tokyo FILMeX, Golden Rooster, Mirage Oslo, San Francisco IFF.

films.title: K POPPER
films.synopsis: Teenage girl devoted to her pop idol yearns to visit Seoul while facing her mother’s opposition.
films.cast: Sareh Bayat, Setayesh Dehghan, Ali Bagheri, Mehdi Hashemi
films.awardsWon: POFF Talin Black IFF, IFFI (competition section of UNESCO Gandhi Medal).

films.title: KURAK
films.synopsis: Interwoven true stories of violence against women reveal tragic consequences in modern Kyrgyzstan.
films.producer: OYMO Studio GmbH, Kairat Birimkulov Produktion, Spirito Libero Belgrad, Girelle Production, Deal Productions, Human Films, Revolver
films.cast: Ainura Kachkynbek, Kyzy Aliman Ryspekova, Begaiym Asanakunova
films.awardsNominated: Busan IFF (Vision Asia section).

films.title: LOST LAND
films.synopsis: In the hope of reuniting with their scattered family, Shafi (4) and his sister Somira (9) leaves Rohingya refugee camp in Bangladesh and heads on a perilous journey to reach Malaysia.
films.kannadaTitle:
In the hope of reuniting with their scattered family, Shafi (4) and his sister Somira (9) leaves Rohingya refugee camp in Bangladesh and heads on a perilous journey to reach Malaysia.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಕುಟುಂಬದೊಂದಿಗೆ ಮತ್ತೆ ಒಂದಾಗುವ ಆಶಯದಲ್ಲಿ, ನಾಲ್ಕು ವರ್ಷದ ಶಫಿ ಮತ್ತು ಅವನ ಒಂಬತ್ತು ವರ್ಷದ ಅಕ್ಕ ಸೋಮಿರಾ ಬಾಂಗ್ಲಾದೇಶದಲ್ಲಿರುವ ರೋಹಿಂಗ್ಯಾ ಶರಣಾರ್ಥಿ ಶಿಬಿರವನ್ನು ತೊರೆದು, ಮಲೇಶಿಯಾದ ಕಡೆಗೆ ಜೀವಪಣದ ಅಪಾಯಕಾರಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಕ್ಕೆ ಹೊರಡುತ್ತಾರೆ.
films.cast: Shomira Rias Uddin, Muhammad Shofik Rias Uddin
films.awardsWon: Venice Film Festival - Orizzonti Competition (Special Jury Award 2025), NETPAC (Special Mention), Bisato d'Oro (Best Director).

films.title: NAM SAALI
films.synopsis: Gangya is asked to read his essay "On the school" aloud in class. With innocence and honesty, he speaks of broken classrooms and missing facilities, truths that expose a system built on negligence. Offended teacher beats him, forcing him to promise a rewritten, proper version. At home, hope briefly returns when his impoverished parents speak of migrating to the city for a better future. Trusting this promise, Gangya skips school the next day without rewriting the essay. But poverty decides otherwise. His parents leave the village in silence, another unseen migration. Abandoned and cornered, Gangya returns to school. This time, he suppresses his truth and reads a safe, obedient essay. The teacher is pleased. The system succeeds.
films.cast: Shreeshil, Jahangir M S

films.title: REPUBLIC OF PIPOLIPINAS
films.synopsis: When the local government threatens the lady to vacate from her own land, she renounces her Filipino citizenship and builds her own micronation.
films.cast: Geraldine Villamil, Alessandra de Ross

films.title: SHADOWBOX
films.synopsis: Maya lives with her husband, Sundar, and their teenage son, Debu, in a bustling suburb of Kolkata. She works multiple jobs, while Sundar is a retired soldier suffering from PTSD. Debu, often left to care for his father, is torn between embarrassment and affection. One night Maya wakes to find Sundar gone. Sundar is a suspect in a murder investigation, and a search ensues. When Sundar returns to Maya a few days later, the family balance is put to test.
films.cast: Tillotama Shome, Chandan Bisht, Sayan Karmakar, Suman Saha
films.awardsWon: El Gouna FF (NETPAC Award), ICAPFF Turkey (Jury Special Award), LEFFEST (Revelation Award), IFFK (Best Debut Director and Special Jury Mention for Performance).
films.awardsNominated: Berlinale 2025, SFFILM, São Paulo IFF, Chicago South Asian FF, New Generations Indian Independent FF, Hainan Island IFF.

films.title: SHAPE OF MOMO
films.synopsis: A woman quits her job to return to her family plagued by the deaths of male members. Finding the remaining women apathetic, she resolves to empower them towards independence and self-reliance.
films.cast: Gaumaya Gurung, Pashupat Rai, Shyama Shree Sherpa, Bhanu Maya Rai, Rahul Mukhia
films.awardsWon: Busan IFF (Songwon Vision Award and Taipei Film Commission Award), IFFK (Best Film).
films.awardsNominated: San Sebastian (New Director), Singapore IFF (Best Film, Best Director, Best Actor)

films.title: THE DEEPEST SPACE IN US
films.synopsis: Kaori, an aromantic and asexual woman, is left shattered after her fiance Takerus sudden suicide. Seeking closure, she embarks on a journey with Nakano, Takerus best friend, to the place of his death unraveling hidden layers of love, identity, and the self exploration.
films.cast: Momoko Fukuchi Kanichiro, Ryutaro Nakagawa
films.awardsNominated: São Paulo IFF, IFFK, BFI (Flare), LGBTQIA+ FF.

films.title: THE FIN
films.synopsis: In a ravaged postwar Korea, mutant Omegas serve as exploited workers. Government employee Sujin questions official doctrine while searching for Mia, a fugitive Omega.
films.editor: Clmentine Decremps, Syeyoung Park, Jiyoon Han, Benjamin Mirguet
films.cast: Yeji Yeon, Pureum Kim, Goh-Woo, Youngdoo Jeong, Joowon Meng
films.awardsNominated: Locarno FF, Sitges FF, Hamburg FF, Golden Rooster FF, Bangkok IFF, Taipei Golden Horse FF.

films.title: THE LAST SUMMER
films.synopsis: Before China’s major exams, Li Zhizhi sees her father with a pregnant woman and in shock, causes an accident harming a child, forcing her to confront guilt, pressure and a deeper truth.
films.cast: Cui Zhongyu, Cui Nan, Ye Fusheng
films.awardsWon: Shanghai FF (Asian New Talent Award), FIRST Youth FF.
films.awardsNominated: Shanghai FF, FIRST Youth FF, Osaka Asian FF (Grand Prix Nomination).

films.title: THE TABLET
films.synopsis: A single mother, Kayal, and her 12-year-old son, Prabhu, have a medical condition. Kayal keeps this a secret from everyone, including her son. Suspicions are raised when one of Prabhu tablets goes missing, and Kayal becomes anxious that people especially Prabhu may find out that the missing tablet is an ART tablet, which reveals that they are HIV positive
films.producer: SSBV Learn and Teach Production Pvt Ltd
films.cast: Raichal

films.title: TIGER'S POND
films.synopsis: In quiet VAGHACHIPANI, a minor Shepherdess is found pregnant, Since this girl with intellectual disabilities has no idea what sex or pregnancy is, her powerful employer who wants to be the chairman of the village tries to bury the truth. Although Prabhu begins making efforts to sweep it under the carpet by conspiring to put the blame on Dalit schoolchildren, the local do-gooder Basu is determined to expose him. Adding to Prabhu’s “woes” is his younger brother Venkati’s romantic affair with the lowered-caste Malabari’s sister, Devaki.
films.cast: Dileesh Pothan, Achyut Kumar, Natesh Hegde
films.awardsWon: Cinemajove Valencia FF (Special Jury mention), Spirit of fire (Special Jury mention),  IFFSA Toronto (Best Actor).

films.title: TWO SEASONS, TWO STRANGERS
films.synopsis: In summer, Nagisa, a woman from the city, and Natsuo, a young man visiting his relatives, meet by the sea. Their vacant gazes reflect each other as they exchange awkward words and wade into the rain drenched ocean. In winter, Li, a screenwriter in a creative slump, travels to a snow-covered village with an old camera left behind by a late acquaintance. There, she finds a peculiar, desolate guesthouse run by the enigmatic Benzo. Their conversations rarely connect, yet they set off on an unexpected adventure.
films.cast: Shim Eun Kyung, Yuumi Kawai, Mansaku Takada, Shiro Sano, Shinichi Tsutsumi
films.awardsWon: Locarno Film Festival (Golden Leopard) IFFK (Best Film).
films.awardsNominated: Asia Pacific Screen Awards (Nominated- Best Film and Best Cinematography), Busan IFF (competition), Red Sea FF (competition).

films.title: A PREGNANT WIDOW
films.synopsis: Ambika, a young pregnant woman from a marginalized caste in Kerala, is left devastated when her husband Shibu, a village officer, dies by suicide after enduring relentless caste-based discrimination at his workplace. His struggle to secure a government job had been a rare achievement for their community, but the system denied him dignity. Left without support, Ambika applies for a job under Kerala compassionate appointment scheme. Forced to travel from Palakkad to Thiruvananthapuram, she encounters the same prejudice, apathy, and red tape that destroyed her husband. Humiliated, harassed, and repeatedly turned away, Ambika gathers the courage to confront the system. Yet justice remains distant, and survival becomes her only victory in a society unwilling to change.
films.cast: Twinkle Joby, Sivakumar, Ajeesh Krishna, Akhila, Thushara Pillai, Santhosh Kurup, Sajilal Nair
films.awardsNominated: IFFK, Chennai IFF, Vindhya IFF, 9th International Folklore FF.

films.title: A SHORT TRIP
films.synopsis: Far from the comfort of home, Balu and Stephy struggle to hold their lives together in a foreign land. Along with demanding jobs-memotional distance, and the relentless energy of their young son Jappu, who lives with ADHD, turn everyday routines into quiet battles. Their fragile balance is further unsettled when Ameer, a desperate job seeker on the brink of collapse, enters their world by chance. What begins as an accidental meeting slowly becomes a shared space of empathy, exhaustion, and unspoken understanding. Over the course of a single, emotionally charged day, suppressed frustrations surface and difficult choices loom. In the chaos of ordinary moments, small gestures reveal quiet kindness, exposing how brief encounters can leave lasting imprints on wounded lives
films.cast: Asif Ali, Divya Prabha, Deepak Parambol, Orhan, Alexander Prasanth, Remya Suresh, Shinz Shan, Ahamed Shaheen
films.awardsWon: IFFI 2025 (Special Jury Mention for Child Artist)
films.awardsNominated: IFFI 2025 (Indian Panorama), Melbourne (Golden Peacock), Jagran FF Mumbai, Chennai IFF, IFFK

films.title: CACTUS PEARS
films.synopsis: Anand, a 30 year old city dweller is compelled to spend a 10 days in mourning for his father's death in the rugged countryside of western India. Anand tenderly bonds with a local farmer who is profusely trying to stay unmarried. As the days pass, their intimacy blooms emotionally and physically. by the end of mourning period when he has to return back to his dailyhood, will their burgeoning bond survive beyond the days that has been spent together. Sabar Bonda explores the delicate bonds that develop under duress and the future of it.
films.sound: Anirban Borthakur, Naren Chandavarkar, Boloy Kumar Doloi, Rahul Karpe
films.cast: Bhushaan Manoj, Suraaj Suman, Jayshri Jagtap
films.awardsWon: Sundance (Grand Jury Prize in World Cinema Dramatic), SXSW London (Grand Jury Prize for Best Film), Asia Pacific Screen Awards (Young Cinema Award), IFFLA  (Audience Choice Award for Best Feature).
films.awardsNominated: Göteborg FF, New Directors/New Films MoMA, Dharamshala IFF, BAFICI, Las Palmas de Gran Canaria IFF, Taipei FF, MOOOV, Tokyo FILMeX

films.title: DESIRE
films.synopsis: Amala faces psychological challenges due to some bitter experiences in her life. Taking advantage of this, a young man named Shanu befriends her and involves her in crimes to escape the law and punishment.
films.screenplay: Fazil Razak, Mridul S, Amrutha Krishnakumar, Ishak Musafir
films.cast: Amrutha Krishnakumar, Ishak Musafir
films.awardsWon: FIPRESCI Award (Best Malayalam Film of a Debut Director)

films.title: GAMAN
films.synopsis: GAMAN is a Marathi feature film that explores migration and the emotional cost of leaving ones roots behind. An elderly couple from Konkan struggles to adjust to city life while staying with their sons in Mumbai. Their bond with two migrant siblings briefly fills the emotional void. As separation and loss follow, the film reflects on how future generations slowly lose their connection.
films.cast: Narayan Jadhav Shradha Khanolkar Dipak Harshika Melekar Sachin ValanjuKumar

films.title: GANARAAG
films.synopsis: Ojapali is a rare art form of Assam which is used by a political party for election campaign. During the campaign, the dead body of the senior lead performer of the troupe is discovered in a paddy field. Such incident frames a negative impact upon the use of Ojapali and they could find no alternative troupe. Then some female members, going against the rules laid down by the patriarchal society forms an Ojapali troupe and start campaigning with renewed vigour. But things turn out to be completely different.
films.cast: Barsha Bandita, Rajendra Nath, Pratibha Choudhury, Ankumoni Roy Saikia, Dilip Nath, Abhinab Hazarika

films.title: GONDHAL
films.synopsis: A young bride Suman who's suffocated in her marriager, uses her lover Sarjerao's obsession in Gondhal ritual and turns sacred tradition into a deadly chess match.
films.cast: Kishor Kadam, Ishita Deshmukh, Yogesh Sohani, Anuj Prabhu, Nishad Bhoir, Kailash Waghamare
films.awardsWon: Silver Peacock (Award For Best Director).
films.awardsNominated: IFFI, GOA 2025

films.title: HIDDEN TREMORS
films.synopsis: Set against the serene yet fragile landscape of Kanjirappally, as frequent landslides and subtle seismic shifts threaten both land and life, a quieter crisis unfolds within a family struggling to hold on to land, to memory, and to each other.
films.cast: Indrans, Thara, Kalabhavan Rahman, Manraj
films.awardsWon: Vancouver IFF (Best Audience Poll Award) Canada
films.awardsNominated: Vancouver IFF (World Premiere) Canada 2025

films.title: KAADU
films.synopsis: KAADU is a poignant tale of a tribal apothecary, Chaman, whose life is inseparable from the forest he inhabits. Living with his grandson Thaman, Chaman passes on ancestral wisdom, stories of coexistence, and the duty to protect nature. As climate threats and a government rehabilitation policy force villagers to leave, Chaman faces a final moral choice when a bird nests atop his relocation documents. Choosing the forest and its fragile life over displacement, Chaman walks back into the wilderness, affirming that the soil and its people are one.
films.cast: Kalan Mooppan, Sharmith Sarath, Santhosh Kizhattur

films.title: MALAVAZHI
films.synopsis: MALAVAZHI: The Man, the Mountain, and the Vanishing Gods. Amid Kerala’s misty hills, Malavazhi follows Manikyan, the last guardian of Parayan Kali, a dying ritual of the Paraya community. Clinging to Muniyattukunnu, a mountain desecrated by quarry mafias, he resists the slow death of faith, memory, and land. Torn between devotion and despair, Manikyan’s fight for the sacred becomes a struggle against greed, displacement, and silence itself. Malavazhi is a haunting meditation on heritage and loss, a lament for cultures fading beneath modernity’s weight.
films.cast: Devadasan cheravath, Siji Pradeep, Santha kumari, Guru Somasundaram, I M Vijayan, Praveen Narayanan, Rajesh Kurumali, Rajan poothrakkal, Pachu
films.awardsWon: Kashmir world IFF (Jury mention), Bollywood IFF, Asian talent IFF.
films.awardsNominated: Benin city FF (Nigeria), 9th international folklore FF 2026 (official selection)

films.title: OUR SCHOOL
films.synopsis: Gangya honestly reads an essay exposing his school’s broken classrooms and neglect, angering his teacher, who beats him and demands a rewritten version. Hoping his parents’ plan to migrate will change his life, Gangya skips school—but they leave silently without him. Abandoned, he returns to class and reads a safe, obedient essay, suppressing the truth. The teacher is pleased, and the system prevails.
films.cast: Shreeshil, Jahangir M S

films.title: PHOUOIBEE (THE GODDESS OF PADDY)
films.synopsis: A man running an old age home meets a mentally unstable man, later identified as Iboyaima from a remote village. On meeting his daughter and brother, he learns of their poverty and hope in sharecropping, praying to the PHOUOIBEE goddess for a better life. Their dreams shattered when unknown miscreants caused an incident that left Iboyaima mentally disabled, plunging the family into deeper hardship.
films.cast: Raju Nong, Y. Kumarjit, Ch. Inaobi, Loitongbam Dorendra, Bloomy Khwairakpam

films.title: THE CREATURE
films.synopsis: JEEV is a contemporary story based on the traditions of the tribal Konkani community. When the head of the Chaure family dies on the day of Holi, an old belief is followed. Until the departed soul returns as a new Jeev on the next Holi, the family and clan stop celebrating all festivals. This new life can return as a human, animal, or bird within the clan. The story follows Miru Chaure, who with his mother, wife, and son tries to bring this new life back to his home. Will the departed soul return and bring happiness back to the Chaure family
films.cast: Shivaji Shewale , Kiran Kakde , Adarsh Jadhav , Diksha Ujagare ,Bebitai Suryavanshi , Sameer Ramteke , Usha Nimbalkar , Ravindra Manik Jadhav and Others
films.awardsNominated: PIFF 2026

films.title: THE LOST PATH
films.synopsis: A local militant group from Northeast India assigned Longing to recruit member in a remote village. He meets School teacher who opposes their activities. The group orders longing to kill him. He loses faith and leaves them and plans to change the path but his dream never comes true.
films.cast: Harmony bey, Rajib Kro, Malin engtipi, Ranjit Teron, Dilip Bey, Rang Mukrang, Langkiram Kro,Rengka Engtipi, Gautam ingti
films.awardsWon: IFFK (Jury Special Mention).
films.awardsNominated: IFFK 2025.

films.title: WHITE SNOW
films.synopsis: With her yak Riri and an old cathodic TV, a mother journeys through the Kashmir Himalayan peaks to screen her sons banned film by fanatics and State, a path that breaks her body and mind but ultimately leads her to a profound, liberating freedom.
films.cast: Madhu Kandhari, Bhavya Khurana, Kachoo Ahmad Khan, Kaneez Fatima, Ghulam Mohmmad
films.awardsNominated: Sao Paulo IFF, 2025 (World Perspective), Jogja-NETPAC Asian FF (Asian Perspective), IFFI Goa, 2025 (UNESCO Gandhi Medal International Competition).

films.title: 4 BY 4
films.synopsis: 4 BY 4 is an evocative anthology film weaving together four powerful stories, each directed by a woman and brought to life by an all-women creative team. The film explores the emotional landscapes of women through narratives of love, loss, ambition, resilience, and transformation. From a mother’s quiet sacrifice that prompts reflection on identity and family, to journeys of self-discovery, betrayal, healing, and personal resolve, each story captures a distinct facet of the female experience. With intimate storytelling and compelling performances, the film presents a nuanced portrait of women navigating life’s defining moments, celebrating diverse voices across generations.
films.producer: Deepthi Murthy Iyer/ Stararama Fillum Productions Pvt Ltd
films.screenplay: Trupti Kulkarni, Meghana Jagannath, Chitra Parameswaran, Poojitha Prasad
films.cast: Dr. Sudharani Govardhan, Ranjani Raghavan, Lakshmi Gopalaswamy, Iti Acharya, Rajesh Nataranga, Chandan Sharma, Greeshma Shridhar, Vishal Nayar, Preetham MN, Siri Ravikumar, Harshil Kaushik
films.awardsWon: Boston Indie FF, World of Women Film Fair Middle East, Oakland FF, San Francisco Women FF.
films.awardsNominated: Istanbul International Spring FF, New York Film and Cinematography Awards, The Women's Bioscope.

films.title: AGNYATHAVASI
films.synopsis: The murder after 25 years in a sleepy Malnad town brings the life of the local investigating inspector into disarray and takes him back to the murder that happened in the very town 25 years ago.
films.cast: Rangayana Raghu, Paavana Gowda, Siddu Moolimani, Sharath Lohitashwa, Ravishankar Gowda

films.title: EMPTY PAGE
films.synopsis: Krishne Gowda, a former Indian soldier in his early stages of dementia, lives with his family yet remains emotionally unreachable. His wife, Swathi, struggles to hold the household together, while their only son, Sharath, is succumbed to digital isolation. A conflict ruptures the family, while having sent the boy away and missing Krishne Gowda. The story creates chilling curiosity as it reaches the culmination.
films.cast: Krishnegowda, Archana, Prabhakar, Hameed, Nagesh N, Poornima

films.title: HAKKIGHAGI
films.synopsis: After losing a friend, a group of children find joy in a new companion, only for him to be forced away by adults’ misunderstanding. Refusing to give up, the children support one another and try to bring their friend back, slowly changing the mindset of those around them. The film also reflects on environmental decay, health, education, and how sensitive truth-tellers are often ignored or suppressed.
films.cast: Nagaraj Neel, Padmashree Harekoppa, Sanvi G Bhat, Dr. Naganath V, Manjunath Byanad, Kumar H G, Dr. Nagesh

films.title: KANTARA A LEGEND CHAPTER-1
films.synopsis: During the Kadamba reign, a fictional feudal land King Vijayendra ruler of Bangras, on his venture to kantara meets his final fate in the mystical forest. On witnessing this, his son Rajashekara seals the borders. Later Prince Kulashekara reopens by killing them. Protagonist Berme seeking prosperity, crosses the divide sparking a clash of faith, power, destiny between the Kingdom and Nature.
films.screenplay: Rishab Shetty, Anirudh Mahesh, Shaneel Gautham
films.cast: Rishab Shetty, Jayaram, Rukmini Vasanth, Gulshan Devaiah, Pramod Shetty.

films.title: MIRAGE
films.synopsis: A happily living lady, whose only desire is to experience a special feeling she had felt in her childhood, is rescued from being arrested of homicide charges, only to find out that her rescuers are not who they seem to be. In order to save herself, she has to uncover the truth. This story is all about discovering her lost feeling of bliss amidst the drama that unfolds.
films.producer: Lelihana Films Private Limited, Vivinkumar M S
films.cast: Lahari Bharighat, R S Ganesh Narayana, Rohith H N
films.awardsWon: Special mention certificate in 15th Dada Saheb Phalke Film Festival.

films.title: OUR SCHOOL
films.synopsis: Gangya honestly reads an essay exposing his school’s broken classrooms and neglect, angering his teacher, who beats him and demands a rewritten version. Hoping his parents’ plan to migrate will change his life, Gangya skips school—but they leave silently without him. Abandoned, he returns to class and reads a safe, obedient essay, suppressing the truth. The teacher is pleased, and the system prevails.
films.cast: Shreeshil, Jahangir M S

films.title: RAVANA RAJYADALLI NAVADAMPATHIGALU
films.synopsis: RAVANA RAJYADALLI NAVADAMPATHIGALU is a Social Satirical drama set in the urban back drop of Bengaluru, in areas where middle class population is high. The story is about a newly married couple getting stuck into the clutches of the social system they live in and how are they going to fight it.
films.producer: Varun T G, M/S Green Chillis Studios
films.cast: Arun Surya, Nidhi Hegde

films.title: RUBY CUBE
films.synopsis: "RUBY CUBE is an intimate family drama set during a brief hill-station vacation where three generations reunite. Psychologist Rohini and her ex-husband Moorthy are brought together by their daughter Chitra, who faces her own marital struggles. As they share space, unresolved tensions and quiet affections surface, revealing the fragility of relationships. The Rubik’s Cube becomes a metaphor for life—complex, imperfect, and requiring patience rather than control."
films.cast: H G.Dattatreya, Vidyamurthy, Raadhya and Dev Devaiah

films.title: SRI JAGANNATHA DAASARU PART 2
films.synopsis: In the 17th century, Sri Srinivasacharya, a man of great learning, experiences severe stomach ache as he spreads false propaganda about Vijayadasa due to the pride of his scholarship. He was later saved from death by the grace of Gopaladasa and Vijayadasa. Following their instructions, he goes to Pandarpur, where, by divine blessing, he receives the Pen name "Jagannathavitthala" and continues his practice of Dasa Sankirtana.
films.screenplay: Dr. Madhusudhan Havaldar, J M Prahalad
films.cast: Sharat Joshi, Bharati Ramana Achar Mukundi, Sachin Purohit, Dr. Sudhendra, Vishnuteertha Joshi Gangavati, Suresh Kanikal(Haveri)

films.title: TO MY SACRED FATHER
films.synopsis: A popular travel vlogger, Prithvi, uncovers a dark secret about his own family. His search for the truth leads him to his estranged father, setting him on a journey of self-discovery. Does Prithvi find closure? Does his journey meet destiny?
films.cast: Nihar Mukesh, Rachana Inder, Sithara, Ravindra Vijay, Rajesh Nataranga, Ajith Hande, Ashwitha Hweg

films.title: VANYA
films.synopsis: Deep in a forest, Kariyappa, an old man, lives in harmony with the wilderness that has been his home for decades. His days are quiet with the jungle. He is a man forgotten by time. But when a project threatens to cut through the forest for legal reasons, officials arrive to convince or force Kariyappa to leave. What begins as a procedural eviction spiral into a complex psychological and moral conflict. The forest, almost a character itself, becomes a battleground between modernity and memory. The film explores how nature heals. By the time the final decision must be made another twist happens which no one ever expected.
films.producer: Ideaworks Motion Pictures - Badiger Devendra, Pallavi Ananth Poomagaame
films.cast: Vaijanath Biradar, Meghana Belawadi, Ashwin Hassan, Yeshwanth Kuchabal, Baby Dhatri
films.awardsNominated: IFFI Goa (Indian Panorama), Vindhya IFF, JIFF Jaipur.

films.title: X & Y
films.synopsis: An eager unborn soul, desperate to experience life, pleads with the Creator to send him to Earth. Tasked with a unique mission, he must find his future parents and ensure their union, only then can he be born. But once on Earth, the soul is met with harsh realities, unexpected struggles, and emotional turmoil. The vibrant world he once longed for turns out to be far more difficult than imagined. Disillusioned and weary, the soul begins to regret his decision, yearning to return to the Creator and vowing never to be born again.
films.cast: Satya Prakash D, Brinda Acharya, Atharva Prakash, Aayana, Sundar Veena, Harini, Veena Sundar, Doddanna

films.title: AMOEBA
films.synopsis: In Singapore, school dropout Choo returns to her elite all-girls Chinese school to join the graduating class. Her little acts of rebellion towards her tyrannical teachers attract the admiration of three other misfits, Vanessa, Gina and Sofia. She’s drawn to them too and confides about the ghost in her room. The new friends idea of using Sofia’s camcorder to evidence the ghost. The four form an inseparable group, and meet an unlikely kindred spirit, Sofia’s family driver, Uncle Phoon.
films.producer: Fran Borgia, Denis Vaslin, Antoine Simkine, Luisa Romeo, Han Sunhee.
films.cast: Ranice Tay, Nicole Lee, Lim Shi-An, Genevieve Tan, Jack Kao.
films.awardsWon: Pingyao IFF (Fei Mu Award for Best Actress, Youth Jury Award, Cinephilia Critics' Award).
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF (World Premiere - Discovery), Busan IFF (A Window on Asian Cinema).

films.title: FORASTERA
films.synopsis: During a sunlit summer in Mallorca, a family struggles with the loss of its matriarch. As grief settles into everyday life, teenage Cata begins to quietly assume her grandmother’s place within the household. Through small gestures and unspoken moments, she absorbs inherited memories and responsibilities. The film unfolds as a gentle, intimate debut that explores mourning, family bonds, and the subtle ways absence reshapes identity, revealing how echoes of those we lose continue to live on in unexpected forms.
films.producer: Tono Folguera, Ariadna Dot, Cesc Mulet, Bàrbara Ferrer, Giovanni Pompili, Olivier Guerpillon, Marta Reguera, Marta Cruañas Compés
films.sound: Nora Haddad, Ulrika Akander, Therese Gylfe, Tove Lidman
films.cast: Zoe Stein, Lluis Homar, Núria Prims, Nonni Ardal, Martina García
films.awardsWon: Toronto IFF (FIPRESCI Award), Valladolid IFF (Best First Feature Award)
films.awardsNominated: Tallinn Black Nights FF (Official Screening), Panorama of European Cinema Athens FF (Official Selection), Vancouver New Spanish Cinema FF (Official Selection)

films.title: LITTLE TROUBLE GIRLS
films.synopsis: Introverted Lucia joins her Catholic school’s all-girls choir, where she befriends a popular older student. But the choir’s weekend trip to a countryside convent tests this friendship and Lucia’s beliefs. As the strict rules of the environment close in, her body begins to awaken.
films.cast: Jara Sofija Ostan, Mina Svajger, Sasa Tabakovic
films.awardsWon: Berlin IFF (FIPRESCI), Tribeca FF (Best Cinematography), Transilvania IFF (Youth Award), IFFI (Best Actor), Jerusalem FF (Best International Debut)
films.awardsNominated: Karlovy Vary IFF (Horizons), Nashville FF (Grand Jury Prize)

films.title: OUT OF LOVE
films.synopsis: After several years, Suzanne unexpectedly shows up at her sister Jeanne's house in a little French town with her two kids. At first glance, it appears like Suzanne is hesitantly trying to get back in touch with her sister. But the morning light shatters this illusion.
films.sound: Laurent Benaim, Alexandre Hecker, Laure Anne Darras, Olivier Guillaume
films.cast: Camille Cottin, Juliette Armanet, Monia Chokri, Féodor Atkine, Myriem Akheddiou, Guillaume Gouix
films.awardsWon: Karlovy Vary IFF (Best Director Award, FIPRESCI Prize)
films.awardsNominated: Geneva IFF (Official Selection), Film Francophone d'Angoulême (Official Competition), Karlovy Vary IFF (Crystal Globe)

films.title: SILENT FRIEND
films.synopsis: In a botanical garden in a medieval German university town stands a majestic ginkgo tree, silent witness to more than a century of change. In 2020, a neuroscientist from Hong Kong studying babies’ minds begins an unexpected experiment with the tree. In 1972, a student is transformed by observing a single geranium. In 1908, the university’s first female student photographs humble plants, revealing hidden cosmic patterns. Each, awkwardly rooted in their own present, reaches out to nature and is quietly altered by it. The ancient ginkgo draws us closer to what it means to be human and to belong.
films.producer: Reinhard Brundig, Monika Mécs, Nicolas Elghozi, Morgane Olivier, MengXie
films.cast: Tony Leung Chiu-wai, Luna Wedler, Enzo Brumm, Sylvester Groth, Martin Wuttke, Johannes Hegemann, Rainer Bock, Léa Seydoux
films.awardsWon: Venice FF (Competition - FIPRESCI Prize, Green Drop Award, CinemaSara Award), Interfilm Award for Promer Promoting Interreligious Dialogue, Chicago IFF (Silver Hugo - Best Cinematography), Valladolid IFF (Silver Spike - Best Film, Green Spike - Best Film ), Lisbon FF (LEFFEST) (Jury Award - Honourable Mention), La Roche-sur-Yon IFF (Compétition Internationale - Grand Prix du Jury)
films.awardsNominated: Venice FF (Golden Lion - Best Film), Chicago IFF (Gold Hugo - Best Feature), Valladolid IFF (Spike - Best Film), Lisbon FF (Best Film Award - Official Competition), Haifa IFF (Carmel International Competition - Best Film, Toronto IFF (Special Presentations), São Paulo IFF (Perspectiva Internacional)

films.title: SUNDAYS
films.synopsis: Ainara, a brilliant and idealistic young woman, faces a pivotal decision about her future. While her family expects her to choose a university and pursue a conventional career, Ainara feels uncertain. As her friends dive into the freedoms and emotions of adolescence, love, parties, self-discovery, she finds herself drawn elsewhere. A quiet spark within her pulls toward the contemplative life of a convent. This unexpected calling challenges everything her family envisions for her, threatening to unsettle the delicate balance of their shared hopes and expectations.
films.producer: Marisa Fernández Armenteros, Sandra Hermida, Nahikari Ipiña, Manu Calvo
films.cast: Blanca Soroa, Patricia López Arnaiz, Miguel Garcés, Juan Minujín, Mabel Rivera, Nagore Aranburu
films.awardsWon: San Sebastián IFF (Best Film, SIGNIS Award, FIPRESCI Prize), José María Forqué Awards (Best Picture, Best Actress)
films.awardsNominated: Feroz Awards, ES (Best Director, Best Screenplay), Premios Carmen (Best Non-Andalusian Feature Film)

films.title: THE PRESIDENT'S CAKE
films.synopsis: While people across 1990s Iraq struggle to survive the war and food shortages, Saddam Hussein requires each school in the country to prepare a cake to celebrate his birthday. Despite her efforts to avoid getting picked, 9-year-old Lamia is chosen among her classmates. The young girl must now use her wits and imagination to gather ingredients for the mandatory cake or face the consequences.
films.cast: Baneen Ahmed Nayyef, Sajad Mohamad Qasem, Waheeda Thabet Khreibat, Rahim AlHaj
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Caméra d'or), São Paulo IFF, Stockholm IFF (Best Debut), Pingyao Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon IFF (Crouching Tigers - Best Film), Bucharest IFF (Grand Prize - Best Cinematography)
films.awardsNominated: Asia Pacific Screen Awards (Best Youth Film), San Sebastián IFF (Official Selection), Vancouver IFF (Feature Films Selection), Busan IFF(A Window on Asian Cinema)

films.title: TO THE WEST, IN ZAPATA
films.synopsis: Landi and Mercedes are a married couple living in the harsh marshlands of Zapata, one of Cuba’s most unforgiving regions. As the pandemic deepens, with shortages and social unrest, daily survival becomes a test of endurance. Driven by love for their son, they are pushed to extreme choices to secure his future.
films.cast: Orlando “Landi” García, Mercedes Morejón, Deinis
films.awardsWon: Visions du Réel (FIPRESCI Award, Special Jury Award), Munich FF(CineVision Award), Hamptons IFF (Jury Award for Best Documentary)
films.awardsNominated: Gijon IFF (Albar International Competition)

films.title: A LIGHT THAT NEVER GOES OUT
films.synopsis: After a breakdown, Pauli, a classically trained flute player, returns to his small Finnish hometown to recover at his parents’ house. Unable to play, he wrestles with failure and silence. He reconnects with Iiris, an old classmate who creates experimental music alone. Drawn to her unruly energy, Pauli begins making music again through strange, imperfect collaborations. As past pressures return, he must choose between control and freedom, and decide what kind of artist and person he wants to become.
films.kannadaTitle: ಅ ಲೈಟ್  ದಟ್  ನೆವರ್  ಗೋಸ್  ಔಟ್
films.cast: Samuel Kujala, Anna Rosaliina Kauno, Camille Auer, Kaisa-Leena Koskenkorva
films.awardsNominated: São Paulo IFF (Official Selection - New Director Competition), Leiden IFF (Official Selection - First Feature Competition), ACID Cannes (Official Selection)

films.title: A POET
films.synopsis: Oscar Restrepo’s obsession with poetry brought him no glory. Aging and erratic, he has succumbed to the cliché of the poet in the shadows. Meeting Yurlady, a teenage girl from humble roots, and helping her cultivate her talent brings some light to his days, but dragging her into the world of poets may not be the way.
films.producer: Juan Sarmiento G., Manuel Ruiz Montealegre, Simón Mesa Soto
films.cast: Ubeimar Rios, Rebeca Andrade, Guillermo Cardona, Allison Correa, Margarita Soto, Humberto Restrepo
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Un Certain Regard - Jury Prize), Melbourne IFF (Bright Horizons Award), San Sebastián IFF (Horizontes Make & Mark Award)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Un Certain Regard), Hamptons IFF (Best International Film), Bergen IFF (Cinema Extraordinaire), Montclair FF (Fiction Feature Competition), Toronto IFF (Special Presentations), Tallinn Black Nights FF (Best of Festivals)

films.title: A SAD AND BEAUTIFUL WORLD
films.synopsis: In this sweeping love story that spans three decades of passion, heartbreak, and hope, Nino and Yasmina find themselves drawn together by a magnetic relationship. As they face an impossible choice between love and survival, they must decide if they want to build a family and chart a path to happiness in Lebanon, despite the tragedies ravaging the country.
films.producer: Georges Schoucair, Jennifer Goyne Blake, April Shih, Georg Neubert, Jasper Wiedhöft
films.sound: Rana Eid, Lama Sawaya, Bassam Lebbos
films.cast: Mounia Akl, Hasan Akil, Julia Kassar, Camille Salameh, Tino Karam, Nadyn Chalhoub
films.awardsWon: Venice FF (People's Choice Award), Valladolid IFF (Meeting Point Section - Feature Film)
films.awardsNominated: São Paulo IFF (International Perspective), BFI London (Thematic Strand - “Love”)

films.title: A USEFUL GHOST
films.synopsis: March is mourning his wife Nat who has recently passed away due to dust pollution. He discovers her spirit has returned by possessing a vacuum cleaner. Disturbed by a ghost that appeared after a worker's death shut down their factory, his family reject their unconventional human-ghost relationship. Trying to convince them of their love, Nat offers to cleanse the factory. To become a useful ghost, she must first get rid of the useless ones.
films.cast: Davika Hoorne, Witsarut Himmarat, Apasiri Nitibhon
films.awardsWon: Cannes Critics Weeks (Grand Prize), SITGES (Citizen Kane Award & Best Screenplay)
films.awardsNominated: Warsaw IFF (Official Selection), Busan FF (A Window on Asian Cinema), BFI London FF (Official Selection), Melbourne IFF (Official Screening)

films.title: AMRUM
films.synopsis: Spring 1945, Amrum Island. In order to assist his mother provide for the family during the last days of the war, 12-year-old Nanning works the local farm, goes fishing at night, and braves the risky sea to hunt seals. Life on the stunning, windswept island feels almost like heaven despite the challenges. However, a greater threat is revealed when peace eventually arrives, the adversary is much closer than he had anticipated.
films.cast: Jasper Billerbeck, Laura Tonke, Lisa Hagmeister, Kian Köppke, Lars Jessen, Detlev Buck
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Official Selection), AFI Fest (Official Selection), Vancouver Turkish FF (Official Selection)

films.title: AS WE BREATHE
films.synopsis: In the early 2000s, in a small Anatolian town, ten-year-old Esma watches her world slowly fall apart after a factory explosion triggers a fire that never seems to end. As smoke spreads across the land and her family struggles to get by, daily life becomes uncertain and fragile. Caught between fear and innocence, Esma clings to her childhood, finding quiet strength in small moments. AS WE BREATHE is a sensitive coming-of-age story about growing up amid unseen catastrophe, resilience, and the stubborn persistence of hope.
films.producer: Fevziye Hazal Yazan, Seyhmus Altun, Johanna Sveinsdottir
films.cast: Defne Zeynep Enci, Hakan Karsak, Sacide Taşaner, Rüzgar Usta, Aras Kavak, Deniz Kavak
films.awardsWon: Cairo IFF (Bronze Pyramid)
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF (World Premier), San Sebastián IFF (Official Selection)

films.title: BEACHCOMBER
films.synopsis: Elias dreams of building a boat from scrap metal, chasing the shadow of his sailor father's legacy. But as his creation crumbles, so does the myth he's built around himself, forcing him to confront the fragile truth of who he really is.
films.cast: Christos Passalis, Aliki Andriomenou, Stathis Kokkoris, Sotiris Belsis, Lefteris Polychronis, Eleni Karageorgis, Gioula Bountali
films.awardsWon: Thessaloniki FF (Artistic Achievement Award, Silver Alexander)
films.awardsNominated: Thessaloniki FF (Golden Alexander), Buenos Aires International Festival of Independent Cinema (Best Film).

films.title: BEFORE THE BODY
films.synopsis: Ana and her two kids live in the anonimity of the suburbs. She cares for sick people to earn a living; but her little daughter requires a lot more, so much so that it puts their delicate life at risk.
films.producer: Paula Mastellone, Miguel Angel Mazza, Sergio Mazza
films.cast: Mónica Antonópulos, Patricio Contreras, Bianca Pujía Levy, Nayaraq Guevara Páez
films.awardsWon: La Mujer y el Cine (Best Cinematography), Puerto Madryn IFF (AsAECA Prize - Best Feature Film), Espanto Film Fest (Best International Feature)
films.awardsNominated: BAFICI (World Premiere), Cine Las Americas (North American Premiere)

films.title: BELÉN
films.synopsis: Belén is inspired by a true case that ignited an international movement. In conservative Argentina, Julieta is falsely accused of infanticide, until lawyer Soledad Deza bravely challenges a corrupt, classist, patriarchal justice system. Her fight sparks nationwide outrage and solidarity, transforming a personal tragedy into a powerful struggle for women’s rights, based on Somos Belén by Ana Correa.
films.screenplay: Dolores Fonzi, Laura Paredes, Agustina San Martín, Nicolás Britos
films.cast: Dolores Fonzi, Camila Plaate, Laura Paredes, Julieta Cardinali, Luis Machín, César Troncoso, Sergio Prina, Liliana Juárez, Ruth Plaate, Gaia Garibaldi
films.awardsWon: San Sebastián IFF (Silver Shell for Best Supporting Performance, RTVE Otra Mirada Special Mention), Biarritz Amérique Latine Festival (Audience Award)
films.awardsNominated: San Sebastián IFF (Golden Shell), Mar del Plata IFF (Official Selection), Chicago IFF (Official Selection), Rio de Janeiro IFF (Official Selection), Critics' Choice Awards (Best Foreign Language Film), Rome FF (Special Screening), Leiden IFF (Official Selection)

films.title: BETTER GO MAD IN THE WILD
films.synopsis: Franta and Ondra are inseparable twins, living away from civilization in the deep bosom of nature. Their daily routine, permeated with peace and harmony with the surrounding world, begins to crack under the pressure of internal contradictions. Franta longs for freedom, change and adventure, while Ondra clings to the safety of immutability. However, their dual existence breaks like a mirror, the same appearance, different desires. In the silent embrace of nature, a fragile drama of separation, reconciliation, and perhaps even reunion takes place. A magical story about what remains when what held us together begins to disappear.
films.kannadaTitle: ಬೆಟರ್ ಗೋ ಮ್ಯಾಡ್ ಇನ್ ದ ವೈಲ್ಡ್
films.cast: František Klišík, Ondřej Klišík
films.awardsWon: Karlovy Vary IFF (Crystal Globe for Best Film)
films.awardsNominated: IFFI (Official Selection), Cork IFF (Official Selection), São Paulo IFF (International Perspective)

films.title: BLUE HERON
films.synopsis: A family of six moves to Vancouver Island in the late 1990s, and Sasha, the youngest kid, gradually reveals underlying dynamics. The family's eldest child, Jeremy, interferes with their new beginning with his increasingly risky behavior.
films.producer: Ryan Bobkin, Sara Wylie, Sophy Romvari, Gábor Osváth
films.cast: Eylul Guven, Amy Zimmer, Iringó Réti, Adam Tompa, Edik Beddoes, Liam Serg, Preston Drabble
films.awardsWon: Locarno FF (Best First Feature Award, Junior Jury Award Special Mention), Toronto IFF (Best Canadian Discovery Award), Vancouver IFF (Horizon Award – Best Narrative Feature), FF Gent (Explore Award)
films.awardsNominated: Locarno FF (World Premiere), TIFF (Centrepiece), Vancouver IFF (Horizons), San Sebastián IFF (Zabaltegi-Tabakalera), FF Gent (Official Selection)

films.title: BROKEN VOICES
films.synopsis: In early 1990’s Czech Republic, 13-year-old Karolína earns a place in a worldfamous girls’ choir, joining her older sister and other driven young talents. Her voice soon catches the attention of the admired and enigmatic choirmaster Macha. Being singled out feels like a triumph, until she begins to understand the unsettling price of that privilege. Inspired by the Bambini di Praga case, the film explores the fragile line where innocence collides with abusive power.
films.cast: Kateřina Falbrová, Juraj Loj, Maya Kintera, Zuzana Šulajová, Marek Cisovský, Ivana Wojtylová, Anna Michalcová, Anežka Novotná, Markéta Kühnová
films.awardsWon: Karlovy Vary IFF (Europa Cinemas Label Award), Oldenburg FF (German Independence Award for Best Film)
films.awardsNominated: Vancouver IFF (Panorama), Warsaw IFF (Official Competition)

films.title: CARAVAN
films.synopsis: Ester, 45, has built her entire life around caring for her son David, who has Down syndrome and autism. Their bond is deep, but years of responsibility have left her drained. While visiting friends in Italy, David’s behavior creates tension, and they are asked to sleep in a caravan. That night, Ester drives away. As they travel through southern Italy in the old camper, Ester begins to imagine a different life. Meanwhile, David slowly opens up to the world and to Zuza, a free-spirited drifter who joins them. Together, they discover connection, balance, and a fragile sense of freedom.
films.screenplay: Zuzana Kirchnerová, Tomáš Bojar, Kristina Májová
films.sound: Martin Ženíšek, Michal Deliopulos, Klára Javoříková
films.cast: Aňa Geislerová, David Vodstrcil, Juliana Brutovska Ol’hová
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Un Certain Regard), Karlovy Vary FF (Official Selection), Warsaw FF (Competition 1-2), Bangkok FF (Official Selection), São Paulo IFF (Official Selection), Stockholm IFF (Official Selection)

films.title: CASE 137
films.synopsis: Stéphanie, a police officer working for Internal Affairs, is assigned to a case involving a young man severely wounded during a tense and chaotic demonstration in Paris. While she finds no evidence of illegitimate police violence, the case takes a personal turn when she discovers the victim is from her hometown.
films.cast: Léa Drucker, Yoann Blanc, Guslagie Malanda
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Palme d'Or), AFI Fest (Official Selection), Warsaw IFF (Audience Award), Pingyao IFF (People's Choice Award - Gala -Best Film)

films.title: CATANE
films.synopsis: In a remote Romanian village, an unusually high number of residents receive disability aid, leading social services to send inspectors to investigate. The village seems almost like a storybook place, where each person has a different disability but continues daily life with determination and humor. Moved by what they see, the inspectors help secure more financial support for the community. However, when they return to collect missing documents, they discover that the village is not as simple or honest as it first appeared, and a hidden reality slowly comes to light.
films.producer: Ioana Mischie, Sorin Baican, Ilaria Malagutti
films.cast: Mihai Malaimare, Costel Cascaval, Iulia Lumanare, Cristian Bota, Mihai Dinvale, Nelu Serghei, Corneliu Ulici, Flavia Hojda, Pavel Ulici, Liana Margineanu, Ioana Abur
films.awardsNominated: Hollywood Music In Media Award (Nomintion: Best Independent Film)

films.title: CHRISTY
films.synopsis: Christy, seventeen, is forced to move in with his estranged older half-brother after being thrown out of his suburban foster home. While his brother sees the arrangement as temporary, Christy begins to feel at home on Cork's working-class Northside, making friends and reconnecting with his past through his seemingly more corrupting extended family. Determined to give Christy a better future, his brother faces tough choices that could drive a wedge between them. After so many years apart, the brothers need to now reconcile their turbulent past whilst deciding what the future looks like.
films.producer: Rory Gilmartin, Meredith Duff, Marina Brackenbury.
films.cast: Danny Power, Diarmuid Noyes, Emma Willis.
films.awardsWon: Berlin IFF (Grand Prix of the Generation 14plus International Jury), Galway Film Fleadh (Best Irish Film)
films.awardsNominated: Berlin IFF (Opening Film), Norwegian IFF (Main Programme)

films.title: CLOISTERED SISTER
films.synopsis: The film follows Stela, a 36 year old educated woman unable to find stability in work or life. Since childhood she has idolized a famous Serbian musician, a Balkan superstar. Vera, a minor celebrity, promises to help Stela meet him and brings her from rural poverty to Bucharest, where she runs a small business. Set between Romania’s EU boom and the financial crisis, their plans collapse when Vera’s company fails. Working as a servant in Vera’s home, Stela finally meets her idol, only to discover he is far from the idealized figure she imagined.
films.screenplay: Ivana Mladenović, Adrian Schiop, Momir Milošević
films.cast: Katia Pascariu, Cendana Trifan, Miodrag Mladenović
films.awardsWon: Sarajevo FF (Best Director), Locarno FF (Boccalino d'Oro Award for Best Actress), Gijón IFF (Special Mention, CIMA Award for Best Feature Film Directed by a Woman)
films.awardsNominated: DocLisboa IFF (Riscos New Visions), Gijón International FF (Best Film), Locarno FF (Best Film)

films.title: COMANDANTE FRITZ
films.synopsis: In 1972, young East German officer Fritz arrives in Cuba during the ceremonial transfer of Isla Ernesto Thälmann, a symbolic gift from Fidel Castro to the GDR. Tasked with preventing a CIA assassination attempt, Fritz quickly finds himself disoriented by the unfamiliar rhythm of the island and the limits of his training. When he meets the enigmatic Lola, his rigid sense of duty begins to soften. As politics, desire, and confusion intertwine, Fritz confronts the fragile line between ideology and humanity under a foreign sun.
films.cast: Yany Prado, Dennis Mojen, Alexis Valdés, Christina Große, Vladimir Cruz
films.awardsNominated: Munich FF (CineCoPro Competition), São Paulo IFF (International Perspective)

films.title: DE TAL PALO
films.synopsis: De Tal Palo follows Don Manuel, a retired grandfather whose quiet life is upended when he gains legal custody of his nine-year-old granddaughter, Irene, after her mother is violently assaulted by her husband. Thrown into an unexpected role, Manuel struggles to adapt, yet gradually forms a tender and resilient bond with Irene. As they learn to become a family, he also begins to show the early signs of a troubling health condition, adding urgency and emotional depth to their journey.
films.sound: Denes Pagán, Carlos J. Dávila Reverón
films.cast: José Félix Gómez , Milena E. Soltero
films.awardsNominated: IFFI (Official Selection)

films.title: DEAD DOG
films.synopsis: On a rainy night, Aida retreats to a secluded family house in the Lebanese mountains, seeking distance and clarity. Her quiet solitude is disrupted by the sudden arrival of her husband Walid, who has been living abroad for years and did not expect to find her there. Over the next four days, the couple is forced into an intimate reunion marked by silence, tension, and unresolved questions. As they cautiously circle each other, memories and resentments surface, revealing a marriage suspended between endurance and collapse, and raising the question of whether anything can still be saved.
films.cast: Chirine Karameh, Nida Wakim
films.awardsWon: Cairo IFF (Best Arabic Film)
films.awardsNominated: IFF Rotterdam (World Premiere)

films.title: DIVINE COMEDY
films.synopsis: Bahram is a 40-year-old filmmaker who’s spent his entire career making films in Turkish-Azeri, none of which have ever been screened in Iran. His latest work, once again denied permission by the Ministry of culture, pushes him to the edge of defiance. With his sharp-tongued, Vespa-riding producer Sadaf by his side, he embarks on an underground mission to showcase his film to an Iranian audience, dodging government censors, absurd bureaucracy, and his own self-doubts.
films.kannadaTitle:
Bahram is a 40-year-old filmmaker who’s spent his entire career making films in Turkish-Azeri, none of which have ever been screened in Iran. His latest work, once again denied permission by the Ministry of culture, pushes him to the edge of defiance. With his sharp-tongued, Vespa-riding producer Sadaf by his side, he embarks on an underground mission to showcase his film to an Iranian audience, dodging government censors, absurd bureaucracy, and his own self-doubts.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಬಹ್ರಾಮ್ 40 ವರ್ಷದ ಒಬ್ಬ ಚಲನಚಿತ್ರ ನಿರ್ದೇಶಕ. ಅವನು ತನ್ನ ಇಡೀ ವೃತ್ತಿಜೀವನದಲ್ಲಿ ಟರ್ಕಿಶ್-ಅಜೆರಿ ಭಾಷೆಯಲ್ಲೇ ಸಿನಿಮಾಗಳನ್ನು ಮಾಡಿದ್ದಾನೆ. ಅವುಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ಒಂದೂ ಇರಾನ್‌ನಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರದರ್ಶನಗೊಂಡಿಲ್ಲ. ಅವನ ಇತ್ತೀಚಿನ ಸಿನಿಮಾಕ್ಕೂ ಸಾಂಸ್ಕೃತಿಕ ಸಚಿವಾಲಯ ಪ್ರದರ್ಶನದ ಅನುಮತಿ ನಿರಾಕರಿಸಿದಾಗ, ಅವನು ವ್ಯವಸ್ಥೆಯ ವಿರುದ್ಧ ಬಂಡೇಳಲು ನಿರ್ಧರಿಸುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಚುರುಕು ಮಾತಿನ, ವೆಸ್ಪಾ ಸ್ಕೂಟರ್ ಓಡಿಸುವ ನಿರ್ಮಾಪಕಿ ಸದಾಫ್ ಜೊತೆಗೂಡಿ, ಬಹ್ರಾಮ್ ತನ್ನ ಚಿತ್ರವನ್ನು ಇರಾನಿನ ಪ್ರೇಕ್ಷಕರಿಗೆ ತೋರಿಸಲು ಒಂದು ರಹಸ್ಯ ಕಾರ್ಯಾಚರಣೆ ಕೈಗೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಈ ಹಾದಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ಅವನು ಸರ್ಕಾರದ ಸೆನ್ಸಾರ್ ಮಂಡಳಿ, ಅರ್ಥಹೀನ ಅಧಿಕಾರಶಾಹಿ ಮತ್ತು ತನ್ನದೇ ಆದ ಆತ್ಮಸಂದೇಹಗಳನ್ನು ಎದುರಿಸಿ ಸಾಗಬೇಕಾಗುತ್ತದೆ.
films.producer: Milad Khosravi, Ali Asgari, Hasan Köroğlu, Lorenzo Cioffi, Giorgio Giampà, Avantika Singh Desbouvries, Solmaz Azizi, Lasse Scharpen, Raha Raz.
films.screenplay: Alireza Khatami, Bahram Ark, Bahman Ark, Ali Asgari
films.cast: Bahram Ark, Sadaf Asgari, Hossein Soleimani, Bahman Ark, Mohammad Soori, Amirreza Ranjbaran, Faezeh Rad
films.awardsNominated: Venice FF (Official Selection - Orizzonti), AFI Fest (World Cinema), Tallinn Black Nights FF (Screen International Critics’ Choice)

films.title: DJ AHMET
films.synopsis: Ahmet, a 15 year old boy from a remote Yuruk village in North Macedonia, finds refuge in music while navigating his father’s expectations, a conservative community, and his first experience with love, a girl already promised to someone else.
films.sound: Miroslav Červená Chaloupka, Ludvik K. Bohadlo
films.cast: Arif Jakup, Agush Agushev, Dora Akan Zlatanova, Aksel Mehmet, Selpin Kerim, Atila Klince
films.awardsWon: Sundance FF (Audience Award, Special Jury Award for Creative Vision), São Paulo IFF (Special Jury Prize), Seattle IFF (New Directors Competition, Special Jury Mention)
films.awardsNominated: Stockholm IFF (Stockholm Competition), Ghent FF (Official Selection), Sydney FF (Official Selection), Tallinn Black Nights FF (Official Screenings), Haifa IFF (Panorama)

films.title: DRAGONFLY
films.synopsis: DRAGONFLY tells the story of an unlikely bond between two neighbours. Colleen, adrift and searching for purpose, becomes increasingly concerned by the neglect faced by her elderly neighbour, Elsie. Frustrated by the indifference of professionals meant to care for her, Colleen steps in, offering companionship, attention, and a sense of dignity that Elsie has been denied. What begins as an act of kindness slowly deepens into dependency, raising questions about control, intention, and responsibility. As Colleen’s motivations are challenged, tensions escalate toward a tragic and devastating conclusion. The film is a tense, intimate exploration of care, loneliness, and moral uncertainty.
films.cast: Andrea Riseborough, Brenda Blethyn, Jason Watkins
films.awardsWon: Cairo IFF (Best Film - Golden Pyramid)
films.awardsNominated: Tribeca FF (Best International Narrative Feature)

films.title: DREAMS
films.synopsis: Johanne falls in love for the first time, with her teacher. To preserve her feelings, she documents her emotions and experiences in writing. When her mother and grandmother read what she has written, they are initially shocked by its intimate content but soon see that it has literary potential. As they debate whether to publish it, Johanne navigates the gap between her romantic fantasy and reality, and all three women confront their differing views on love, sexuality, and self-discovery.
films.cast: Ella Øverbye, Selome Emnetu, Ane Dahl Torp, Anne Marit Jacobsen
films.awardsWon: Berlin IFF (Golden bear-Best film, FIPRESCI Prize, Guild Film Prize). Amanda Awards (Best Editing)
films.awardsNominated: Amanda Awards (Best Film, Best Actor in a Leading Role), Karlovy Vary IFF (Horizons), Busan IFF (Icon)

films.title: DRY LEAF
films.synopsis: Sports photographer Lisa disappears without explanation, leaving a letter asking not to be searched for. Her last traces lead to remote Georgian villages where she was photographing rural football fields. Her father Irakli refuses to accept the silence she leaves behind and begins a journey to find her. Joined by Levani, Lisa’s enigmatic closest friend, he travels across the countryside, passing through quiet villages and meeting strangers and children playing football. They uncover only fleeting signs of Lisa’s presence, each more elusive than the last, until a mysterious encounter offers one fragile clue and renewed hope for the future ahead.
films.producer: Mariam Shatberashvili, Luise Hauschild, Alexandre Koberidze
films.cast: David Koberidze, Irina Chelidze, Giorgi Bochorishvili, Vakhtang Fanchulidze, Otar Nijaradze
films.awardsWon: Locarno IFF (FIPRESCI Prize, Special Mention: International Competition)
films.awardsNominated: Locarno IFF (Golden Leopard Best Film), Tallinn Black Nights FF (International Perspective), Busan IFF (World Cinema), São Paulo IFF (International Perspective), Toronto IFF (Wavelengths), Chicago IFF (Snapshots), Viennale (Features), Thessaloniki IFF (Survey Expanded: Fragilities)

films.title: FATHER
films.synopsis: A tragic mistake shatters the life of a devoted father, shaking his marriage and isolating him in guilt. As the threat of prison looms, he begins to question whether he deserves to go on living. But when he and his wife come to see that the tragedy was not a personal failure, but something rooted deep in the architecture of the human mind, a fragile path toward forgiveness begins to emerge. Even with this understanding, the question remains: can love survive what no heart was built to endure?
films.producer: Veronika Paštéková, Anton Skreko, Karel Chvojka,  Miloš Lochman, Marta Gmosińska, Mariusz Włodarski
films.cast: Milan Ondrík, Dominika Morávková, Dominika Zajcz, Martina Sľúková, Aňa Geislerová, Peter Ondrejička, Peter Bebjak, Ingrid Timková, Roman Polák
films.awardsWon: Zurich FF (Best International Feature Film), Stockholm FF (Best Film, Best Screenplay)
films.awardsNominated: Warsaw IFF (Grand Prix), Venice FF (Official Selection: Orizzonti), Vancouver IFF (Official Selection)

films.title: FATHER MOTHER SISTER BROTHER
films.synopsis: FATHER MOTHER SISTER BROTHER is a feature film, though carefully constructed in the form of a triptych. All three stories concern the relationships between adult children, their somewhat distant parent (or parents), and each other. Each of the three chapters takes place in the present, and each in a different country. FATHER is set in the Northeast US, MOTHER in Dublin, Ireland, and SISTER BROTHER in Paris, France. The film is a series of character studies, quiet, observational and non-judgmental – a comedy, but interwoven with threads of melancholy.
films.producer: Joshua Astrachan, Carter Logan, Atilla Salih Yücer, Charles Gillibert, Richard Bolger
films.cast: Tom Waits, Adam Driver, Mayim Bialik, Charlotte Rampling, Cate Blanchett, Vicky Krieps, Sarah Greene, Indya Moore, Luka Sabbat, Françoise Lebrun.
films.awardsWon: Venice IFF (Golden Lion), National Board of Review Awards (Top 10 Independent Films)
films.awardsNominated: New York FF (Centerpiece Selection) , BFI London FF (Official Selection), AFI Fest (Official Selection), IFFI (Official Selection), Gotham Independent Film Awards (Outstanding Supporting Performance), Thessaloniki IFF (Opening Film)

films.title: FIUME O MORTE!
films.synopsis: Under the command of the colorful, war-loving Italian author Gabriele D'Annunzio, a group of about three hundred men stormed the Northern Adriatic port town of Fiume, which is now Rijeka (Croatia), on September 12, 1919, with the intention of annexing the city to Italy. His official photography crew took almost 10,000 pictures during what is considered one of the most strange militant sieges in history over the course of the following 16 months.
films.producer: Vanja Jambrovic, Tibor Keser, Erica Barbiani, Lucia Candelpergher, Marina Gumzi
films.sound: Eric Guerrino Nardin, Ana Jurčić, Andrea Blasetig
films.cast: Izet Medošević, Ćenan Beljulji, Albano Vučetić, Tihomir Buterin, Andrea Marsanich, Massimo Ronzani, Milovan Večerina Cico
films.awardsWon: IFF Rotterdam (Tiger Award, FIPRESCI)
films.awardsNominated: San Sebastian FF (Zabaltegi - Tabakalera), Tallinn Black Nights FF (Best of Docs), Melbourne IFF (Screening), Vancouver IFF (Screening)

films.title: FOLLIES
films.synopsis: This film traces a couple’s first steps into polyamory. After sixteen years together and raising two children, they decide to open their relationship. Over several months, we follow their experiments with different forms of non-monogamy, told across six chapters. As new relationships emerge, their long-standing bond begins to shift, exposing tensions, desires, and doubts. The film observes how love changes under pressure, and whether what they have built can survive this transformation.
films.producer: Hany Ouichou, Laurie Pominville, Eric K. Boulianne
films.sound: Laurent Ouellette, Samuel Gagnon-Thibodeau, Sylvain Brassard
films.cast: Eric K. Boulianne, Catherine Chabot, Florence Blain Mbaye, Sarah Chouinard Poirier, Étienne Galloy, Agathe Ledoux, Simone Bellemare-Ledoux, Antonin Mousseau-Rivard, Sophie Letourneur, Ève Landry
