films.title: GOD WILL NOT HELP
films.synopsis: A traditional mountain community goes into turmoil when a mysterious foreign woman arrives claiming to be the wife of a man who left them many years ago.
films.music: Stavros Evangelou, Iris Asimakopoulou, Vasilis Chontos
films.cast: Manuela Martelli, Ana Marija Veselčić, Filip Đurić, Mauro Ercegović Gracin, Nikša Butijer, Tina Orlandini, Bogdan Farcaș, Ivan Skoko, Vinko Kraljević
films.awardsWon: Locarno FF (Best Performance), Thessaloniki FF (Best Actress), Sarajevo FF (Special Award for the Promotion of Gender Equality)
films.awardsNominated: Locarno FF (Best Film), Palm Springs IFF (Grand Jury Prize), Sarajevo FF (Best Film)

films.title: HALF MOON
films.synopsis: The eruption of war in Syria made it impossible for Syrian composer/clarinettist Kinan Azmeh to return, sparking his introspective journey into the power of art during times of conflict. He delves into his roots, personal stories, reshaping the narrative of contemporary Syria through music.
films.producer: Niek Koppen, Jan de Ruiter, Jia Zhao
films.cinematography: Benito Strangio, Talal Khoury, Melle van Essen, NSC, Roel van ‘t Hoff, Frank Scheffer
films.editor: Ruben van der Hammen, Frank Scheffer
films.cast: Kinan Azmeh, Dima Orsho, Basilius Arawad, Yo-Yo Ma, Eric Vloeimans
films.awardsNominated: Rotterdam IFF (World Premiere - Harbour), Vancouver IFF (Portraits), DOCNYC (Sonic Cinema)

films.title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY
films.synopsis: Toha is a young maid who dreams of one simple thing: a birthday candle to make a wish. When her best friend, Nelly, the daughter of her employer, is promised a birthday party amid her parents’ looming divorce, Toha takes it upon herself to make the celebration happen. As she plans the party, she forms an unexpected bond with Nelly’s mother Laila, briefly blurring rigid social boundaries. When the family tries to send Toha away to prevent her attendance, her persistence exposes buried tensions. Confronted with rejection, Toha begins to question her place within a harsh and unforgiving class system.
films.producer: Ahmed Desuky, Ahmed Abbas, Ahmed Badawy, Jamie Foxx, Datari Turner
films.cast: Doha Ramadan, Nelly Karim, Hanan Motawie, Hanan Youssef
films.awardsWon: Tribeca Film Festival (Best International Narrative Feature, Best Screenplay in an International Narrative Feature, Nora Ephron Award), São Paulo IFF (Best Performance)
films.awardsNominated: Tallinn Black Nights FF (Official Screening), Tokyo IFF (Women’s Empowerment)

films.title: HUMAN RESOURCE
films.synopsis: Fren works in HR at an unjust company, interviewing young new hires and closely observing their lives. While doing so, she secretly grapples with her one month pregnancy and the question of whether to bring a child into the world.
films.cast: Prapamonton Eiamchan, Paopetch Charoensook, Chanakan Rattana-Udom, Pimmada Chaisaksoen
films.awardsWon: Venice FF (Premio Fondazione Fai Persona Lavoro Ambiente)
films.awardsNominated: Asia Pacific Screen Award (Best Screenplay), Busan IFF (Official Selection), BFI London FF (Official Selection), Vancouver IFF (Panorama)

films.title: I ONLY REST IN THE STORM
films.synopsis: Sérgio travels to a metropolis in Guinea-Bissau to work for an NGO as an environmental engineer on a road project between the desert and the forest. There, he becomes entangled in an intimate yet unbalanced relationship with two inhabitants of the city, Diara and Gui. As the neo-colonial dynamics among the expatriate community unravel, this fragile bond becomes his only refuge from an impending collapse into solitude or barbarism.
films.kannadaTitle: ಐ ಓನ್ಲಿ ರೆಸ್ಟ್ ಇನ್ ದ ಸ್ಟಾರ್ಮ್
films.screenplay: Pedro Pinho, Miguel Seabra Lopes, José Filipe Costa, Luísa Homem, Marta Lança, Miguel Carmo, Tiago Hespanha, Leonor Noivo, Luís Miguel Correia, Paul Choquet
films.editor: Rita M. Pestana, Karen Akerman, Claúdia Rita Oliveira
films.sound: Jules Valeur, Pablo Lamar, Marius Leftarache
films.cast: Sérgio Coragem, Cleo Diára
films.awardsWon: Montréal Festival of New Cinema Louve d'Or (Best Feature Film - International Competition), Valladolid IFF (Punto de Encuentro Award - Best Feature Film)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Prix Un Certain Regard Award, Queer Palm), Munich FF (CineRebels Award), Athens IFF (Golden Athena - Best Picture), Busan IFF (Flash Forward)

films.title: IMPATIENCE OF THE HEART
films.synopsis: On a night out, a young soldier tries to improve his chances with an attractive older woman by courting her grumpy sister. But when Isaac (23) playfully pulls Edith (22) off a bench, she slumps limply to the floor. Only now does he discover her wheelchair parked on the side. Isaac tries to clear up the misunderstanding, but a scuffle ensues with some of the regulars and his comrades. Burdened with shame, Isaac is urged to correct the sisters’ image of him. He makes an effort to connect with Edith, and an unexpected friendship develops between the two.
films.cast: Giulio Brizzi, Ladina von Frisching, Livia Matthes, Thomas Loibl.
films.awardsWon: FF Max Ophuls Preis (Best Film), Neisse FF (Best Feature Film), Filmkunstfest Mecklenburg-Vorpommern (Best Film)
films.awardsNominated: Stockholm IFF (Official Screening)

films.title: IT WAS JUST AN ACCIDENT
films.synopsis: When an auto mechanic encounters the man who may have been his torturer in prison, he kidnaps him to exact vengeance. But since the sole clue to Eghbal’s identity is the squeak of his prosthetic leg, Vahid turns to other now-freed victims for confirmation. And the danger only escalates.
films.cast: Vahid Mobasseri, Maryam Afshari, Ebrahim Azizi, Hadis Pakbaten, Majid Panahi
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Palme d'Or), Toronto IFF (Best International Feature) Indiewire Critics' Poll (Best International Film, Best Film, Best Director, Best Screenplay), Sydney FF (Sydney Film Prize), Warsaw IFF (Audience Award)
films.awardsNominated: Locarno IFF (Piazza Grande), San Sebastián IFF (Perlak), Viennale (Features), Toronto Film Critics Association Awards (Best International Feature), British Independent Film Awards (Best International Independent Film)

films.title: JANINE MOVES TO THE COUNTRY
films.synopsis: In a small-town microcosm of Germany caught between violence and erotic fantasy. Janine, who is queer, moves back to the country and encounters ghosts of her past. A peeping neighbor’s inappropriate conduct stirs up dark memories – and also draws her in.
films.music: Ulf Wrede, Peter Uehling, Sanaa Schlaeger
films.sound: Harald Ansorge, Michael Gabelmann, Cedric Hommel
films.cast: Janine Lear, Maximilian Brauer, Adrian Wenzel, Kathrin Angerer, Pierre Emö, Susanne Bredehöft, Daniel Zillmann, Beatrice Cordula
films.awardsNominated: Berlin IFF (Official Screening - Forum)

films.title: KIKA
films.synopsis: Kika (Manon Clavel) is a married social worker whose stable life is upended when she falls in love with another man and becomes pregnant – and again when her new partner unexpectedly dies. This sets the scene for her journey in search of a new independence, as she navigates impermanence, grief, and economic precarity, and seeks out a more lucrative and dependable means of supporting herself and her child.
films.cast: Manon Clavel, Suzanne Elbaz, Makita Samba, Thomas Coumand
films.awardsWon: Munich FF (ARRI/OSRAM Award - Best International Film), Valladolid IFF (Best New Director).
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Critics' Week), Karlovy Vary FF (Official Screening: Horizons), Warsaw FF (Best Film), Thessaloniki FF (Official Selection: Open Horizons)

films.title: KOKORAS
films.synopsis: A janitor of the Municipality of Athens, determined to give his six-year-old son the future he himself was denied, enrolls him in a private school. But his chase of the “Greek dream” turns into a tragicomic spiral of conflicts, leading to a bitter revelation: perhaps his illusions were all he truly had.
films.cast: Nikos Kasapis, Kora Karvouni, Dimitris Katalifos, Eleni Kokkidou, Yannis Sarakatsanis, Youlika Skafida, Yannis Drakopoulos, Konstantinos Moutaftsis, Nikos Dafnis, Eleni Dafni
films.awardsNominated: Thessaloniki FF (World Premiere)

films.title: KONTINENTAL '25
films.synopsis: Orsolya is a bailiff in Cluj, the main city in Transylvania. One day she must evict a homeless man who lives in the basement of a building. An unexpected event creates a moral crisis she tries to solve as best she can.
films.cast: Eszter Tompa, Gabriel Spahiu, Adonis Tanța, Șerban Pavlu, Oana Mardare, Annamária Biluska, Adrian Sitaru, Marius Damian.
films.awardsWon: Berlinale (Silver Bear Best Screenplay), IFF of Uruguay (Best Film Award International Competition, Best Film Award Young Jury), Chicago IFF (International Competition – Best Female Performance)
films.awardsNominated: Berlinale (Competition), Hong Kong IFF (Les Auteurs), Sydney FF (Features selection), New Zealand FF (Official Screening), New York FF (Main Slate)

films.title: LATE SHIFT
films.synopsis: Nurse Floria brings passion and precision to her surgical ward in a Swiss hospital, always attuned to patients amid chaos. On a grueling late shift with a colleague absent and the understaffed unit- she juggles a critically ill young mother, a diagnosis-anxious elder, and a demanding private patient. As night deepens, her routine spirals into a desperate race against time.
films.producer: Reto Schaerli, Lukas Hobi, Zodiac Pictures
films.cast: Leonie Benesch
films.awardsWon: Haifa IFF (Golden Anchor Award - Best Film)
films.awardsNominated: Berlin IFF(Berlinale Special), Locarno IFF (Swiss Panorama), Sydney FF (Feature)

films.title: LOVE ME TENDER
films.synopsis: At the end of summer, Clémence tells her ex-husband that she’s had relationships with women. Her life is turned upside down when he files to strip her of their son’s custody. Then begins a struggle of several years for Clémence to defend her right to be a mother and a woman, free to make her own choices.
films.cast: Vicky Krieps, Antoine Reinartz, Monia Chokri, Vigo Ferrera-Redier, Aurélia Petit, Ji-Min Park, Salif Cissé, Julien De Saint-Jean, Malou Khebizi, Tallulah Cassavetti
films.awardsWon: Rio IFF (Prêmio Felix - Special Jury Prize)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Un Certain Regard), Karlovy IFF (Official selection) Thessaloniki FF (Greek premiere), BFI London FF (Official screening), Lux Audience Awards 2026

films.title: MAGELLAN
films.synopsis: 16th century. Magellan, a young and ambitious Portuguese navigator, rebels against the power of the King, who doesn’t support his dream of discovering the world. He persuades the Spanish Crown to fund his bold expedition to the fabled lands of the East. The voyage is exhausting beyond expectations, with hunger and mutiny pushing the crew to their limits. Upon reaching the islands of the Malayan Archipelago, Magellan’s mind changes. He becomes obsessed with conquest and conversion, which sparks violent uprisings beyond his control. This is not the myth of Magellan, but the truth of his journey.
films.producer: Rosa Filmes, Andergraun Films, Black Cap Pictures, Lib Films
films.cast: Gael García Bernal, Ângela Azevedo, Amado Arjay Babon, Ronnie Lazaro, Hazel Orencio
films.awardsWon: Valladolid IFF (Golden Spike - Best Film)
films.awardsNominated: Munich FF (Best International Film), Asia Pacific Screen Awards (Best Film, Best Cinematography)

films.title: MAYSOON
films.synopsis: Almost ten years after the Arab Spring, the young Egyptian archaeologist Maysoon lives in Berlin with her German boyfriend Tobi and their two children. When private problems begin to shake her life, and her political and social status are threatened, Maysoon fears that she may lose everything once again: family, love, and freedom. Fuelled by love and idealism, she fights for her independence as a woman and as a citizen on a rollercoaster that can at any time turn everything into ruins.
films.kannadaTitle:
Almost ten years after the Arab Spring, the young Egyptian archaeologist Maysoon lives in Berlin with her German boyfriend Tobi and their two children. When private problems begin to shake her life, and her political and social status are threatened, Maysoon fears that she may lose everything once again: family, love, and freedom. Fuelled by love and idealism, she fights for her independence as a woman and as a citizen on a rollercoaster that can at any time turn everything into ruins.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಅರಬ್ ಸ್ಪ್ರಿಂಗ್ ನಡೆದ ಸುಮಾರು ಹತ್ತು ವರ್ಷಗಳ ನಂತರ, ಯುವ ಈಜಿಪ್ಟಿಯನ್ ಪುರಾತತ್ವ ತಜ್ಞೆ ಮೇಸೂನ್ ತನ್ನ ಜರ್ಮನ್ ಸಂಗಾತಿ ಟೋಬಿ ಮತ್ತು ಇಬ್ಬರು ಮಕ್ಕಳೊಂದಿಗೆ ಬರ್ಲಿನ್‌ನಲ್ಲಿ ವಾಸಿಸುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ವೈಯಕ್ತಿಕ ಸಂಕಷ್ಟಗಳು ಅವಳ ಜೀವನವನ್ನು ಅಲುಗಾಡಿಸುವಾಗ, ಅವಳ ರಾಜಕೀಯ ಮತ್ತು ಸಾಮಾಜಿಕ ಅಸ್ತಿತ್ವಕ್ಕೆ ಧಕ್ಕೆ ಉಂಟಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಮತ್ತೊಮ್ಮೆ ಕುಟುಂಬ, ಪ್ರೀತಿ ಮತ್ತು ಸ್ವಾತಂತ್ರ್ಯವನ್ನು ಕಳೆದುಕೊಳ್ಳುವ ಭಯ ಅವಳನ್ನು ಕಾಡುತ್ತದೆ. ಪ್ರೀತಿ ಮತ್ತು ಆದರ್ಶಗಳಿಂದ ಪ್ರೇರಿತಳಾಗಿ, ಮಹಿಳೆಯಾಗಿ ಮತ್ತು ನಾಗರಿಕಳಾಗಿ ತನ್ನ ಸ್ವಾತಂತ್ರ್ಯಕ್ಕಾಗಿ ಹೋರಾಡುವ ಮೇಸೂನ್‌ನ ಬದುಕು ಯಾವ ಕ್ಷಣದಲ್ಲಾದರೂ ಎಲ್ಲವನ್ನೂ ಧ್ವಂಸಗೊಳಿಸಬಲ್ಲ ರೋಲರ್‌ಕೋಸ್ಟರ್ ಪ್ರಯಾಣವಾಗುತ್ತದೆ.
films.cast: Sabrina Amali, Florian Stetter, Susanne Bormann, Karyofyllia Karabeti, Marie Tragousti, Mehdi Meskar, Zoë Valks, Josef Mohamed, Patrick Schlegel, Deborah Kaufmann
films.awardsWon: Thessaloniki FF (Best Actress - International Competition)
films.awardsNominated: Thessaloniki FF (Golden Alexander), Oldenburg FF (Audience Award - Best Film)

films.title: MILITANTROPOS
films.synopsis: Militantropos captures the human condition through the fractured realities of the Russian invasion of Ukraine. The film pieces together everyday lives transformed by war—those who flee, those who lose everything, and those who stay to resist. Amid devastation and atrocity, it traces the instinct to survive and the deep-seated need for closeness. It is a profound exploration of how the human is absorbed into war, and how war, in turn, becomes an inseparable part of the human soul.
films.producer: Eugene Rachkovsky, Ralph Wieser, Nabil Bellahsene
films.screenplay: Yelizaveta Smith, Alina Gorlova, Simon Mozgovyi, Maksym Nakonechnyi
films.cinematography: Viacheslav Tsvietkov, Khrystyna Lizohub, Denis Melnyk
films.editor: Yelizaveta Smith, Alina Gorlova, Simon Mozgovyi
films.awardsWon: Docudays UA International Documentary Human Rights FF (Union of the Ukrainian Film Critics Prize : DOCU/UKRAINE Competion)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF(Golden Eye, Directors' Fortnight Audience Award)

films.title: MORTICIAN
films.synopsis: An Iranian mortician in Canada, tasked by the Iranian government to wash the bodies of recently deceased ex-pats, has his world turned upside down when he receives an unusual request from a dissident singer in hiding.
films.sound: Alireza Alavian, Sana Alavian, Soroosh Arefi
films.cast: Nima Sadr, Gola, Erfan Bokaei, Rahim Bahrami, Hamidreza Hosseini
films.awardsWon: Edinburgh IFF (Feature Filmmaking Excellence)
films.awardsNominated: São Paulo IFF (Official Selection), Haifa IFF (Official Selection)

films.title: MOTHERTONGUE
films.synopsis: A struggling actress returns to her hometown in Sichuan. Confused by the fact that she can no longer speak her native dialect, she searches for a new life.
films.cast: Bai Baihe, Wang Chuanjun, Liu Dan, Peng Jin
films.awardsWon: Tokyo IFF (World Premiere, Best Director)
films.awardsNominated: Tokyo IFF (Grand Prix)

films.title: MY FATHER'S SHADOW
films.synopsis: A semi-autobiographical tale set over the course of a single day in the Nigerian metropolis, Lagos, during the 1993 Nigerian election crisis. The story follows a father, estranged from his two young sons, as they travel through the massive city while political unrest threatens their journey home.
films.cast: Ṣọpẹ́ Dìrísù,  Chibuike Marvellous Egbo,  Godwin Egbo
films.awardsWon: São Paulo IFF (Best International Film), British Independent Film Awards (Best Director), Gotham Awards (Breakthrough Director), Pingyao IFF(Best Director - Crouching Tigers)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Special Mention: Caméra d'or), Chicago IFF (Special Mention: International Feature Film Competition), British Independent Film Awards (Best Screenplay, Best Cinematography, Best Debut Director, Best British Independent Film)  Melbourne IFF, Busan IFF, Toronto IFF, BFI London FF, Karlovy Vary IFF

films.title: MY UNCLE JENS
films.synopsis: Akam, a young literature teacher living a quiet life in Oslo, is caught off guard when his estranged uncle from Iranian Kurdistan arrives unannounced. Though his shared apartment is already crowded, Akam feels compelled to offer him a place to stay. Days pass, and the visit stretches on, unsettling both Akam and his flatmates. As tensions rise, Akam begins to question his uncle’s true reasons for coming. What starts as an awkward family obligation soon unfolds into a chain of revelations, forcing both men to confront choices that could alter the course of their lives.
films.cast: Peiman Azizpour, Hamza Agoshi, Sarah Francesca Brænne, Emir Hakki, Theresa Eggesbø, Magnus Lysbakken
films.awardsWon: Duhok IFF (Winner: Best Director and Best Screenplay Awards)
films.awardsNominated: SXSW - South by Southwest (Official Selection), Munich FF (Best Film), Windsor IFF (Official Selection), San Diego Asian FF (Asia Pop Nominations), Taipei IFF (Official Selection: City Focus)

films.title: NINO
films.synopsis: In three days, Nino will face a major challenge. But first, his doctors have assigned him two vital tasks. Two missions that will lead the young man on a journey through Paris, compelling him to reconnect with the world and himself.
films.cast: Théodore Pellerin, William Lebghil, Salomé Dewaels, Jeanne Balibar, Camille Rutherford, Estelle Meyer, Victoire DuBois, Mathieu Amalric, Balthazar Billaud
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Rising Star Award in Critics’ Week, Valbonne Audience Award), Ornano-Valenti Prize (Best First French Film), 20th Rome Film Fest (Progressive Cinema Competition - JURY GRAND PRIZE), Cinemania (BEST FILM)
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF (Platform Competition), FilmFest Hamburg, The American French FF (US Premiere), Mannheim-Heidelberg IFF (Official Selection)

films.title: NO OTHER CHOICE
films.synopsis: Adapted from a novel by Donald E. Westlake, this darkly comic satire by Park Chan-wook follows Lee Man-soo, a longtime paper-company employee suddenly laid off after twenty-five years. Once comfortable with a family, home, and status, he finds himself drowning in debt and pressure to sell his childhood house. Obsessed with landing a prestigious job at a rival firm, he invents a fake company and invites competing candidates to private meetings, where he quietly eliminates them. The film turns workplace anxiety and middle-class ambition into something chilling, funny, and disturbingly familiar.
films.producer: Park Chan-wook, Back Jisun, Michèle Ray, Gavras Alexandre Gavras
films.screenplay: Park Chan-wook, Lee Kyoung-mi, Don McKellar, Jayhe Lee
films.cast: Lee Byung Hun, Son Yejin, Park Hee Soon, Lee Sung Min, Yeom Hye Ran, Cha Seung Won
films.awardsWon: Toronto IFF (International People's Choice Award), Indiewire Critics' Poll (Best Cinematography, Best International Film)
films.awardsNominated: Venice IFF (Official Selection), Golden Globes (Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy, Foreign Language), Toronto Film Critics Association Awards (Adapted Screenplay), Gotham Awards (Best International Feature, Best Adapted Screenplay), Viennale FF(Feature Film), Busan IFF(Opening Film), Tallinn Black Nights FF (Screen International Critics’ Choice)

films.title: NOMAD SHADOW
films.synopsis: Mariam, violently deported from Spain back to the family home in Western Sahara she left a decade earlier, rails against the confines of a culture and home she had once escaped. Mariam’s relentless determination to steer her own destiny in the world of complex traditions she returns to puts her at risk of losing everything, including the people who care for her most.
films.kannadaTitle:
Mariam, violently deported from Spain back to the family home in Western Sahara she left a decade earlier, rails against the confines of a culture and home she had once escaped. Mariam’s relentless determination to steer her own destiny in the world of complex traditions she returns to puts her at risk of losing everything, including the people who care for her most.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಮರಿಯಮ್ ಹತ್ತು ವರ್ಷಗಳ ಹಿಂದೆಯೇ ತನ್ನ ಹಳ್ಳಿಯನ್ನು ಬಿಟ್ಟು ಸ್ಪೇನ್ ದೇಶಕ್ಕೆ ಹೋಗಿರುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಆದರೆ ಅಲ್ಲಿಂದ ಅವಳನ್ನು ಬಲವಂತವಾಗಿ ಪಶ್ಚಿಮ ಸಹಾರಾದಲ್ಲಿರುವ ಅವಳ ಮನೆಗೆ ವಾಪಸ್ ಕಳುಹಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ತಾನು ಯಾವ ಕಟ್ಟುಪಾಡುಗಳಿಂದ ಮತ್ತು ಸಂಪ್ರದಾಯಗಳಿಂದ ತಪ್ಪಿಸಿಕೊಂಡು ಹೋಗಿದ್ದಳೋ, ಈಗ ಮತ್ತೆ ಅದೇ ಮನೆಯೊಳಗೆ ಅವಳು ಬಂಧಿಯಾಗುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಸಂಕೀರ್ಣ ಸಂಪ್ರದಾಯಗಳ ನಡುವೆ ತನ್ನ ಸ್ವಂತ ದಾರಿಯನ್ನು ಹುಡುಕಿಕೊಳ್ಳುವ ಮರಿಯಮ್‌ನ ಹಠ ಮತ್ತು ಛಲ, ಅವಳನ್ನು ಅಪಾಯಕ್ಕೆ ದೂಡುತ್ತದೆ. ಈ ಹಾದಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ಅವಳು ತನ್ನವರನ್ನು ಮತ್ತು ತನ್ನ ಬಳಿ ಇರುವ ಎಲ್ಲವನ್ನೂ ಕಳೆದುಕೊಳ್ಳುವ ಪರಿಸ್ಥಿತಿ ಎದುರಾಗುತ್ತದೆ.
films.producer: Shrihari Sathe, Eimi Imanishi, Belén Sánchez Silvero, Queralt Pons Serra, Damon Owlia, Jayne Baron Sherman, Virginie Lacombe, Eric Dupont
films.cast: Nadhira Mohamed, Omar Salem, Suleiman Filali, Eddami Elabed, Chekh Mehdi, Khadija Najem Allal, Ghizlane L’Koucha
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF (World Premiere), Tallinn Black Nights FF (In Focus: Catalonia)

films.title: ORENDA
films.synopsis: On a remote lighthouse island, two women are forced to confront a shared past. Nora, a renowned opera singer, arrives to bury her husband, who has taken his own life and wished to be laid to rest there. She encounters Natalia, a former priest living in isolation, who is unsettled by Nora’s presence. Bound by their connection to the same man, the two women struggle to find words for grief, guilt, and unspoken truths. Together they face questions of love, faith, and forgiveness.
films.kannadaTitle:
On a remote lighthouse island, two women are forced to confront a shared past. Nora, a renowned opera singer, arrives to bury her husband, who has taken his own life and wished to be laid to rest there. She encounters Natalia, a former priest living in isolation, who is unsettled by Nora’s presence. Bound by their connection to the same man, the two women struggle to find words for grief, guilt, and unspoken truths. Together they face questions of love, faith, and forgiveness.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಒಂದು ದೂರದ ದ್ವೀಪದ ಲೈಟ್‌ಹೌಸ್‌ನಲ್ಲಿ ಇಬ್ಬರು ಮಹಿಳೆಯರು ತಮ್ಮ ಹಳೆಯ ನೆನಪುಗಳನ್ನು ಎದುರಿಸಬೇಕಾದ ಸಂದರ್ಭ ಬರುತ್ತದೆ. ನೋರಾ ಎಂಬ ಪ್ರಖ್ಯಾತ ಒಪೆರಾ ಗಾಯಕಿ, ಆತ್ಮಹತ್ಯೆ ಮಾಡಿಕೊಂಡ ತನ್ನ ಪತಿಯ ಅಂತ್ಯಕ್ರಿಯೆಗಾಗಿ ಆ ದ್ವೀಪಕ್ಕೆ ಬರುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ತನ್ನನ್ನು ಅಲ್ಲೇ ಹೂಳಬೇಕೆಂಬುದು ಅವಳ ಪತಿಯ ಕೊನೆಯ ಆಸೆಯಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ. ಅಲ್ಲಿ ಅವಳಿಗೆ ನಟಾಲಿಯಾ ಎಂಬ ಮಾಜಿ ಪಾದ್ರಿ ಸಿಗುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಜನರಿಂದ ದೂರವಾಗಿ ಏಕಾಂಗಿಯಾಗಿ ಬದುಕುತ್ತಿರುವ ನಟಾಲಿಯಾಗೆ ನೋರಾಳ ಬರುವಿಕೆ ಇಷ್ಟವಾಗುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. ಆದರೆ, ಒಂದೇ ವ್ಯಕ್ತಿಯೊಂದಿಗೆ ಇಬ್ಬರಿಗೂ ಇದ್ದ ಸಂಬಂಧ ಅವರನ್ನು ಹತ್ತಿರ ತರುತ್ತದೆ. ದುಃಖ, ಅಪರಾಧ ಪ್ರಜ್ಞೆ ಮತ್ತು ಇದುವರೆಗೆ ಹೇಳಲಾಗದ ಸತ್ಯಗಳ ನಡುವೆ ಇಬ್ಬರೂ ಮೌನವಾಗಿ ಹೋರಾಡುತ್ತಾರೆ. ಈ ಜಿಗುಟಾದ ಹಾದಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ಅವರು ಪ್ರೀತಿ, ನಂಬಿಕೆ ಮತ್ತು ಕ್ಷಮೆಯ ಕುರಿತಾದ ಪ್ರಶ್ನೆಗಳಿಗೆ ಉತ್ತರ ಹುಡುಕತೊಡಗುತ್ತಾರೆ.
films.cast: Alma Pöysti, Pirkko Saisio, Luca Leino, Hannu-Pekka Björkman, Mikko Kauppila, Tambek Tuisk
films.awardsWon: Septimius Awards (Best Cinematography, Best European Actress - Alma Pöysti)
films.awardsNominated: Rotterdam IFF (World Premiere, Big Screen Competition), Göteborg FF (Best Nordic Film), Tampere FF (Opening Film)

films.title: OSLO: A TAIL OF PROMISE
films.synopsis: OSLO: A TAIL OF PROMISE is a true, non-linear journey of Pooja and Oslo, a Siberian husky who transforms her life. From founding an ecological sanctuary called The Farm to healing through animals, the film weaves love, loss, courage, and surrender. Oslo, a traumatised pup, becomes Pooja’s anchor and guide, opening her to the sentience of nature and animal wisdom. Their annual 5,000 km pilgrimage to the snow raises ethical questions, confronts grief, and celebrates the profound human–animal bond, urging us to choose love over fear.
films.producer: Pooja R Bhale, Mansi Pingle, Amey Gosavi
films.cast: Pooja Bhale, Oslo Khanwalkar
films.awardsNominated: Indian Panorama, 56th IFFI (Official Selection, World Premiere, Pune IFF (Festival Screening)

films.title: OUTCRY
films.synopsis: Seti loves music and dreams of being heard. In Iran, where women are legally banned from performing in public, she turns the street into her stage and begins to sing. Passersby become her audience, and her defiant act quickly draws attention. Seti’s voice spreads, turning her into a symbol for a generation unwilling to accept silence or repression. Produced independently, Soheil Beiraghi’s fourth feature offers a rare, uncompromising look at contemporary Iran. The film stands as an act of resistance, giving space to voices that censorship continues to suppress.
films.cast: Sarvin Zabetian, Amir Jadidi, Leili Rashidi
films.awardsWon: Karlovy Vary International Film Festival (Special Jury Prize)
films.awardsNominated: Batumi IAFF (Competition Selection), Festival do Rio (Official Selection), Vancouver IFF (Panorama Selection), Cyrus IFF (Official Selection)

films.title: PROMISED SKY
films.synopsis: Marie, an Ivorian pastor and former journalist, has lived in Tunisia for ten years. Her home becomes a refuge for Naney, a young mother seeking a better future, and Jolie, a strong-willed student carrying her family’s hopes. The arrival of a little orphan girl challenges their sense of solidarity in a tense social climate, revealing both their fragility and strength.
films.screenplay: Erige Sehiri, Anna Ciennik, Malika Cécile Louati
films.sound: Aymen Laabidi, Alexis Jung, Simon Apostolou
films.cast: Aïssa Maiga, Debora Lobe Naney, Laetitia Ky, Estelle Kenza Dogbo, Foued Zaazaa, Mohamed Grayaa, Touré Blamassi
films.awardsWon: Marrakech IFF (Golden Star, Best Actress), Mostra de Valencia FF (Best Screenplay)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Un Certain Regard), Zurich FF (Official Selection)

films.title: REEDLAND
films.synopsis: When reed cutter Johan discovers the lifeless body of a girl on his land, he is overcome by an ambiguous sense of guilt. While taking care of his granddaughter, he sets out on a quest to track down evil. But darkness can thrive in unexpected places.
films.producer: Marleen Slot, Dries Phlypo, Martien Vlietman
films.music: Mitchel van Dinther, Lyckle de Jong
films.cast: Gerrit Knobbe, Loïs Reinders
films.awardsWon: Mannheim-Heidelberg IFF (FIPRESCI Award), Budapest IFF (Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award), Kyiv IFF (Special Mention - Molodist)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Critics’ Week), New Zealand IFF (Fresh Selection), Sarajevo FF (Kinoscope Section), Oslo Pix (Competition for Audience Award), Busan IFF (Flash Forward Competition)

films.title: RENOVATION
films.synopsis: The current Lithuania's Vilnius. Perfectionist 29-year-old Ilona feels pressure to be successful and settled by the time she is 30. She starts to wonder how she really wants to live at this pivotal moment in her life. She and her lover Matas move into what looks to be the ideal apartment, and things are starting to become serious. However, when the building's renovations get underway, Ilona's inner doubts gradually come to light. She unexpectedly becomes acquainted with Oleg, a construction worker from Ukraine. Her doubts about whether she truly wants to settle down and establish a family are heightened by their relationship.
films.producer: Uljana Kim, Alise Rogule, Dominiks Jarmakovičs and Kristian Van der Heyden
films.cast: Žygimantė Elena Jakštaitė, Šarūnas Zenkevičius, Roman Lutskyi
films.awardsWon: Tallinn Black Nights FF (Best Director - Baltic Film Competition)
films.awardsNominated: Karlovy Vary IFF (World Premiere), Tallinn Black Nights FF (Baltic Film Competition)

films.title: RESURRECTION
films.synopsis: In a post-apocalyptic future, a woman emerges from brain surgery and finds herself in a semi-conscious state, the world around her laid to waste. She comes upon the motionless body of an android and decides to tell it the history of China. Slowly, with each passing night, the robot’s senses are restored. When her stories arrive at the present, she faces a dilemma: should she return to the real world, or should she follow her heart and remain with this machine?
films.producer: Bi Gan, Zuolong Shan, Charles Gillibert, Lele Yang
films.cast: Yee Jackson, Shu Qi, Chao Mark, Li Gengxi
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Jury Special Prize), Busan IFF (Artistic Contribution Award), Pingyao IFF (Chinese Filmmaker of the Year)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Palme d'Or), Gotham Awards (Best Film)

films.title: RIVERSTONE
films.synopsis: Against the backdrop of alleged custodial killings disguised as police encounters, the film probes the moral and psychological cost of state-sanctioned violence. As three police officers escort a suspect to a remote location for a staged “shootout,” they confront their own doubts, fears, and complicity. Caught between duty, ambition, and conscience, their journey exposes how political power manipulates law enforcement, erodes due process, and turns ordinary officers into instruments of arbitrary justice.
films.cast: Mahendra Perera, Shayam Fernando, Priyantha Sirikumara, Randika Gunathilaka, Ananda Kumaraunnahe, Prabodini Chandrasena
films.awardsWon: Singapore IFF (Best Director, Best Performance), Shanghai IFF (Asian New Talent Best Script Writer, Asian New Talent Best Cinematography), Fajr IFF (Special Jury Award)
films.awardsNominated: São Paulo IFF (New Directors Competition)

films.title: SENTIMENTAL VALUE
films.synopsis: Sisters Nora and Agnes reunite with their estranged father, the charismatic Gustav, a once renowned director who offers stage actress Nora a role in what he hopes will be his comeback film. When Nora turns it down, she soon discovers he’s given her part to an eager young Hollywood star. Suddenly, the two sisters must navigate their complicated relationship with their father and deal with an American star dropped right into the middle of their complex family dynamics.
films.cast: Renate Reinsve, Stellan Skarsgård, Elle Fanning, Inga Ibsdotter Lilleaas
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Grand Prix), Indiewire Critics' Poll (Best Screenplay, Best Film, Best International Film, Best Director), Seville European FF (Puerta América Award)
films.awardsNominated: Golden Globes (Best Motion Picture), Locarno IFF (Piazza Grande), San Sebastián IFF (Perlak), Viennale (Feature Film), Sydney FF (Special Presentation)

films.title: SIRĀT
films.synopsis: A man and his son arrive at a rave lost in the mountains of Morocco. They are looking for Marina, their daughter and sister, who disappeared months ago at another rave. Driven by fate, they decide to follow a group of ravers in search of one last party, in the hope that Marina will be there.
films.cast: Sergi López, Brúno Nuñez, Stefania Gadda, Joshua Liam Henderson, Tonin Janvier
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Jury Prize, Best Composer, Palm Dog - Jury Prize), Chicago IFF (Gold Hugo - Best Feature), Denver FF (Best Feature Film)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Palme d'Or), European Film Awards (European Film, European Director, European Actor), Critics Choice Awards (Best Foreign Language Film)

films.title: SKIN OF YOUTH
films.synopsis: SKIN OF YOUTH focuses on the turbulent romance between a transgender sex worker seeking to realise her dream of living in a woman’s body, and a cage fighter in 1990s Saigon. San wants to have enough money for a sex-change operation that will fulfill her dream of living in a woman’s body. San’s lover, Nam, must work as an underground dog-cage fighter to support this dream. The young lovers are unaware that the dark forces they will have to battle may cost them their relationship and test the limit of their humanity.
films.producer: Trân Thi Bích Ngoc, Ash Mayfair, Fran Borgia
films.cast: Trân Quân, Võ Diên Gia Huy, Phan Thi Kim Ngân, Hajime Inoue
films.awardsWon: IFFI (Golden Peacock for Best Feature Film), New York Asian FF (Special Jury Award)
films.awardsNominated: New York Asian FF (Official Selection - Uncaged Award)

films.title: SLEEPLESS CITY
films.synopsis: Toni, a 15-year-old Roma boy, lives in the largest illegal settlement in Europe, on the outskirts of Madrid. Proud to belong to his family of scrap metal dealers, he follows his grandfather everywhere. But as demolitions move closer and closer to their plot, and his grandfather is willing to do anything to stay, Toni will have to choose what to let go and what to sacrifice. This is the premise of the film SLEEPLESS CITY.
films.producer: Marina García López, Marisa Fernández Armenteros, Manu Calvo, Alex Lafuente, Damien Megherbi
films.sound: Barto Alcaine, Antoine Bertucci, Vincent Arnardi
films.cast: Antonio “Toni” Fernández Gabarre, Bilal Sedraoui, Jesús “Chule” Fernández Silva
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (SACD Screenwriting Award), Cambridge FF (Best Discovery Feature), Almería IFF (Best First Film)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Official Selection), San Sebastián IFF (Audience Award)

films.title: SOUND OF FALLING
films.synopsis: Four girls, Alma, Erika, Angelika, and Lenka, each spend their youth on the same farm in northern Germany. As the home evolves over a century, echoes of the past linger in its walls. Though separated by time, their lives begin to mirror each other.
films.sound: Kai Tebbel, Billie Mind, Jürgen Schulz, Claudio Demel
films.cast: Hanna Heckt, Greta Krämer, Filip Schnack, Helena Lüer, Anastasia Cherepakha, Susanne Wuest, Gode Benedix, Luzia Oppermann
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Jury Prize), Chicago IFF (Best Director), (Best Sound), Stockholm IFF (Best Director), Chicago IFF (Silver Hugo for Best Sound & for Best Director)
films.awardsNominated: Denver FF (Krzysztof Kieslowski Award - Best Feature Film), European Film Awards (European Film, Director, Cinematographer, Screenwriter), Toronto IFF (Special Presentations), Tallinn Black Nights FF (Screen International Critics’ Choice), New York FF (Official Selection)

films.title: STRAIGHT CIRCLE
films.synopsis: A pair of enemy soldiers stationed on a remote border in a vast featureless desert descend into a state of profound disorientation after forgetting which side of the border is which. As they grapple with their identities, loyalties, and the absurdity of their situation, their isolation slowly gives way to an unfathomable nightmare that will blur the line between friend and foe.
films.producer: Thomas Benski, Kevin Rowe, Rik Green, Riaz Rizvi
films.cast: Luke Tittensor, Elliott Tittensor, Neil Maskell
films.awardsWon: Venice FF (Best Film, Young Jury Prize Ca' Foscari), Marrakech IFF (Best Director)
films.awardsNominated: São Paulo IFF (Official Selection), BFI London (Feature Films), AFI Fest (After Dark)

films.title: TALES OF THE WOUNDED LAND
films.synopsis: As war engulfs South Lebanon, a family flees their home while bombs reduce their town to ruins. Returning to devastation, they find only fragments of what once was, yet among the wreckage, the community clings to a fragile hope that peace and renewal will come.
films.kannadaTitle:
As war engulfs South Lebanon, a family flees their home while bombs reduce their town to ruins. Returning to devastation, they find only fragments of what once was, yet among the wreckage, the community clings to a fragile hope that peace and renewal will come.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ದಕ್ಷಿಣ ಲೆಬನಾನ್ ಯುದ್ಧದ ಭೀತಿಯಲ್ಲಿದೆ. ಬಾಂಬ್ ದಾಳಿಯಿಂದ ತಮ್ಮ ಊರು ನಾಶವಾಗುತ್ತಿದ್ದಂತೆ, ಒಂದು ಕುಟುಂಬ ಅಲ್ಲಿಂದ ತಪ್ಪಿಸಿಕೊಂಡು ಓಡಿಹೋಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಯುದ್ಧ ನಿಂತ ಮೇಲೆ ಅವರು ಹಿಂತಿರುಗಿ ನೋಡಿದಾಗ, ಅಲ್ಲಿ ಕೇವಲ ಮನೆಗಳ ಅವಶೇಷಗಳು ಮಾತ್ರ ಇರುತ್ತವೆ. ಆದರೂ, ಆ ಜನರಲ್ಲಿ ಮತ್ತೆ ಶಾಂತಿ ನೆಲೆಸುತ್ತದೆ ಮತ್ತು ಬದುಕು ಚಿಗುರುತ್ತದೆ ಎಂಬ ಸಣ್ಣ ಭರವಸೆ ಇನ್ನೂ ಜೀವಂತವಾಗಿದೆ.

films.title: TÊTES BRÛLÉES
films.synopsis: Twelve-year-old Eya grows up in a Tunisian Muslim family in Brussels, closely bonded to her older brother Younès and his circle of friends, who treat her as one of their own. When Younès dies suddenly, her world is shaken. As her community gathers around the family, Eya experiences both shared solidarity and private silence in grief. Through creativity, faith, and her evolving connection with her brother’s friends, she slowly finds her own way forward.
films.kannadaTitle:
Twelve-year-old Eya grows up in a Tunisian Muslim family in Brussels, closely bonded to her older brother Younès and his circle of friends, who treat her as one of their own. Through creativity, faith, and her evolving connection with her brother’s friends, she slowly finds her own way forward.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಬ್ರಸೆಲ್ಸ್‌ನ ಟುನೀಶಿಯನ್ ಮುಸ್ಲಿಂ ಕುಟುಂಬವೊಂದರಲ್ಲಿ ಬೆಳೆಯುವ ಹನ್ನೆರಡು ವರ್ಷದ ಹುಡುಗಿ ಎಯಾ, ತನ್ನ ಅಣ್ಣ ಯೂನೆಸ್ ಮತ್ತು ಅವನ ಸ್ನೇಹಿತರ ಬಳಗದೊಂದಿಗೆ ನಿಕಟ ಸಂಬಂಧ ಹೊಂದಿರುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಆ ಸ್ನೇಹಿತರೆಲ್ಲರೂ ಅವಳನ್ನು ತಮ್ಮವರಲ್ಲೊಬ್ಬಳೆಂಬಂತೆ ನಡೆಸಿಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಾರೆ. ಯೂನೆಸ್ ಅನಿರೀಕ್ಷಿತವಾಗಿ ಮರಣ ಹೊಂದಿದಾಗ, ಎಯಾಳ ಪ್ರಪಂಚವೇ ನಡುಗಿಹೋಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಅವಳ ಸಮುದಾಯವು ಕುಟುಂಬದ ಬೆಂಬಲಕ್ಕೆ ನಿಂತಾಗ, ಎಯಾ ಈ ದುಃಖದ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಒಗ್ಗಟ್ಟು ಮತ್ತು ಖಾಸಗಿ ಮೌನ ಎರಡನ್ನೂ ಅನುಭವಿಸುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಸೃಜನಶೀಲತೆ, ನಂಬಿಕೆ ಮತ್ತು ತನ್ನ ಅಣ್ಣನ ಸ್ನೇಹಿತರೊಂದಿಗೆ ವಿಕಸನಗೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಿರುವ ಬಾಂಧವ್ಯದ ಮೂಲಕ, ಅವಳು ನಿಧಾನವಾಗಿ ತನ್ನ ಜೀವನದ ಮುಂದಿನ ಹಾದಿಯನ್ನು ಕಂಡುಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಾಳೆ.

films.title: THE DISAPPEARANCE OF JOSEF MENGELE
films.synopsis: After World War II, Nazi doctor Josef Mengele, known as the “Angel of Death,” escaped to South America and vanished into a shadowy life across Argentina, Brazil, and Paraguay. Based on Olivier Guez’s novel, Kirill Serebrennikov’s film follows Mengele’s years in hiding, marked by fear, isolation, and the inescapable weight of his crimes. Watched through the uneasy gaze of his son and haunted by memories of the past, the film examines how a war criminal survives, unpunished yet never free, offering a stark reflection on guilt, denial, and moral collapse.
films.kannadaTitle:
After World War II, Nazi doctor Josef Mengele, known as the “Angel of Death,” escaped to South America and vanished into a shadowy life across Argentina, Brazil, and Paraguay. Based on Olivier Guez’s novel, Kirill Serebrennikov’s film follows Mengele’s years in hiding, marked by fear, isolation, and the inescapable weight of his crimes. Watched through the uneasy gaze of his son and haunted by memories of the past, the film examines how a war criminal survives, unpunished yet never free, offering a stark reflection on guilt, denial, and moral collapse.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಎರಡನೇ ಮಹಾಯುದ್ಧದ ನಂತರ, "ಸಾವಿನ ದೂತ"  ಎಂದೇ ಕುಖ್ಯಾತನಾಗಿದ್ದ ನಾಜಿ ವೈದ್ಯ ಜೋಸೆಫ್ ಮೆಂಗೆಲೆ, ದಕ್ಷಿಣ ಅಮೆರಿಕಾಕ್ಕೆ ಪಲಾಯನ ಮಾಡಿ ಅರ್ಜೆಂಟೀನಾ, ಬ್ರೆಜಿಲ್ ಮತ್ತು ಪರಾಗ್ವೆಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ರಹಸ್ಯ ಜೀವನ ನಡೆಸುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಆಲಿವಿಯರ್ ಗುಯೆಜ್ ಅವರ ಕಾದಂಬರಿಯನ್ನು ಆಧರಿಸಿದ ಕಿರಿಲ್ ಸೆರೆಬ್ರೆನ್ನಿಕೋವ್ ಅವರ ಈ ಚಿತ್ರವು, ಭಯ, ಏಕಾಂತ ಮತ್ತು ಘೋರ ಅಪರಾಧಗಳ ಅಳಿಸಲಾಗದ ಹೊರೆಯ ನಡುವೆ ಕಳೆದ ಮೆಂಗೆಲೆಯ ಅನಾಮಧೇಯ ಜೀವನವನ್ನು ವಿವರಿಸುತ್ತದೆ. ಆತನ ಮಗನ ಅಹಿತಕರ ನೋಟ ಮತ್ತು ಭೂತಕಾಲದ ನೆನಪುಗಳಿಂದ ಕಾಡಿಸುವ  ಚಿತ್ರವು, ಯುದ್ಧಾಪರಾಧಿಯು ಶಿಕ್ಷೆಯಿಂದ ಪಾರಾದರೂ ಸಹ ಸಂಪೂರ್ಣ ಮುಕ್ತನಾಗದ ಬದುಕನ್ನು ಪರಿಶೀಲಿಸುತ್ತದೆ. ಇದು ಅಪರಾಧ ಪ್ರಜ್ಞೆ, ನಿರಾಕರಣೆ ಮತ್ತು ನೈತಿಕ ಕುಸಿತದ ಬಗೆಗಿನ ಒಂದು ಕಟು ಪ್ರತಿಬಿಂಬವಾಗಿದೆ.

films.title: THE DREAMED ONES
films.synopsis: It’s not uncommon for a film to have a moving love story at its core. Yet this particular set-up is unusual. The lovers here are Ingeborg Bachmann and Paul Celan, both important representatives of post-war German-language poetry. The story of the relationship between the Austrian and the Jew from Czernowitz is told through their nearly 20-year correspondence (1948–1967). Or, more precisely, by a young woman and a young man reading from their letters in a studio in Vienna’s venerable Funkhaus.
films.cast: Anja Plaschg, Laurence Rupp

films.title: THE LAST AMBASSADOR
films.synopsis: Afghanistan‘s last female ambassador, Manizha Bakhtari, is risking everything in her fight for the rights of girls and women in Afghanistan.

                            ಅಫ್ಘಾನಿಸ್ತಾನದ ಕೊನೆಯ ಮಹಿಳಾ ರಾಯಭಾರಿಯಾದ ಮನಿಝಾ ಬಖ್ತಾರಿ ಅವರು ಅಫ್ಘಾನಿಸ್ತಾನದ ಹೆಣ್ಣುಮಕ್ಕಳ ಮತ್ತು ಮಹಿಳೆಯರ ಹಕ್ಕುಗಳಿಗಾಗಿ ನಡೆಸುತ್ತಿರುವ ಹೋರಾಟದಲ್ಲಿ ತಮ್ಮ ಸರ್ವಸ್ವವನ್ನೂ ಪಣಕ್ಕಿಟ್ಟಿದ್ದಾರೆ.

films.title: THE LOVE THAT REMAINS
films.synopsis: The film tenderly captures a year in the life of a family as the parents navigate their separation. Through both playful and heartfelt moments, the film portrays the bittersweet essence of faded love and shared memories amidst the changing seasons.

films.synopsis: 1982. As an unknown disease begins to spread in a small mining town in the Chilean desert, gay men are accused of transmitting it through their eyes. Twelve-year-old Lidia, the only girl in the community, sets out in search of the truth.

films.title: THE PORTUGUESE HOUSE
films.synopsis: The disappearance of his wife leaves Fernando, a quiet geography teacher, completely devastated. Aimless, he assumes another man’s identity as a gardener on a Portuguese estate, where he forms an unexpected friendship with the owner, stepping into a new life that isn’t his own.
films.kannadaTitle:
The disappearance of his wife leaves Fernando, a quiet geography teacher, completely devastated. Aimless, he assumes another man’s identity as a gardener on a Portuguese estate, where he forms an unexpected friendship with the owner, stepping into a new life that isn’t his own.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಫರ್ನಾಂಡೋ ಒಬ್ಬ ಶಾಂತ ಸ್ವಭಾವದ ಭೂಗೋಳ ಶಾಸ್ತ್ರದ ಶಿಕ್ಷಕ. ಹೆಂಡತಿಯ ನಾಪತ್ತೆಯಿಂದ ಅವನು ಸಂಪೂರ್ಣವಾಗಿ ಕುಸಿದುಹೋಗುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಬದುಕಿನ ಗುರಿ ಕಳೆದುಕೊಂಡ ಅವನು, ತನ್ನ ಗುರುತನ್ನು ಮರೆಮಾಚಿ ಬೇರೊಬ್ಬನ ಹೆಸರಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಪೋರ್ಚುಗಲ್‌ನ ತೋಟವೊಂದರಲ್ಲಿ ಕೆಲಸಕ್ಕೆ ಸೇರುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಅಲ್ಲಿನ ಮಾಲೀಕನೊಂದಿಗೆ ಅವನಿಗೆ ಅನಿರೀಕ್ಷಿತ ಸ್ನೇಹವಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಹೀಗೆ ಫರ್ನಾಂಡೋ ತನಗೇ ಅರಿಯದಂತೆ ತನ್ನದಲ್ಲದ ಹೊಸ ಜೀವನದೊಳಗೆ ಹೆಜ್ಜೆ ಇಡುತ್ತಾನೆ.

films.title: THE PUPIL
films.synopsis: As the line between mentorship and manipulation blurs, 12 year old Daan faces a frightening inner conflict. He admires his football coach Ries, who slowly becomes a central figure in his life and begins to exploit that trust. What feels like attention and encouragement gradually turns into control and abuse. Daan’s behaviour changes as he withdraws from his family, skips school, and becomes increasingly volatile. Caught between shame, loyalty, and confusion, he struggles to understand what is happening to him and how to find a way back to safety and himself.

films.title: THE THINGS YOU KILL
films.synopsis: Haunted by the suspicious death of his ailing mother, Ali, a university professor coerces his enigmatic gardener to execute a cold-blooded act of vengeance.

films.title: TO THE VICTORY!
films.synopsis: Ukraine, in the near future, after the war has ended. A film director remains behind in a country struggling to redefine itself. Unemployed and emotionally adrift, he is cut off from both his profession and his family, who have rebuilt their lives in Vienna. Caught between denial and inertia, he drifts through a fragile peace, clinging to the belief that stability will return on its own. As time stretches on, hope becomes increasingly abstract, exposing a quiet portrait of displacement, masculinity, and the cost of waiting in a world that has already moved on.
films.producer: Volodymyr Yatsenko, Iya Myslytska, Valentyn Vasyanovych, Anna Yatsenko, Marija Razgutė
films.cast: Valentyn Vasyanovych, Vladlen Odudenko, Marianna Novikova, Hryhoriy Naumov, Volodymyr Kuznetsov
films.awardsWon: Toronto IFF (Platform Award)
films.awardsNominated: Thessaloniki Film Festival (Official Selections)

films.title: TWO PROSECUTORS
films.synopsis: Soviet Union, 1937. Thousands of letters from detainees falsely accused by the regime are burned in a prison cell. Against all odds, one of them reaches its destination, upon the desk of the newly appointed local prosecutor, Alexander Kornyev. Kornyev does his utmost to meet the prisoner, a victim of agents of the secret police, the NKVD. A dedicated Bolshevik of integrity, the young prosecutor suspects foul play. His quest for justice will take him all the way to the office of the Attorney General in Moscow. In the age of the great Stalinist purges, this is the plunge of a man into the corridors of a totalitarian regime that does not bear said name.

His quest for justice will take him all the way to the office of the Attorney General in Moscow. In the age of the great Stalinist purges, this is the plunge of a man into the corridors of a totalitarian regime that does not bear said name.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಸೋವಿಯತ್ ಒಕ್ಕೂಟ, 1937. ಸರ್ಕಾರದ ಸುಳ್ಳು ಆರೋಪಕ್ಕೆ ಬಲಿಯಾಗಿ ಜೈಲು ಸೇರಿದ ಸಾವಿರಾರು ಕೈದಿಗಳ ಪತ್ರಗಳನ್ನು ಜೈಲಿನ ಕೊಠಡಿಯಲ್ಲೇ ಸುಟ್ಟು ಹಾಕಲಾಗುತ್ತಿರುತ್ತದೆ. ಆದರೆ, ಎಲ್ಲ ಅಡೆತಡೆಗಳನ್ನು ಮೀರಿ ಒಂದು ಪತ್ರ ಮಾತ್ರ ಸರಿಯಾದ ವಿಳಾಸ ತಲುಪುತ್ತದೆ. ಅದು ಹೊಸದಾಗಿ ನೇಮಕಗೊಂಡ ಸ್ಥಳೀಯ ಪ್ರಾಸಿಕ್ಯೂಟರ್ ಅಲೆಕ್ಸಾಂಡರ್ ಕಾರ್ನ್ಯೆವ್ ಅವರ ಮೇಜಿನ ಮೇಲೆ ಬಂದು ಬೀಳುತ್ತದೆ. ರಹಸ್ಯ ಪೊಲೀಸ್ ಪಡೆ (NKVD) ಹೂಡಿದ ಸಂಚಿಗೆ ಬಲಿಯಾದ ಆ ಕೈದಿಯನ್ನು ಹೇಗಾದರೂ ಮಾಡಿ ಭೇಟಿಯಾಗಲು ಕಾರ್ನ್ಯೆವ್ ನಿರ್ಧರಿಸುತ್ತಾರೆ. ಪ್ರಾಮಾಣಿಕ ಅಧಿಕಾರಿಯಾದ ಇವರಿಗೆ ಈ ಪ್ರಕರಣದಲ್ಲಿ ಯಾವುದೋ ದೊಡ್ಡ ಕುತಂತ್ರ ಅಡಗಿದೆ ಎಂಬ ಅನುಮಾನ ಶುರುವಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ನ್ಯಾಯಕ್ಕಾಗಿ ಅವರು ನಡೆಸುವ ಹುಡುಕಾಟ ಅವರನ್ನು ಮಾಸ್ಕೋದ ಅಟಾರ್ನಿ ಜನರಲ್ ಕಚೇರಿಯವರೆಗೂ ಕೊಂಡೊಯ್ಯುತ್ತದೆ. ಸ್ಟಾಲಿನ್ ಕಾಲದ ಆ ಕ್ರೂರ ಆಡಳಿತದ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ, ಒಬ್ಬ ವ್ಯಕ್ತಿ ವ್ಯವಸ್ಥೆಯ ವಿರುದ್ಧ ನಡೆಸುವ ಅಪಾಯಕಾರಿ ಹೋರಾಟದ ಕಥೆ ಇದು.
films.cast: Aleksandr Kuznetsov, Anatoliy Beliy, Aleksandr Filippenko
films.awardsWon: Valladolid IFF (FIPRESCI Prize)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Palme d'Or), Warsaw IFF (Encounters : Polish Film Institute Award)

films.title: VANILLA
films.synopsis: In late 1980s Mexico, eight-year-old Roberta watches her family of seven women fight to save their home from mounting debt, a struggle that reshapes how she sees herself and those around her.
films.producer: Stacy Perskie, Karla Luna Cantú, Andrea Porras Madero, Paloma Petra
films.cast: Aurora Dávila, Fernanda Baca, Rosy Rojas, María Castellá, Natalia Plascencia, Paloma Petra, Lola Ochoa
films.awardsWon: Venice FF (Authors under 40 Award Best Screenplay), Morelia IFF (Audience Award), Huelva Ibero-American FF (Best Director)
films.awardsNominated: São Paulo IFF (New Filmmakers Competition), Morelia IFF (Best Feature Film)

films.title: WE BELIEVE YOU
films.synopsis: Today, Alice stands before a judge and there’s no room for error. She must speak up for her children, as custody is being called into question. Can she protect them from their father before it’s too late?
films.sound: Antoine Petit, Liza Thiennot, Arthur Meeus de Kemmeter
films.cast: Myriem Akheddiou, Laurent Capelluto, Narali Broods
films.awardsWon: Berlin IFF (Special Mention), Seville European FF (Best Film, Best Actress, Women in Focus Award)
films.awardsNominated: Berlin FF (Best First Feature), Zurich FF (Best International Feature Film)

films.title: WHAT DOES THAT NATURE SAY TO YOU
films.synopsis: A young poet drives his girlfriend to her parents’ imposing home and is unexpectedly drawn into their world. After meeting her father, mother, and sister, a casual visit stretches into a full day of shared meals, drinks, and wandering conversations. As time drifts on, small gestures and offhand remarks reveal unspoken tensions, desires, and misunderstandings, turning an ordinary encounter into a quietly revealing study of relationships, intimacy, and chance.
films.kannadaTitle:
A young poet drives his girlfriend to her parents’ imposing home and is unexpectedly drawn into their world. After meeting her father, mother, and sister, a casual visit stretches into a full day of shared meals, drinks, and wandering conversations. As time drifts on, small gestures and offhand remarks reveal unspoken tensions, desires, and misunderstandings, turning an ordinary encounter into a quietly revealing study of relationships, intimacy, and chance.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಯುವ ಕವಿಯೊಬ್ಬ ತನ್ನ ಗೆಳತಿಯನ್ನು ಅವಳ ಪೋಷಕರ ಭವ್ಯವಾದ ಮನೆಗೆ ಕರೆದೊಯ್ಯುತ್ತಾನೆ ಹಾಗು ಅನಿರೀಕ್ಷಿತವಾಗಿ ಅವರ ಪ್ರಪಂಚದೊಳಗೆ ಸೆಳೆಯಲ್ಪಡುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಅವಳ ತಂದೆ, ತಾಯಿ ಮತ್ತು ಸಹೋದರಿಯನ್ನು ಭೇಟಿಯಾದ ನಂತರ, ಒಂದು ಸಾಮಾನ್ಯ ಭೇಟಿಯು ಊಟ, ಪಾನೀಯ ಮತ್ತು ಸುದೀರ್ಘ ಸಂಭಾಷಣೆಗಳ ಒಂದು ಪೂರ್ಣ ದಿನವಾಗಿ ವಿಸ್ತರಿಸುತ್ತದೆ. ಸಮಯ ಉರುಳಿದಂತೆ, ಸಣ್ಣ ಸನ್ನೆಗಳು ಮತ್ತು ಪ್ರಾಸಂಗಿಕ ಮಾತುಗಳು ಅಲ್ಲಿನ ಅಲಿಖಿತ ಉದ್ವಿಗ್ನತೆಗಳು, ಆಸೆಗಳು ಮತ್ತು ತಪ್ಪು ತಿಳುವಳಿಕೆಗಳನ್ನು ಅನಾವರಣಗೊಳಿಸುತ್ತವೆ. ಈ ಮೂಲಕ ಒಂದು ಸಾಮಾನ್ಯ ಭೇಟಿಯು ಸಂಬಂಧಗಳು, ಆಪ್ತತೆ ಮತ್ತು ಆಕಸ್ಮಿಕಗಳ ಬಗೆಗಿನ ಆಳವಾದ ಅಧ್ಯಯನವಾಗಿ ಬದಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ.
films.cast: Ha Seong-guk, Kwon Hae-hyo, Cho Yun-hee, Kang Soyi, Miso Park
films.awardsNominated: Berlin IFF (Golden Bear), Karlovy Vary IFF (Official Selection), Vancouver IFF (Official Selection), Chicago IFF (Official Selection), Ghent FF (Official Selection), Melbourne IFF (Official Screening)

films.title: WHERE THE WIND COMES FROM
films.synopsis: On the outskirts of Tunis, lifelong friends Alyssa, fierce and impulsive, and Mehdi, a gentle aspiring artist, feel trapped by limited prospects. When Alyssa discovers a national art competition in Djerba that could change everything, she drags Mehdi onto an unplanned road trip across Tunisia. As they cross cities, deserts, and coastlines, the journey becomes a test of class, courage, and loyalty. Dreams collide with reality, resentments surface, and their friendship is stretched to breaking point. Both must decide whether escape means running away, or finally choosing who they want to become in a restless country searching for direction today.
films.producer: Asma Chiboub, Karim Aitouna, Haut les mains Productions, Atlas Vision
films.cast: Eya Bellagha, Slim Baccar
films.awardsWon: El Gouna FF (Golden Star - Best Arab Narrative Film) Toronto Arab FF, (Jury Prize - Best Feature Film), Mediterrane FF (Golden Bee Award - Best Feature Film)
films.awardsNominated: Sundance FF (Grand Jury Prize - World Cinema - Dramatic), La Roche-sur-Yon IFF(Compétition internationale - Grand Prix du Jury), San Francisco IFF (Golden Gate Award - New Director), El Gouna FF (Golden Star - Feature Narrative Competition)

films.title: WIND, TALK TO ME
films.synopsis: Stefan reunites with his family to celebrate his grandmother’s birthday for the first time after his mother’s recent passing. This homecoming, driven by his urge to complete a film about his mother and an attempt to make amends by rescuing a stray dog, will ignite an introspective journey for Stefan. Inspired by the director’s real-life experiences and starring his actual family members in a mission to complete a lake house and a film, WIND, TALK TO ME is an intimate cinematic exploration of the timeless mother-son relationship.
films.producer: Dragana Jovovic, Stefan Djordjevic, Stefan Ivancic, Ognjen Glavonic
films.cast: Negrica Djordjevic, Stefan Djordjevic, Bosko Djordjevic, Djordje Davidovic, Budimir Jovanovic, Ljiljana Jovanovic, Ana Petrovic, Marina Davidovic, Vidak Davidovic, Jakov Miahjlovic, Jana Mihajlovic, dog Lija
films.awardsWon: Vancouver IFF (Vanguard Award), Valdivia IFF (International Competition)
films.awardsNominated: International FF Rotterdam (Tiger Competition), Chicago IFF (New Directors Competition), Munich FF (CineVision Competition), IndieLisboa International Independent FF (International Competition), Viennale (Screening), São Paulo IFF (Screening)

films.title: YOUNG MOTHERS
films.synopsis: 1997. Eight-year-old Linda drifts from her wealthy grandmother’s Swiss villa with her carefree mother, Eva. In Italy, they meet sisters Azzurra and Marta. A chance summer encounter binds the three girls in a gang to protect each other, their youth, and freedom. Around them swirl selfish parents chasing fragile dreams, gossiping neighbors, and a queer babysitter searching for belonging in a homophobic world.
films.producer: Jean-Pierre et Luc Dardenne, Delphine Tomson, Denis Freyd
films.cast: Babette Verbeek, Elsa Houben, Janaina Halloy Fokan, Lucie Laruelle, Samia Hilmi
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Best Screenplay Award)
films.awardsNominated: Sydney FF (Australian Premiere), Busan IFF (Icon Section), 98th Academy Award (Official Selection)

films.title: DANCING IN THE DUST
films.synopsis: Set in Côte d’Ivoire, this lively comedy follows Demi-God, a wealthy pineapple magnate with five wives who believes his carefully ordered polygamous household is perfectly balanced. Confident in his authority, he decides to take yet another wife, convinced that it will bring greater harmony. Instead, the arrival of Binta, a spirited young woman forced into the marriage after clashing with tradition, throws his world into chaos. As old customs collide with modern attitudes, the film uses sharp humor to explore greed, power, arranged marriage, and polygamy, offering a playful yet pointed look at changing social values.
films.cast: Bamba Bakary, Hanny Tchelly, Thérèse Taba, Anne Kabou, Sy Savane Naky, Victor Cousin, Jeanne Banc
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Official Selection - Classics), Locarno International FF (Official Selection - Retrospective), New Directors New Film (Official Selection), Francophone FF of Greece (Official Selection)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: LE FRANC
films.synopsis: Marigo, a struggling musician, dreams of reclaiming his beloved congoma, which his landlady has seized due to his unpaid rent. When he comes into possession of a lottery ticket, he treats it as his one chance at freedom and carefully hides it while waiting for the draw. As hope and desperation intertwine, Marigo clings to the possibility that a stroke of luck might change his fate and allow him to recover both his instrument and his dignity.
films.music: Dieye Ma Dieye, Issa Cissokho, Moussa N'Diaye
films.cast: Dieye Ma Dieye, Aminata Fall, Demba Bâ
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Official Selection - Directors' Fortnight), Berlin IFF (Official Selection - Retrospective), Locarno IFF (World Premiere), New York FF (Official Selection - Retrospective)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: LIFE IS ROSY
films.synopsis: La Vie est belle, is a musical comedy set against the pulsating music scene of Kinshasa. The film follows a rags-to-riches journey of a poor rural musician, played by legendary Congolese artist Papa Wemba, widely known as the King of Rumba Rock, who arrives in the city dreaming of fame and success. Marking a significant shift in Congolese cinema, the film adopted a more artistic and celebratory tone, rather than focusing on colonial trauma, it foregrounds urban life, music, and Congolese cultural vitality. The soundtrack features leading artists like Tshala Muana, Klody, and Zaiko Langa Langa.
films.screenplay: Benoît Lamy, Mweze Ngangura, Maryse León García
films.music: Papa Wemba, Klody, Zaïko Langa Langa, Tashala Muana
films.cast: Papa Wemba, Bibi Krubwa, Landu Nzunzimbu Matshia
films.awardsWon: Ghent FF (Georges Delerue Prize - Best Music), Taormina IFF (Best Actress Award - Bronze Mask)
films.awardsNominated: São Paulo IFF (Official Selection), Film Forum (American Premiere)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: NATIONALITY: IMMIGRANT
films.synopsis: Sidi, a Mauritanian worker living in France, endures the harsh reality faced by many immigrants. Assigned the most dangerous and exhausting jobs, he and his fellow workers are exploited not only by employers but also by middlemen from their own community, who profit through fake work permits and overcrowded, overpriced housing. Confronted daily with racism and economic injustice, the workers gradually begin to unite. What starts as silent endurance turns into collective resistance, as they organize to challenge the system that profits from their vulnerability and demand dignity, rights, and fair treatment.
films.producer: GREC – Film Research and Experimentation Group, Ethnographic Film Committee – CFE, SERDDAV (CNRS)
films.cinematography: Étienne Carton de Grammont, Frédéric Variot
films.cast: Sidney Sokhona, Sally N'Dongo, Jacques Ruisseau, Constant Hames, Franck Valmont, Denis Parichon

films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Official Selection), IFF Rotterdam (Official Selection), Marrakesh IFF (Official Selection), Francophone FF Greece (Official Selection)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: SAMBA TRAORÉ
films.synopsis: After a petrol station robbery ends in bloodshed, Samba Traoré escapes with a suitcase full of stolen money and disappears. Years later, he returns to his native village, hoping to leave his violent past behind. Life there seems unchanged, and Saratou, the woman he once loved, still holds his attention. Yet beneath the calm surface, guilt and memory linger. As Samba tries to rebuild his life and start anew, the weight of his past slowly closes in, revealing how old crimes and buried mistakes inevitably resurface.
films.screenplay: Idrissa Ouedraogo, Jacques Arhex, Santiago Amigorena
films.cast: Bakary Sangaré, Mariam Kaba, Abdoulaye Komboudri
films.awardsWon: Berlin IFF (Grand Jury Prize)
films.awardsNominated: Locarno (Official Selection - Restored Classics), Melbourne IFF (Official Selection)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: TABATABA
films.synopsis: Tabataba tells the story of a small Malagasy village during the independence uprising which took place in 1947 in the south of the country. For several months, part of the Malagasy population revolted against the French colonial army.
films.cinematography: Gilles Arnaud, Véronique Patte, Bruno Privat
films.cast: Saotody, Lucien Dakadisy, François Botozandry, Soavelo, Rasoa, Philippe Nathourn
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF (Audience Award), Festival de Taormina (Prix du Jury), Journées cinématographiques de Carthage (Prix de la première œuvre)
films.awardsNominated: Festival Lumière (Official Selection - Restored Classics)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: TALKING ABOUT TREES
films.synopsis: Filmmakers Ibrahim, Suliman, Eltayeb, and Manar are longtime friends who left Sudan in the 1960s and 1970s to study cinema abroad. Years later, after lives shaped by exile and distance, they reunite through the Sudanese Film Group, founded in 1989. Bound by a shared passion and unfinished dreams, they return home with a single goal: to revive cinema in Sudan. Their plan is to reopen the long-abandoned Halfaia Cinema in Khartoum, transforming a crumbling theater into a symbol of cultural renewal, memory, and resistance through film.
films.producer: Marie Balducchi, Mahamat-Saleh Haroun, Melanie Andernach, Jeremy Delpon, Benjamin Delboy
films.cast: Ibrahim Shaddad, Suliman Mohamed Ibrahim Elnour, Eltayeb Mahdi, Manar al Hilo, Hana Abdelrahman Suliman
