films.awardsNominated: BFI London FF(Official Selection), Vancouver IFF (Official Selection), Stockholm IFF (Official Selection), Tallinn Black Nights FF (Official Selection)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: THE CEMETERY OF CINEMA
films.synopsis: Believed to be the first film ever made in Guinea, MOURAMANI becomes the starting point for filmmaker Thierno Souleymane Diallo’s personal investigation into the country’s cinematic past. Curious about the film’s production and the fate of its missing print, he travels across Guinea, meeting archivists and witnesses who remember the era. Filming his own journey—on foot, barefoot, or riding a donkey—Diallo documents everyday life alongside forgotten cinema halls and neglected archives. Blending observation, performance, and re-enactment, the film unfolds as a layered road journey through a nation once central to African cinema, now slowly reconnecting with its cultural memory.
films.producer: Maud Martin, Jean-Pierre Lagrange, Marie-Louise Sarr, Alpha Amadou Diouldé Diallo
films.cast: Thierno Souleymane Diallo, Penda Lam, Aboubacar Condé, Moussa Doumbouya, Alkaly Kaba, Bohla Lanciné Condé, Alpha Oumar Sow, Mamadi Traoré, Ibrahima Sory Tounkara
films.awardsWon: Afrika FF Köln (People's Choice Award)
films.awardsNominated: Berlinale IFF (World Premiere)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: THE CHAPEL
films.synopsis: Set in the 1930s, the film follows a remote village where men devoted to ancestral traditions seek only a quiet, peaceful life. When an evangelical mission establishes a school, pressure mounts on the villagers to build a chapel. As construction stalls, the impatient priest leans on the sacristan and the village chief to assert control. The arrival of a young, progressive teacher and the schoolmaster’s hostility deepen existing tensions, allowing the priest to tighten his grip. The story unfolds as a subtle exploration of power, belief, and the clash between tradition, religion, and colonial authority.
films.cast: Alphonse D'Oliviera, Segolo Dia Manungu, Albert M'Bou, Gaston Samba
films.awardsWon: FESPACO (Prize of Authenticity)
films.awardsNominated: Film at Lincoln Center (New York Premiere),  Festival des 3 Continents (Official Selection)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: THE LITTLE GIRL WHO SOLD THE SUN
films.synopsis: Sili is a young girl living on the streets, moving on crutches after polio left her unable to walk. Rejected and bullied by the boys who sell newspapers, she refuses to accept a life of begging. Determined to claim her place, Sili decides to sell newspapers herself, insisting on dignity and equal rights. As she navigates the harsh, unforgiving world of street life, she encounters both cruelty and unexpected solidarity. Shot on real streets with the participation of street children, the film offers a powerful, grounded portrait of resilience, survival, and self-determination.
films.kannadaTitle: ದ ಲಿಟಲ್ ಗರ್ಲ್ ಹೂ ಸೋಲ್ಡ್ ದ ಸನ್
films.cast: Aminata Fall, Moussa Baldé, Lissa Balera, Dieynaba Laam, Tayerou M'Baye, Martin N'Gom, Oumou Samb
films.awardsWon: Namur IFF (Special Jury Award), Chicago International Children's FF (Adult's Jury Award)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Official Selection - Directors' Fortnight), IFF Rotterdam (Premiere), Berlin IFF (Official Selection), Toronto IFF (Official Selection)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: TUG OF WAR
films.synopsis: Set in the final years of British colonial rule in Zanzibar, this coming-of-age political love story follows Denge, a young freedom fighter, whose path crosses with Yasmin- an Indian-Zanzibari woman on her way to an arranged marriage. Their chance meeting sparks an intense bond shaped by desire, fear, and rising resistance. As personal longing collides with the momentum of revolution; love becomes inseparable from politics forcing both to confront the cost of freedom, loyalty, and choice in a society on the edge of change.
films.screenplay: Jenna Cato Bass, Amil Shivji, Simon Rieber
films.cast: Gudrun Columbus Mwanyika, Ikhlas Gafur Vora, Siti Amina, Luqman Thani, Rasheed Hemed, Nick Reding, Gabo Zigamba, Salum Suleiman,  Abubakr Mrisho
films.awardsWon: Seattle IFF (Winner - Special Jury Prize in New Directors Competition)
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF (World Premiere), Locarno IFF (Official Selection), Toronto Black FF (Official Selection)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: TWENTY YEARS OF AFRICAN CINEMA
films.synopsis: This documentary traces two decades of African cinema through conversations with filmmakers and carefully chosen excerpts from eighteen landmark films. By weaving together personal reflections and film history, it offers a clear, engaging portrait of how African cinema evolved during this period. Its themes, struggles, and creative breakthroughs make the journey accessible to both new audiences and seasoned cinephiles.
films.cast: Med Hondo,Ousmane Sembène, Jean-Pierre Dikongue-pipa, Safi Faye, Oumarou Ganda, Ola Balogun, Souleymane Cissé, Caston Kabore
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Un Certain Regards - Nominations)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: WENDEMI, THE GOOD LORD'S CHILD
films.synopsis: Abandoned at birth by his unwed mother, Wendemi has lived with unanswered questions for twenty years. Now an adult and in love, he hopes to marry, but the absence of his mother and the mystery of his origins stand in his way. Determined to confront the past, he travels to the capital in search of the woman who abandoned him—the only person who can reveal the truth about his birth. His journey becomes both a physical search and an emotional reckoning, shaped by memory, longing, and the need for belonging.
films.cast: Sylvain Minonugou Sylvie Yameogo Alassane Dakissaga Abdoulaye Komboudri Sotigui Kouyaté
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Un Certain Regards - Nominations)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: BLUE MOON
films.synopsis: On the evening of March 31, 1943, legendary lyricist Lorenz Hart confronts his shattered self-confidence in Sardi’s bar as his former collaborator Richard Rodgers celebrates the opening night of his ground-breaking hit musical “Oklahoma!”
films.producer: Mike Blizzard, John Sloss, Richard Linklater
films.cast: Ethan Hawke, Margaret Qualley, Bobby Cannavale, Andrew Scott
films.awardsWon: Berlin IFF (Silver Bear for Best Supporting Performance) ,Boston Society of Film Critics Awards (Best Original Screenplay, Best Actor)
films.awardsNominated: Viennale (Special Screening), Golden Globes (USA) (Best Motion Picture: Musical or Comedy)

films.title: FAMILY PATTABIC
films.synopsis: FAMILY PATTABIC is a documentary on the life and legacy of filmmaker Pattabhiram Reddy, a native of Nellore, Andhra Pradesh. In 1970, he produced and directed the Kannada classic SAMSKARA, a landmark film based on the novel of the same name by Jnanpith Award–winning writer U. R. Ananthamurthy. SAMSKARA won the President’s Gold Medal for Best Film and received several international film festival awards, creating history in Kannada cinema. This documentary traces Pattabhiram Reddy’s journey and explores the making of this path-breaking film that changed the course of Kannada filmmaking.

films.title: PETER HUJAR'S DAY
films.synopsis: On December 19, 1974, writer Linda Rosenkrantz sits with her friend, photographer Peter Hujar, in a quiet New York apartment and asks him to recount the previous day in precise detail. What unfolds is a candid, fragmented portrait of an artist - witty, erotically frank, and deeply vulnerable. Around their stillness echoes 1970s New York: a portrait session with Allen Ginsberg, a call with Susan Sontag, fleeting encounters and gestures. Drawn from transcripts rediscovered in 2019, Ira Sachs shapes a tender portrait of a city, an era and the act of being truly seen.
films.cast: Ben Whishaw, Rebecca Hall
films.awardsWon: Gijón IFF (Best Actor)
films.awardsNominated: Berlin IFF (Best Feature Film), Karlovy Vary IFF (Horizons), Sundance FF (Official Selection), Film Independent Spirit Awards (Best Feature, Best Director, Best Cinematography)

films.title: THE EPIC POET
films.synopsis: MAHAKAVI is a Historical Film based on Poets concepts of Pampa who express in his work. Pampa is the first epic poet of the Kannada Language. An important scripture regarding him has been discovered in Andhra Pradesh. He lived in the 10th century, when he composed two epic poems called Aadi Purana and Vikramaarjuna Vijaya. Of these Vikramaarjuna Vijaya has become popular as Pampas Bharata. In this epic he has told the story of Mahabharata in different. Aadi Purana encapsulates the famous history and legends of Jainism.
films.cast: Kishor, Anusha Rai, Kumar Govind, Sundar Raj, Pramila Joshai, Sundar Raj Urs, Akanksh.M. Baragur, Sheela Sindhu, Raghav

films.title: THE GREAT ARCH
films.synopsis: 1982. French President François Mitterrand decides to launch an international architectural competition for the flagship project of his mandate: The Great Arch of La Défense, aligned with the Louvre and the Arc de Triomphe. Against all odds, Otto von Spreckelsen, a Danish architect, wins the competition. Overnight, this 53-year-old man, unknown in France, arrives in Paris where he is propelled at the helm of this pharaonic project. While the architect intends to build the Great Arch exactly as he envisioned, his ideas quickly clash with realistic constraints and the vicissitudes of politics.
films.sound: Julien Sicart Tan-Ham, Sarah Lelu, Eddie Simonsen, Johannes Rasmus Rose
films.cast: Claes Bang, Michel Fau, Sidse Babett Knudsen, Xavier Dolan, Swann Arlaud
films.awardsWon: France Odeon French FF (Florence - Feuille d'or Best Film, Best Sound Track)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF (Un certain regard), Lumière Awards 2026 (Best Film, Best Director, Best Actor, Best Screenplay), Busan IFF (Official Screening), Rome FF (Freestyle)

films.title: CAIRO STATION
films.synopsis: Qinawi, a physically challenged peddler who makes his living selling newspapers in the central Cairo train station, is obsessed with Hanuma, an attractive young woman who sells drinks. While she jokes with him about a possible relationship, she is actually in love with Abu Siri, a strong and respected porter at the station who is struggling to unionize his fellow workers to combat their boss’ exploitative and abusive treatment.
films.screenplay: Abdel Hay Adib, Mohamed Abou Youssef
films.cast: Youssef Chahine, Hend Rostom, Farid Chawki
films.awardsNominated: Berlin IFF 1958 (Golden Bear), Locarno IFF 1996 (Retrospective), Karlovy Vary IFF 2019 (Retrospective)

films.title: RUDAALI
films.synopsis: In a desert village in Rajasthan, Shanichari is a woman cursed by a lifetime of misfortune who is unable to shed a single tear. When she is mentored by a veteran "Rudaali", a professional mourner hired to weep at funerals of the elite, she eventually confronts her suppressed grief and finds her voice through a tragic personal revelation.
films.cast: Dimple Kapadia, Rakhee Gulzar, Raj Babbar, Amjad Khan, Raghubir Yadav, Sushmita Mukherjee, Manohar Singh, Mita Vasisht, Ravi Jhankal.
films.awardsWon: National Film Awards (Best Actress, Best Art  Direction, Best Costume Design). 38th Asia-Pacific FF (Best Music Director, Best Actress).
films.awardsNominated: 38th Asia-Pacific FF, 8th Damascus IFF.

films.title: ANMOL- LOVINGLY OURS
films.synopsis: The joy of a couple becoming parents is shaken when an unexpected truth about their newborn’s gender identity confronts them with fear, love, and their own deeply held beliefs about what “normal” means.
films.cast: Biswajeet Daas , Vaishnavi Ratna Prashant, Nishank Verma, Sharat Sonu, Arika Jain, Vidhaan Jain
films.awardsNominated: Kolkata IFF (Best Indian Film)

films.title: CALLE MÁLAGA
films.synopsis: Maria Angeles, a 79-year-old Spanish woman, lives alone in Tangier, Morocco, and enjoys her daily routine. However, her life is turned upside down when her daughter arrives from Madrid to sell the apartment in which she has always lived. Determined to stay, she does everything she can to get her home and her belongings back and, unexpectedly, rediscovers love and sensuality.
films.producer: Nabil Ayouch, Amine Benjelloun, Jean-Rémi Ducourtioux, Simón de Santiago, Fernando Bovaira, Fred Burle, Sol Bondy and Sebastian Schelenz
films.cast: Carmen Maura, Marta Etura, Ahmed Boulane, María Alfonsa Rosso
films.awardsWon: Venice FF (Audience Award), Denver FF (Audience)
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF (Official Selection), London BFI (Official Selection), Oscars (Moroccan entry)

films.title: COTTON QUEEN
films.synopsis: In a cotton-farming village in Sudan, teenage Nafisa is raised on heroic tales of battling British colonizers told by her grandmother, the village matriarch Al-Sit. But when a young businessman arrives from abroad with a new development plan and genetically engineered cotton, Nafisa becomes the center of a power play to determine the future of the village. Awakening to her own strength, Nafisa sets out to save the cotton fields – and herself. Neither she nor her community will ever be the same again.
films.editor: Amparo Mejías, Simon Blasi, Frank Müller
films.cast: Mihad Murtada, Rabha Mohamed Mahmoud, Talaat Fareed
films.awardsWon: Thessaloniki FF (Best Feature Film, Best Music Composer)
films.awardsNominated: Venice FF (Best Film), SCHLINGEL IFF (Best Youth Film), Chicago IFF (New Directors Competition)

films.title: ELFRIEDE JELINEK: LANGUAGE UNLEASHED
films.synopsis: A portrait of Elfriede Jelinek, the provocative Austrian writer who became the country’s first Nobel Laureate in Literature in 2004. Drawing on archive footage, interviews, and voiceovers, the film unfolds from Jelinek’s own perspective, tracing her radical relationship with language. Rebel, feminist, communist, enfant terrible and uncompromising artist, Jelinek emerges as a figure who weaponised words to confront power, patriarchy, and national mythmaking. The film captures her brilliance and vulnerability, revealing how language itself becomes her primary site of resistance and creation.
films.cast: Elfriede Jelinek, Sophie Rois, Stefanie Reinsperger, Sandra Hüller, Martin Wuttke, Maren Kroymann, Ilse Ritter
films.awardsWon: Munich FF 2022 (FIPRESCI Prize of the International Film Critics), Austrian Film Award 2023 (Best Documentary), German Film Awards 2023 (Best Documentary)
films.awardsNominated: Austrian Film Award 2023 (Best Editing, Best Cinematography), German Film Awards 2023 (Best Editing), CPH:DOX 2023 (Official Selection), Göteborg FF 2023 (Official Selection)

films.title: INVISIBLES
films.synopsis: An escort questions her life until a client with a disability makes her confront who she is and who she might become.
films.cast: Nadia Essadiqi, Catherine Bérubé, Stéphane Crête, Floyd Lapierre-Poupart, Victor Trelles Turgeon
films.awardsWon: Cinemania FF (Best Quebec Film)
films.awardsNominated: Tallinn Black Nights FF (Selection)

films.title: MOSQUITOES
films.synopsis: 1997. Eight-year-old Linda drifts from her wealthy grandmother’s Swiss villa with her carefree mother, Eva. In Italy, they meet sisters Azzurra and Marta. A chance summer encounter binds the three girls in a gang to protect each other, their youth, and freedom. Around them swirl selfish parents chasing fragile dreams, gossiping neighbors, and a queer babysitter searching for belonging in a homophobic world.
films.producer: Daniele Esposito, Michela Pini, Olga Lamontanara, Marco Colombo,Nicola Rosada, Guillaume Marien
films.screenplay: Maria Sole Limodio, Valentina Bertani, Nicole Bertani
films.cast: Mia Ferricelli, Agnese Scazza, Petra Scheggia, Clara Tramontano, Milutin Dapčević, Jessica Piccolo Valerani
films.awardsWon: Locarno IFF (Young Jury Special Mention)
films.awardsNominated: Thessaloniki IFF (Open Horizons), Ankara FF (Fresh Start), Carbonia FF (Special Mention)

films.title: PERLA
films.synopsis: In 1981 Vienna, Perla, an exiled artist and single mother, struggles to support her daughter, Julia, a talented young pianist. When Julia’s father, Andrej, claims to be seriously ill, Perla makes the dangerous journey back to communist Czechoslovakia, only to discover that he wants to force his way back into their lives. Pulled between past and present, Perla begins making reckless choices that jeopardise her future with her daughter.
films.cast: Rebeka Poláková, Simon Schwarz, Carmen Diego, Noël Czuczor, Hilde Dalik
films.awardsWon: IFF Art Film (FIPRESCI Prize, Best Director, Best Female Performance), Leeds IFF, England (Best Film), Diagonale IFF (Most Popular Film), Viennale IFF (Best Austrian Film)
films.awardsNominated: Karlovy Vary IFF (Feature Film), Munich FF (Best International Film), IFFR (Emerging Director), Stockholm FF (Best Film)
films.filmCourtesy: Austrian Embassy New Delhi, Austrian Cultural Forum

films.title: THE IVY
films.synopsis: Azucena, a woman in her thirties, approaches Julio, a teenage boy living in a group home, for reasons he doesn’t understand. As they spend time together, an uneasy closeness grows, changing the shape of a bond neither expected to find.
films.producer: Joe Houlberg Silva, Alex de Icaza, Gabriela Maldonado, Montse Pujol Solà, Thierry Leunovel
films.editor: Gerard Borràs, Omar Guzmán, Ana Cristina Barragán
films.sound: Gisela Maestre Plaza, Juan José Luzuriaga, Jean-Guy Veran
films.cast: Simone Bucio, Francis Eddú Llumiquinga
films.awardsWon: Venice IFF (Best Screenplay), San Sebastián IFF (Special Mention), Bogotá IFF (Youth Award), Thessaloniki IFF (Open Horizons)
films.awardsNominated: Venice FF (Best Film)

films.title: THE NATURE OF INVISIBLE THINGS
films.synopsis: Gloria, a 10-year-old girl, is spending her vacation in the hospital with her mother, a hard working nurse. While exploring the facility, Gloria meets Sofia, a girl convinced that her great grandmother’s worsening health is a result of her hospital admission. Bonding over their shared desire to leave, the two girls find solace in each other’s company. As departure becomes inevitable, the girls and their mothers head to a countryside retreat to spend the final days of an unforgettable summer.
films.producer: Daniela Marinho, Rebeca Gutiérrez Campos, Otavio Chamorro, Rafaela Camelo
films.cast: Laura Brandão, Serena, Larissa Mauro, Camila Márdila, Aline Marta Maia.
films.awardsWon: Seattle IFF (Jury Special Mention - Ibero American Feature Film Competition), São Paulo IFF (Critics’ Award - Best Brazilian Feature, Prisma Queer Award - Best Brazilian Feature)
films.awardsNominated: Berlin IFF (Generation Kplus Competition), Busan International Kids and Youth FF, Seattle IFF (Ibero American Feature Film Competition), Palm Springs IFF (New Voices New Visions Competition).

films.title: KY NAM INN
films.synopsis: Set in post war Vietnam in 1985, Khang moves to Saigon after securing a job translating The Little Prince. Protected by family connections, he lives comfortably under the new regime until he meets Ky Nam, a reserved older widow in his neighborhood. Their encounter quietly unsettles his sense of stability, drawing him into an unexpected emotional journey that challenges his assumptions about love, loss, and belonging.
films.screenplay: Leon Lê, Nguyen Thi Minh Ngoc
films.cast: Liên Bỉnh Phát, Đỗ Thị Hải Yến, Phương Bình, Lý Kiều Hạnh, Trần Thế Mạnh, Ngo Hong Ngoc, Tu Quyen, Hồ Thành Trung, Nguyễn Thu Thắm, Lý Hồng Ân
films.awardsWon: Hawai‘i IFF (Shooting Star Award)
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF (World Premiere), Busan IFF(Official Selection: A Window on Asian Cinema), Palm Springs IFF (World Cinema Now)

films.title: ACCIDENT
films.synopsis: A drunk driving accident by Deepak, the privileged son of a powerful politician, kills homeless people sleeping on a footpath and sparks national outrage. His father uses his influence to suppress the investigation and control the media. Ravi, a journalist, refuses to let the truth be buried and begins his own pursuit of justice. As corruption and silence close in, the film becomes a tense confrontation between power and accountability, asking how far one can go when the system protects the guilty instead of the vulnerable
films.cast: Anant Nag, Shankar Nag, Arundathi Nag, T. S. Nagabharana, Ashok Mandanna, Srinivasa Prabhu, Ramesh Bhat
films.awardsWon: National Film Awards 1984 (Best Film on Social Issues), Karnataka State Film Awards 1984-85 (Best Film, Best Supporting Actress, Best Screenplay, Best Sound Recording, Special Award for Stunts)

films.title: KOORMAVATARA
films.synopsis: Anand Rao, a retiring government clerk in Karnataka, lives a quiet, unremarkable life until his striking resemblance to Mahatma Gandhi lands him a role in a television serial about the leader. As the show becomes popular, Rao enjoys sudden fame, money, and public admiration. But playing Gandhi forces him to confront the gap between merely imitating ideals and truly living them. The attention strains his family life and inner peace, pushing him to question authenticity, morality, and what it really means to embody the values he portrays on screen.
films.kannadaTitle:
Anand Rao, a retiring government clerk in Karnataka, lives a quiet, unremarkable life until his striking resemblance to Mahatma Gandhi lands him a role in a television serial about the leader. As the show becomes popular, Rao enjoys sudden fame, money, and public admiration. But playing Gandhi forces him to confront the gap between merely imitating ideals and truly living them. The attention strains his family life and inner peace, pushing him to question authenticity, morality, and what it really means to embody the values he portrays on screen.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಆನಂದ ರಾವ್ ಎಂಬ ನಿವೃತ್ತ ಹೊಂದುತ್ತಿರುವ ಕರ್ನಾಟಕದ ಒಬ್ಬ ಸರಕಾರಿ ನೌಕರನು ಶಾಂತ, ಸಾಮಾನ್ಯ ಜೀವನ ನಡೆಸುತ್ತಿರುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಅದು- ಮಹಾತ್ಮಾ ಗಾಂಧಿಯವರೊಂದಿಗೆ ಅವನ ಚಹರೆಯ ಗಮನಾರ್ಹ ಹೋಲಿಕೆಯು ಆತನಿಗೆ ಅವರ ಕುರಿತ ಒಂದು ಟಿವಿ ಧಾರಾವಾಹಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ಪಾತ್ರ ವಹಿಸುವಂತೆ ಮಾಡುವ ತನಕ ಮಾತ್ರ. ನಂತರ, ಧಾರವಾಹಿಯು ಜನಪ್ರಿಯವಾಗುತ್ತಿರುವಂತೆಯೇ ರಾವ್‌ ಖ್ಯಾತಿ, ಹಣ, ಜನರ ಮೆಚ್ಚುಗೆ ಎಲ್ಲವನ್ನೂ ಅನುಭವಿಸುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಆದರೆ, ಗಾಂಧೀಜಿಯ ಪಾತ್ರ ವಹಿಸುವುದು- ಕೇವಲ ಆದರ್ಶಗಳನ್ನು ಅನುಕರಿಸುವುದು ಮತ್ತು ಆ ಆದರ್ಶಗಳನ್ನು ನಿಜವಾಗಿಯೂ ಅನುಸರಿಸುವುದರ ನಡುವಿನ ಅಂತರವನ್ನು ಎದುರಿಸುವಂತೆ ಮಾಡುತ್ತದೆ. ಸಾರ್ವಜನಿಕ ಗಮನವು ಆತನ ಕೌಟುಂಬಿಕ ಜೀವನ ಮತ್ತು ಆಂತರಿಕ ಶಾಂತಿಯನ್ನು ಕದಡುತ್ತದೆ; ಸಾಚಾತನ, ನೈತಿಕತೆ ಮತ್ತು ತಾನು ಪರದೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಚಿತ್ರಿಸುವ ಮೌಲ್ಯಗಳನ್ನು ಹೊಂದಿರುವುದರ ನಿಜವಾದ ಅರ್ಥ ಏನು ಎಂದು ಅತ ಪ್ರಶ್ನಿಸುವಂತೆ ಮಾಡುತ್ತದೆ
films.cast: Shikaripura Krishnamurthy, Jayanthi, Apoorva Kasaravalli, Rashmi Hariprasad, Chasva, Harish Raju
films.awardsWon: National Film Awards (Best Kannada Film), Karnataka State Film Awards (Best Film, Best Story, Best Cinematography)

films.title: KRAURYA
films.synopsis: The story follows Rangajji, an elderly widow in a small village who finds joy in telling fantastical stories to local children. Her life is upended when her only son dies under mysterious circumstances, leaving her vulnerable and dependent. She moves in with distant relatives, but her presence is met with coldness and indifference rather than compassion.
films.cast: Renukamma Murugodu, Master Vishwas, H. G. Dattatreya, T. V. Gurumurthy, Ashok Hegde, Vijaya Ekkundi, and Swathi.
films.awardsWon: National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Kannada (1995), Karnataka State film Award (Second Best Film).
films.awardsNominated: IFF Rotterdam 2003 (Girish Kasaravalli Focus)

films.title: RIDING THE STALLION OF DREAM
films.synopsis: Set in a rural village, Kanasembo Kudureyaneri follows Irya, a gravedigger whose life is guided by his deep faith in Siddhas, wandering mystics believed to ensure salvation if their arrival coincides with a death. Through a non linear narrative shaped by dreams, omens, and village rituals, Irya begins to question his beliefs when signs fail and contradictions surface. As faith clashes with doubt, the film gently probes the thin line between belief and superstition, revealing how tradition, fear, and human self interest shape reality. It is a quiet, reflective meditation on faith, perception, and belonging.
films.cast: Vyjanath Biradar, Umashri, Sadashiv Brahmavar
films.awardsWon: National Film Awards 2010 (Best Screenplay, Best Feature Film), Asiatica Film Mediale (Italy), 2010 (NETPAC Award).
films.awardsNominated: London Indian FF 2025 (Official Selection)

films.title: THAAYI SAHEBA
films.synopsis: The film is based on the story of a Brahmin family during the pre-independence and post-independence periods of India. The protagonist, Narmada Thayi, is the second wife of Appa Sahib, a freedom fighter. The childless couple decide to adopt the child of Venkobanna, a close relative. Venkobanna has other plans in mind when he gives up his child for adoption. He calculates that his son will inherit the family's money and property
films.cast: Jayamala, Suresh Heblikar, Shivaram, Harish Raju, Bharath, Renukamma Murugodu, Basavaraj Murugodu, Sudha Belawadi, Vijaya Akundi, Rathi Manjunath, Deepa Rabakavi, Sunanda Kadapatti, Vishweshwara Surapura, Venkata Rao, H.G. Somashekar Rao
films.awardsWon: Filmfare Award 1999 (Best Film, Best Actress, Best Director), National Film Award 1998 (Special Jury, Best Feature Film, Best Producer, Best Art Director), Karnataka State Film Awards 1997-98 (Best Film, Best Actress, Best Story, Best Cinematographer)
films.awardsNominated: IFF Rotterdam 2003 (Girish Kasaravalli Focus)

films.title: FAMILT DEITY
films.synopsis: A brother and sister grow up in a poor village family weighed down by debt. To survive, they open a small tea stall near a bus stop and face daily struggles and ridicule. The brother gives up his education so his sister can continue studying and dream of a better future. Despite illness, hardship, and uncertainty, they remain united and determined. Over time, their honesty and hard work earn respect, and the humble tea stall slowly becomes the start of a more hopeful and dignified life.
films.cast: Gopal Naik, Lakshmi Somashekhar Naik, Sudhakar Naik, Rekha Bai

films.title: JEVANN
films.synopsis: A family comedy in the Konkani language, this film follows three friends working in a catering company as they chase their dreams and navigate everyday challenges. The story begins when one of them goes to meet a prospective bride, setting off a series of humorous and unexpected events. As they encounter deception, misunderstandings, and setbacks, the trio struggles to achieve their goals with the help of colorful characters around them. The film is the ninth production in the history of Saraswath Konkani GSB Konkani cinema.
films.cast: Satish Pai Kundapur, Santosh Pai, Kundapur,Radhesh Shenoy
films.awardsWon: HISSNA GLOBLE KONKANI FILM AWARD

films.title: NADUBETTU APPANNA
films.synopsis: NADUBETTU APPANNA is a story that revolves around a stingy and selfish person named Appanna and his family, who reside in a remote village named Dabbadka. After the incident of the attack of wild Elephants on his plantation, causing the death of his wife and son, a remarkable change sprouts in him, resulting in the generous donation of his property to the government.
films.cast: Nataraj Honnavalli Adoor Balakrishna kasaragod Vijay Hari Rai, Putturu Bhavani Shankar Adthale Gangadhar Nellikode Lokesh Oorubailu
films.awardsNominated: Kolkata IFF (Accredited by FIAPF), Mysore Dasara FF

films.title: SERENG
films.synopsis: The story follows Maghi Munda, a young indigenous girl who loses her parents to brutal violence and flees the city to survive on her own. She meets Seraj Ansari, a compassionate band musician, and begins working as a laborer carrying tube lights in wedding processions. With Seraj’s guidance, Maghi learns to play musical instruments and gradually gains confidence and independence. Against many obstacles, she builds a new life and earns respect in the male-dominated world of wedding bands.
films.producer: ULGULAN FILM PRODUCTION and ABHA FILMS CREATION
films.cast: Shweta Prajapti, Vivek Nayak, Nitesh Kachhap, Kajal Mundu

films.title: UMMATTAT
films.synopsis: Ummattat is a vibrant folk dance of the Kodava women from Coorg (Kodagu), Karnataka. Rooted in Kodava culture, it expresses joy, grace, and devotion, performed mainly during Kaveri Sankramana, celebrating the sacred river Kaveri’s origin. Dancers in traditional Kodava attire move in circles to cymbal beats (thala), singing devotional songs. One woman carries a brass kalasha symbolizing the river goddess Kaveri. The slow, circular steps represent harmony and life’s eternal cycle. Entirely led and performed by women, Ummattat highlights unity, community spirit, and reverence for nature. It stands as a living symbol of Kodava heritage and spiritual identity.
films.cast: K Prakash Kariappa, Bollajira Yamuna Aiyappa, Mukkattira Shilpa Nanjappa

films.title: WHISPERS OF THE MOUNTAINS
films.synopsis: In the rugged Aravali region, a struggling tea stall owner turns to mining to survive, unaware of the damage it will bring. As the land slowly erodes around him, his mute son feels torn between loyalty to his father and his love for nature. Unable to protest with words, the boy begins a quiet rebellion, secretly planting trees to heal the wounded hills. Amid growing environmental destruction, his small, determined acts become a fragile but powerful symbol of hope.
films.cast: Harshant Sharma, Rajveer Rao, Kunal Mehta
films.awardsNominated: IFFI (Indian Panaroma Section), Kolkata IFF (Competition on Indian Language’s Films)

films.title: CLEO FROM 5 TO 7
films.synopsis: CLÉO FROM 5 TO 7 follows Florence, a young singer known professionally as “Cléo Victoire,” over a brief stretch of time on June 21, from 5 p.m. to 6:30 p.m., as she waits for the results of a biopsy that may confirm stomach cancer. As she moves through Paris, meeting friends and strangers, moments of everyday life prompt reflection. As time passes, her playful confidence gives way to deeper self-awareness and vulnerability.
films.kannadaTitle:
CLÉO FROM 5 TO 7 follows Florence, a young singer known professionally as “Cléo Victoire,” over a brief stretch of time on June 21, from 5 p.m. to 6:30 p.m., as she waits for the results of a biopsy that may confirm stomach cancer. As she moves through Paris, meeting friends and strangers, moments of everyday life prompt reflection. As time passes, her playful confidence gives way to deeper self-awareness and vulnerability.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಈ ಸಿನಿಮಾವು 'ಕ್ಲಿಯೋ ವಿಕ್ಟೋರಿ' ಎಂಬ ಹೆಸರಿನಿಂದ ಪ್ರಖ್ಯಾತಳಾದ ಯುವ ಗಾಯಕಿ ಫ್ಲಾರೆನ್ಸ್ಳ ಬದುಕಿನ ಕೇವಲ ಒಂದೂವರೆ ಗಂಟೆಯ ಕಥೆಯನ್ನು ಹೇಳುತ್ತದೆ. ಜೂನ್ 21ರ ಸಂಜೆ 5 ರಿಂದ 6:30ರ ವರೆಗೆ, ತನಗೆ ಹೊಟ್ಟೆಯ ಕ್ಯಾನ್ಸರ್ ಇರಬಹುದೇ ಎಂಬ ಆತಂಕದಲ್ಲಿ ತನ್ನ ವೈದ್ಯಕೀಯ ವರದಿಯ ಫಲಿತಾಂಶಕ್ಕಾಗಿ ಕಾಯುತ್ತಿರುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಆ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಅವಳು ಪ್ಯಾರಿಸ್ ನಗರದ ಬೀದಿಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ಸುತ್ತುತ್ತಾ, ಗೆಳೆಯರನ್ನು ಮತ್ತು ಅಪರಿಚಿತರನ್ನು ಭೇಟಿಯಾಗುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಈ ಸಣ್ಣ ಪ್ರಯಾಣದಲ್ಲಿ ಅವಳು ಬದುಕಿನ ಬಗ್ಗೆ ಹೊಸದಾಗಿ ಆಲೋಚಿಸತೊಡಗುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಸಮಯ ಕಳೆದಂತೆ, ಕೇವಲ ವಿನೋದ ಮತ್ತು ಆತ್ಮವಿಶ್ವಾಸದಿಂದ ಕೂಡಿದ್ದ ಕ್ಲಿಯೋ, ತನ್ನೊಳಗಿನ ಭಯ ಮತ್ತು ಸೂಕ್ಷ್ಮತೆಯನ್ನು ಅರ್ಥ ಮಾಡಿಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಾ ಹೆಚ್ಚು ಗಂಭೀರವಾಗುತ್ತಾಳೆ.
films.cinematography: Jean Rabier, Paul Bonis, Alain Levent
films.sound: Jacques Maumont, Jean Labussière, Julien Coutelier
films.cast: Antoine Bourseiller, Corinne Marchand, Dominique Davray, Dorothée Blanck, Michel Legrand
films.awardsWon: French Syndicate of Cinema Critics 1963 (Best Film), OFTA 2022 (Best Film)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF 1962 (Palme d'Or)

films.title: GEHENU LAMAI
films.synopsis: Set in rural Sri Lanka, the movie tells the heartbreaking tale of two sisters whose dreams come to nought in the face of insurmountable class barriers. Kusum falls in love with Nimal, an upper-class boy in whose house she works. Nimal’s outraged mother fires Kusum, ending the couple’s romance. Her happy-go-lucky sister Soma’s dreams of becoming a beauty queen are shattered when she becomes pregnant. The story progresses as a lyrical exploration of the end of innocence and romantic dreams.
films.kannadaTitle:
Set in rural Sri Lanka, the movie tells the heartbreaking tale of two sisters whose dreams come to nought in the face of insurmountable class barriers. Kusum falls in love with Nimal, an upper-class boy in whose house she works. Nimal’s outraged mother fires Kusum, ending the couple’s romance. Her happy-go-lucky sister Soma’s  dreams of becoming a beauty queen are shattered when she becomes pregnant. The story progresses as a lyrical exploration of the end of innocence and romantic dreams.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಶ್ರೀಲಂಕಾದ ಹಳ್ಳಿಯೊಂದರಲ್ಲಿ ನಡೆಯುವ ಈ ಸಿನಿಮಾ, ಸಮಾಜದ ಶ್ರೀಮಂತ ಮತ್ತು ಬಡವರ ನಡುವಿನ ಗೋಡೆಯಿಂದಾಗಿ ಇಬ್ಬರು ಸಹೋದರಿಯರ ಕನಸುಗಳು ಹೇಗೆ ನುಚ್ಚುನೂರಾಗುತ್ತವೆ ಎಂಬ ಕರುಣಾಜನಕ ಕಥೆಯನ್ನು ಹೇಳುತ್ತದೆ. ಕುಸುಮ್ ಎಂಬ ಹುಡುಗಿ ತಾನು ಕೆಲಸ ಮಾಡುವ ಶ್ರೀಮಂತ ಮನೆತನದ ನಿಮಲ್ ಎಂಬುವವನನ್ನು ಪ್ರೀತಿಸುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಆದರೆ ವಿಷಯ ತಿಳಿದ ನಿಮಲ್‌ನ ತಾಯಿ ಕೋಪದಿಂದ ಕುಸುಮ್‌ಳನ್ನು ಕೆಲಸದಿಂದ ತೆಗೆದುಹಾಕುವ ಮೂಲಕ ಅವರ ಪ್ರೇಮಕಥೆಗೆ ಅಂತ್ಯ ಹಾಡುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಇತ್ತ ಕುಸುಮ್‌ಳ ಸಹೋದರಿ ಸೋಮಾ, ಸದಾ ಲವಲವಿಕೆಯಿಂದ ಇರುತ್ತಾ ತಾನು ಬ್ಯೂಟಿ ಕ್ವೀನ್ ಆಗಬೇಕೆಂದು ಕನಸು ಕಾಣುತ್ತಿರುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಆದರೆ ಅವಳು ಗರ್ಭಿಣಿಯಾದಾಗ ಅವಳ ಸುಂದರ ಕನಸುಗಳೆಲ್ಲಾ ಒಡೆದು ಹೋಗುತ್ತವೆ. ಈ ಸಿನಿಮಾವು ಮುಗ್ಧತೆ ಮತ್ತು ಪ್ರೀತಿಯ ಕನಸುಗಳು ಹೇಗೆ ನಿಧಾನವಾಗಿ ಕಮರಿ ಹೋಗುತ್ತವೆ ಎಂಬುದನ್ನು ಅತ್ಯಂತ ಸುಂದರವಾಗಿ ಮತ್ತು ಭಾವನಾತ್ಮಕವಾಗಿ ಚಿತ್ರಿಸುತ್ತದೆ.
films.cast: Vasanthi Chathurani, Ajith Jinadasa, Jenita Samaraweera, Shyama Ananda, Trilicia Gunawardena, Chitra Wakishta
films.awardsWon: London FF 2025 (Outstanding Film of the Year), National Awards - Sri Lanka 1979 (Presidential Film Awards- Merit award for her debut performance), O.C.I.C. Film Awards (Best Actress)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF 2025 (Official Selection- Cannes Classics)

films.title: HEMAVATHI
films.synopsis: Set in a rural landscape, the film explores the life of Hemavathi, a woman whose existence is deeply intertwined with the social traditions and agricultural rhythms of her village. It delves into the complexities of human relationships and the struggles against stagnant societal norms, capturing the lyrical yet harsh realities of life in 1970s rural Karnataka.
films.kannadaTitle:
Set in a rural landscape, the film explores the life of Hemavathi, a woman whose existence is deeply intertwined with the social traditions and agricultural rhythms of her village. It delves into the complexities of human relationships and the struggles against stagnant societal norms, capturing the lyrical yet harsh realities of life in 1970s rural Karnataka.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಗ್ರಾಮೀಣ ಪರಿಸರದ ಹಿನ್ನೆಲೆಯಲ್ಲಿರುವ ಈ ಚಿತ್ರ, ಹೇಮಾವತಿ ಎಂಬಾಕೆಯ ಬದುಕಿನ ಸುತ್ತ ಸಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಅವಳ ಜೀವನವು ಆ ಊರಿನ ಕೃಷಿ ಮತ್ತು ಅಲ್ಲಿನ ಆಚಾರ-ವಿಚಾರಗಳೊಂದಿಗೆ ಬೆಸೆದುಕೊಂಡಿರುತ್ತದೆ. ಬದಲಾಗದ ಹಳೆಯ ಕಾಲದ ಕಟ್ಟುಪಾಡುಗಳ ನಡುವೆ ಅವಳು ಪಡುವ ಕಷ್ಟಗಳು ಮತ್ತು ಜನರ ನಡುವಿನ ಸಂಕೀರ್ಣ ಸಂಬಂಧಗಳ ಬಗ್ಗೆ ಈ ಚಿತ್ರ ಮಾತನಾಡುತ್ತದೆ. 1970ರ ದಶಕದ ಕರ್ನಾಟಕದ ಹಳ್ಳಿಯ ಬದುಕು ಕಾವ್ಯಾತ್ಮಕವಾಗಿ ಕಂಡರೂ, ಅದರ ಹಿಂದಿರುವ ಕಠಿಣ ವಾಸ್ತವವನ್ನು ಈ ಸಿನಿಮಾ ಅತ್ಯಂತ ಆಪ್ತವಾಗಿ ಚಿತ್ರಿಸುತ್ತದೆ.
films.producer: N Veeraswamy, S P Varadaraj, Chandulal Jain, Siddalingaiah
films.cast: Udaykumar, G. V. Iyer, Bharathi Vishnuvardhan, Lokanath, Shantala, Ashwath, B. S. Dwarakanath
films.awardsWon: Karnataka State Film Awards (Best Supporting Actor)

films.title: INDIA SONG
films.synopsis: India Song unfolds within the decaying decadence of a French embassy in 1930s India. Here, a diplomat’s wife drifts through a series of hollow affairs, surrendering to a suffocating sense of ennui. Interweaving themes of sex, madness, and colonial guilt, the film creates a haunting, almost incantatory experience—a cinematic fever dream with few precedents in the history of art.
films.kannadaTitle:
India Song unfolds within the decaying decadence of a French embassy in 1930s India. Here, a diplomat’s wife drifts through a series of hollow affairs, surrendering to a suffocating sense of ennui. Interweaving themes of sex, madness, and colonial guilt, the film creates a haunting, almost incantatory experience—a cinematic fever dream with few precedents in the history of art.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            1930ರ ದಶಕದ ಭಾರತದಲ್ಲಿದ್ದ ಫ್ರೆಂಚ್ ರಾಯಭಾರಿ ಕಚೇರಿಯ ವೈಭವ ಮತ್ತು ಅಲ್ಲಿನ ಸೊರಗುತ್ತಿರುವ ವಾತಾವರಣದ ಹಿನ್ನೆಲೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಈ ಸಿನಿಮಾ ಸಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಇಲ್ಲಿ ಉನ್ನತ ಅಧಿಕಾರಿಯೊಬ್ಬರ ಪತ್ನಿ, ತನ್ನ ಬದುಕಿನ ಏಕತಾನತೆಯಿಂದ ಬೇಸತ್ತು ಹೋಗಿರುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಆ ಬೇಸರವನ್ನು ಮರೆಯಲು ಅವಳು ಹಲವಾರು ಸಂಬಂಧಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ತನ್ನನ್ನು ತೊಡಗಿಸಿಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಕಾಮ, ಉನ್ಮಾದ ಮತ್ತು ವಸಾಹತುಶಾಹಿ ಕಾಲದ ಅಪರಾಧ ಪ್ರಜ್ಞೆಯಂತಹ ವಿಷಯಗಳನ್ನು ಒಳಗೊಂಡಿರುವ ಈ ಸಿನಿಮಾ, ಒಂದು ವಿಭಿನ್ನ ಅನುಭವವನ್ನು ನೀಡುತ್ತದೆ. ಕೇವಲ ಒಂದು ಕಥೆಯಾಗಿ ಉಳಿಯದೆ, ಇದು ನೋಡುಗರನ್ನು ಒಂದು ನಿಗೂಢ ಕನಸಿನ ಲೋಕಕ್ಕೆ ಕರೆದೊಯ್ಯುತ್ತದೆ. ಇಂತಹ ಪ್ರಯೋಗವು ಚಿತ್ರರಂಗದ ಇತಿಹಾಸದಲ್ಲೇ ಅತ್ಯಂತ ಅಪರೂಪ.
films.cast: Delphine Seyrig, Michael Lonsdale, Mathieu Carrière, Claude Mann, Vernon Dobtcheff, Didier Flamand, Claude Juan
films.awardsNominated: César Awards, France 1976 (Best Actress, Best Music, Best Sound), Cannes FF 2006 (Official Selection- Cannes Classics), IFFR 1975 (Official Selection), Mar del Plata IFF 2023 (Screened)
films.filmCourtesy: IFcinéma - Institut français / Alliance française de Bangalore

films.title: PADUVARAHALLI PANDAVARU
films.synopsis: Set in a rural village, five young men, unite to challenge the oppressive tyranny of a wealthy, corrupt landlord. Highlighting themes of collective justice and the struggle against feudalism.
films.sound: M. Shiva Rao, Jyothi, A. Govindaswamy
films.cast: Ambareesh, Ramakrishna, Jai Jagadish, Dheerendra Gopal, Musuri Krishnamurthy, Srilalitha, Shanthala, M. Jayashree, Aarathi.

films.title: THE DISPOSSESSED
films.synopsis: Vaasthuhara is based on the short story of the same name by C. V. Sreeraman. The film looks into the lives of partition refugees from East Bengal to West Bengal. At a larger level, it's the universal story of refugees.
films.kannadaTitle:
Vaasthuhara is based on the short story of the same name by C. V. Sreeraman. The film looks into the lives of partition refugees from East Bengal to West Bengal. At a larger level, it's the universal story of refugees.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            ಈ ಸಿನಿಮಾವು ಸಿ. ವಿ. ಶ್ರೀರಾಮನ್ ಅವರ ಇದೇ ಹೆಸರಿನ ಸಣ್ಣಕಥೆಯನ್ನು ಆಧರಿಸಿದೆ. ಭಾರತದ ವಿಭಜನೆಯ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಪೂರ್ವ ಬಂಗಾಳದಿಂದ ಪಶ್ಚಿಮ ಬಂಗಾಳಕ್ಕೆ ನಿರಾಶ್ರಿತರಾಗಿ ವಲಸೆ ಬಂದ ಜನರ ಬದುಕನ್ನು ಈ ಚಿತ್ರವು ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಕಟ್ಟುವಂತೆ ವಿವರಿಸುತ್ತದೆ. ಇದನ್ನು ಕೇವಲ ಒಂದು ಪ್ರಾಂತ್ಯದ ಕಥೆಯಾಗಿ ನೋಡುವ ಬದಲು, ಜಗತ್ತಿನ ಯಾವುದೇ ಮೂಲೆಯ ನಿರಾಶ್ರಿತರು ಅನುಭವಿಸುವ ಸಂಕಟದ ಕಥೆಯಾಗಿಯೂ ನೋಡಬಹುದು.
films.cast: Mohanlal, Shobhana, Neelanjana Mitra, Neena Gupta, Padmini, N.L. Balakrishnan, Lakshmi Krishnamurthy, Shyama, C.V. Sreeraman, Valsala Menon
films.awardsWon: National Film Award 1991 (Best Feature Film in Malayalam), Kerala State Film Awards (Best Film, Best Director, Best Story)

films.title: THE EARRINGS OF MADAM DE
films.synopsis: In the gilded world of 19th-century Paris, the Countess Louise sells her wedding earrings to settle a secret debt, claiming she simply lost them. This small, frivolous lie triggers a devastating chain of events as the jewels travel through the hands of her husband and her lover, the Baron Donati. What began as a trivial deception soon returns to haunt her, transforming a pair of trinkets into a catalyst for scandal, heartbreak, and a fatal clash of honor.
films.kannadaTitle:
In the gilded world of 19th-century Paris, the Countess Louise sells her wedding earrings to settle a secret debt, claiming she simply lost them. This small, frivolous lie triggers a devastating chain of events as the jewels travel through the hands of her husband and her lover, the Baron Donati. What began as a trivial deception soon returns to haunt her, transforming a pair of trinkets into a catalyst for scandal, heartbreak, and a fatal clash of honor.
                                
                                                            
                            
                            19ನೇ ಶತಮಾನದ ಪ್ಯಾರಿಸ್‌ನ ಶ್ರೀಮಂತ ಲೋಕದಲ್ಲಿ, ಕೌಂಟೆಸ್ ಲೂಯಿಸ್ ತನ್ನ ರಹಸ್ಯ ಸಾಲ ತೀರಿಸಲು ತನ್ನ ಮದುವೆಯ ಕಿವಿಯೋಲೆಗಳನ್ನು ಮಾರಿಬಿಡುತ್ತಾಳೆ; ಆದರೆ ಅವು ಕಳೆದುಹೋಗಿವೆ ಎಂದು ಹೇಳಿಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಾಳೆ. ಈ ಸಣ್ಣ, ತೀರಾ ಹಗುರವಾದ ಸುಳ್ಳೇ ಒಂದು ಭೀಕರ ಘಟನೆಗಳ ಸರಣಿಗೆ ಕಾರಣವಾಗುತ್ತದೆ—ಅವು ಅವಳ ಗಂಡನ ಕೈಗೂ, ಅವಳ ಪ್ರೇಮಿಯಾದ ಬ್ಯಾರನ್ ಡೊನಾಟಿಯ ಕೈಗೂ ಬದಲಾಗುತ್ತಾ ಸಾಗುತ್ತವೆ. ಅಲ್ಪವಾದ ಮೋಸವೆಂದು ಆರಂಭವಾದದ್ದು, ಬೇಗನೇ ಅವಳನ್ನು ಹಿಂಬಾಲಿಸಿ ಕಾಡುತ್ತದೆ; ಒಂದು ಜೋಡಿ ಆಭರಣಗಳು ಹಗರಣ, ಹೃದಯಭಂಗ, ಮತ್ತು ಮಾನದ ಘೋರ ಸಂಘರ್ಷಕ್ಕೆ ಕಾರಣವಾಗುವ ದಿಕ್ಕಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಕಥೆ ತಿರುಗಿಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತದೆ.
films.producer: Henri Bérard, Henry Deutschmeister, Angelo Rizzoli
films.cast: Charles Boyer, Danielle Darrieux, Vittorio De Sica, Jean Debucourt
films.awardsNominated: Academy Awards, USA (Best Costume Design, Black-and-White)

films.title: TWO ACRES OF LAND
films.synopsis: Do Bigha Zamin follows Shambhu, a poor farmer fighting to save his small plot of land from an exploitative landlord. Given a short deadline to repay his debt, he travels to the city with his young son to earn money. Forced into harsh urban labor as a rickshaw-puller while his son shines shoes, they confront poverty, humiliation, and fragile hope. Though they ultimately lose their land to industrial development, the film powerfully affirms their resilience, dignity, and unbroken moral strength amid relentless social injustice.
films.screenplay: Salil Choudhury, Hrishikesh Mukherjee, Paul Mahendra
films.cast: Balraj Sahni, Nirupa Roy, Ratan Kumar, Murad, Nana Palsikar, Nasir Hussain, Rajlakshmi, Noorjahan, Nazir Hussain, Rekha, Mishra, Chitra, Jagdeep, Tiwari, Meena Kumari
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF 1954 (International Prize), National Film Awards 1954 (Certificate of Merit), Karlovy Vary IFF (Prize for Social Progress), Filmfare Awards 1954 (Best Film, Best Director)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF 1954 (Grand Prize of the Festival), Venice FF 2025 (Best Restored Film)

films.title: CHOPIN, A SONATA IN PARIS
films.synopsis: Who is this young, fearless pianist? Who is this Polish composer who is using music to transcend its power? Who is this star that turns the heads of all Parisians? They refer to him as Chopin. The most romantic character of opulent Parisian evenings, he is the buzz of the town. Chopin realizes his days are running out when his lungs begin to hemorrhage. His sole concentration is composing. He is driven to transform music by the passing of time.
films.music: Robot Koch, Frédéric Chopin, Hildur Guðnadóttir
films.cast: Eryk Kulm, Joséphine de La Baume, Victor Meutelet, Lambert Wilson, Théo Grundmann Bréchet, Przemysław Kowalski
films.awardsWon: Camerimage (Bronze Frog), Gdynia FF (Best Production, Costume Design)
films.awardsNominated: Warsaw IFF(Official screening), Gdynia FF (Opening Film), CinÉast (Opening Film), IFF Kerla (World Cinema), Poland FF in Tokyo (Opening Film)

films.title: FRANZ
films.synopsis: A kaleidoscopic biopic of the iconic 20th-century Czech writer Franz Kafka, the film traces the imprint he left on the world from his birth in 19th-century Prague to his death in post–World War I Vienna. FRANZ offers a fresh, intimate perspective on the life of the man behind the literary giant, revealing the contradictions, obsessions, and inner worlds that shaped his enduring legacy.
films.cast: Idan Weiss, Peter Kurth, Jenovéfa Boková, Ivan Trojan, Katharina Stark, Sandra Korzeniak, Sebastian Schwarz, Aaron Friesz, Carol Schuler, Gesa Schermuly, Josef Trojan, Jan Budař
films.awardsWon: Gdynia Polish FF (Best film & Actor)
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF (World Premier), San Sebastián FF (Official Selection), Busan IFF (Official Selection)

films.title: GOLEM
films.synopsis: Pernat finds himself in a police interrogation, accused of murder, and unable to recall any details of the crime, or even his own life. He’s released back into a world of raving lunatics and deranged dentists, murderous doctors and scientists who believe the secret of human creation is inside the walls of a cast-iron oven.
films.cast: Marek Walczewski, Krystyna Janda, Joanna Żółkowska, Mariusz Dmochowski, Krzysztof Majchrzak, Wiesław Drzewicz, Bogusław Sobczuk
films.awardsWon: Polish FF (Best Directorial), Madrid Sci-Fi FF (Best Director and Best Screenplay).
films.awardsNominated: Warsaw IFF, 2022 (Classics from Poland)

films.title: LETTERS FROM WOLF STREET
films.synopsis: Indian filmmaker Arjun Talwar turns his lens on Warsaw’s Wilcza Street, where he has lived for a decade. Through witty encounters with an eclectic mix of neighbors—from a lonely postman to a Syrian exile—the film explores the complexities of integration, the shadow of a lost friend, and the pulse of a modern Poland caught between tradition and multiculturalism.
films.editor: Bigna Tomschin (main editor), Arjun Talwar, Sabina Filipowicz
films.cast: Piotr Chadryś, Mo Tan, Feras Daboul, Barbara Goettgens, Kazimierz "Oskar" Paczkowski, Andrzej Jakimowski.
films.awardsWon: Millennium Docs Against Gravity (Cinema Association Award), Neisse FF (Best Documentary and Audience Documentary Award)
films.awardsNominated: Berlin IFF (World Premiere), CPH:DOX (Millenium Docs Against Gravity), Beldocs IDFF, Neisse FF, Transylvania IFF, Beyond Borders FF, Melbourne Indian FF, Cin East Luxembourg, IDFA (Best of Fests).

films.title: ON THE SILVER GLOBE
films.synopsis: A lady is among the few cosmic explorers who depart Earth to establish a new civilization. They are unaware that the end of their own dream is within them. As their offspring revert to a primitive local culture and create new myths and gods, they perish one by one.
films.cast: Andrzej Seweryn, Jerzy Trela, Grażyna Dyląg, Waldemar Kownacki, Iwona Bielska, Jerzy Grałek, Elżbieta Karkoszka
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF, 1988 (Un Certain Regard)

films.title: THE HOURGLASS SANATORIUM
films.synopsis: While visiting his father at a dilapidated sanatorium, Joseph discovers that the old man has stopped breathing but hasn’t died. Has his arrival halted time itself? He takes a strange journey through the many rooms of the hospital, each conjuring worlds composed of memories, dreams and nightmares.
films.cast: Jan Nowicki, Tadeusz Kondrat, Irena Orska, Halina Kowalska, Gustaw Holoubek, Mieczysław Voit, Bożena Adamek, Ludwik Benoit, Henryk Boukołowski.
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF, 1973 (Jury Prize).
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF, 1973 (Palme d’Or), Thessaloniki FF 2025 (Special Screening)

films.title: UNDER THE VOLCANO
films.synopsis: A Ukrainian family is spending their final day of vacation in Tenerife, Spain, when suddenly Russia’s ongoing occupation of Ukraine turns into a full-scale invasion. As their return to Kyiv becomes impossible, the tourists are forced to become refugees overnight.
films.cast: Sofiia Berezovska, Roman Lutskyi, Anastasiia Karpienko, Fedir Pugachov
films.awardsWon: Polish FF, 2024 (Best Debut Actor), Marrakech IFF, 2024 (Best Actor, Best Director)
films.awardsNominated: Toronto IFF, 2024 (World Premiere), BFI London FF, 2024 (Official Selection), Zurich FF 2024 (Official Selection)

films.title: BHUMIKA
films.synopsis: The film follows the life of a successful film star, revealing her increasing alienation in a role both glamorized and patronized by society. After being forced into show business by her family, she spends her time between studios and disastrous love affairs, and feels more and more dissatisfied.
films.screenplay: Satyadev Dubey, Girish Karnad, Shyam Benegal
films.sound: Hitendra Ghosh, B.N. Tiwari, Mangesh Desai
films.cast: Smita Patil, Amol Palekar, Anant Nag, Naseeruddin Shah, Amrish Puri.
films.awardsWon: Filmfare Awards 1978 (Best Film), National Film Awards 1978 (Silver Lotus Award: Best Screenplay)
films.awardsNominated: Chicago IFF 1978(Gold Hugo - Best Feature)

films.title: GAMAN
films.synopsis: Gaman follows Ghulam Hasan, a young man from Lucknow who migrates to Bombay to support his family, leaving behind his sick mother and devoted wife, Khairun. Working as a taxi driver, he faces exploitation, poverty, and isolation in the city’s slums, sustained only by letters home and fragile friendships with other migrants. As his hopes fade and losses mount, including his mother’s death, Ghulam is pushed toward despair and self-destruction, revealing a city that deepens rather than relieves rural hardship.
films.cast: Farooq Shaikh, Smita Patil, Gita Siddharth, Jalal Agha, Amir Bano, Hira Devi Mishra, Sulabha Deshpande, Nana Patekar, Arvind Deshpande, Satish Shah, Arun Joglekar
films.awardsWon: National Film Awards 1979 (Special Mention: Feature Film, Best Music Direction, Best Female Playback Singer)

films.title: CHIDAMBARAM
films.synopsis: Muniyandi, a farm laborer, marries and brings Shivakami to the farm, where she befriends Shankaran. Muniyandi later catches them together, and, devastated, dies by suicide. Overcome with guilt, Shankaran flees and tries alcohol and spirituality to escape his torment. His journey ends in the temple town of Chidambaram, where he finds Shivakami working as a shoe keeper at the temple.
films.cast: Bharat Gopy, Smita Patil, Sreenivasan
films.awardsWon: National Film Awards 1985 (Golden Lotus Award: Best Film)
films.awardsNominated: Chicago IFF 1986 (Gold Hugo - Best Feature), Leeds IFF 2024 (Official Screening - Retrospective)

films.title: MIRCH MASALA
films.synopsis: Subedars (tax collectors) in colonial India traveled from village to village with troops, demanding far more than taxes. When one of these tax collectors sets his gaze on Sonbai, she seeks shelter in a pepper factory, which inevitably leads to the village’s marginalised women speaking up.
films.producer: National Film Development Corporation of India (NFDC)
films.screenplay: Shafi Hakim, Hriday Lani, Ketan Meht, Tripurari Sharma
films.cast: Smita Patil, Naseeruddin Shah, Om Puri, Ratna Pathak, Supriya Pathak, Suresh Oberoi, Neena Kulkarni
films.awardsWon: Hawaii IFF 1987 (East-West Center Award Best Narrative), National Film Awards 1987 (Golden Lotus Award: Best Feature Film)
films.awardsNominated: Moscow IFF(Golden Prize), Leeds IFF 2024 (Official Screening - Classic Retrospective)

films.title: CANAL
films.synopsis: “Watch them closely, for these are the last hours of their lives,” announces a narrator, foretelling the tragedy that unfolds as a war-ravaged company of Home Army resistance fighters tries to escape the Nazis through the sewers of Warsaw.
films.cast: Teresa Izewska, Tadeusz Janczar, Wienczyslaw Glinski, Tadeusz Gwiazdowski
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF, 1957 (Jury Special Prize)
films.awardsNominated: BAFTA Award, 1959 (Most Promising Newcomer to Film), Cannes FF, 1957 (Palme d'Or)

films.title: ASHES & DIAMONDS
films.synopsis: On the final day of a major global conflict, a young resistance fighter receives orders to carry out one last assignment. As the nation transitions between eras of control, he experiences a chance romantic encounter that sparks a profound moral crisis. He finds himself torn between his ingrained sense of duty and a newfound desire for a normal, peaceful life.
films.cast: Zbigniew Cybulski, Ewa Krzyzewska, Waclaw Zastrzezynski, Adam Pawlikowski, Bogumił Kobiela
films.awardsWon: Venice FF, 1959 (FIPRESCI)
films.awardsNominated: BAFTA Awards, 1960 (Best Foreign Actor, Best Film)

films.title: INNOCENT SORCERERS
films.synopsis: A bachelor doctor, who is also a jazz musician, can’t quite commit himself to his superficial girlfriend. Him and his aimless friends find any kind of human contact or emotional commitment as a trouble and uninviting prospect.
films.cast: Tadeusz Łomnicki, Krystyna Stypułkowska, Wanda Koczeska, Kalina Jędrusik, Zbigniew Cybulski, Roman Polański, Jerzy Skolimowski
films.awardsWon: Edinburgh IFF 1961 (Diploma of Merit), Jussi Awards (Finland) 1963  (Best Foreign Film)
films.awardsNominated: Melbourne IFF 1963 (Screened), IFFI 1965 (Screened), São Paulo IFF 2016 (Screened)

films.title: THE PROMISED LAND
films.synopsis: The Promised Land follows three ambitious friends - a Pole, a German, and a Jew - who strive to build a textile factory in 19th-century Łódź. Their quest for wealth exposes the brutal realities of industrial capitalism and moral compromise.
films.cinematography: Witold Sobociński, Edward Kłosiński, Wacław Dybowski
films.cast: Daniel Olbrychski, Wojciech Pszoniak, Andrzej Seweryn, Kalina Jędrusik, Anna Nehrebecka
films.awardsWon: Chicago IFF, 1975 (Golden Hugo), Moscow FF, 1975 (Golden Prize), Valladolid IFF, 1977 (Golden Corn)
films.awardsNominated: Academy Award, 1976 (Best Foreign Language)

films.title: MAN OF MARBLE
films.synopsis: A young Polish filmmaker sets out to find out what happened to Mateusz Birkut, a bricklayer who became apropaganda hero in the 1950s but later fell out of favor and disappeared.
films.cast: Krystyna Janda, Jerzy Radziwiłowicz, Tadeusz Łomnicki
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF, 1977 (FIPRESCI Prize), Polish FF (Critics Award), New York Film Critics Circle Awards, 1981 (Special Award), Zlote Kaczki, Poland, 2009 (Best Polish Actor in period pieces)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF, 1977 (Un Certain Regard Award), New York Film Critics Circle Awards, 1981 (Best Foreign Language Film)

films.title: THE MAIDS OF WILKO
films.synopsis: Set in the late ’20s. A thirtyish young man, who heads a small factory, faints at the funeral of a close friend. He decides to go home to his aunt and uncle for a while, but gets involved with a family of five women who had been in love with him at one time.
films.cast: Daniel Olbrychski,Anna Seniuk,Christine Pascal
films.awardsWon: Polish FF (Special Jury Prize, Best Production Design)
films.awardsNominated: Academy Awards, USA 1980 (Best Foreign Language Film), Valladolid IFF (Best Film)

films.title: AFTERIMAGE
films.synopsis: In Andrzej Wajda’s final film, Afterimage, legendary avant-garde painter Władysław Strzemiński defies the Soviet-imposed doctrine of Socialist Realism in post-war Poland. As the Stalinist regime strips him off his teaching position and dignity, the disabled artist wages a tragic, uncompromising battle for creative freedom and personal integrity.
films.cast: Bogusław Linda, Bronisława Zamachowska, Zofia Wichłacz, Krzysztof Pieczyński, Maria Semotiuk
films.awardsWon: Polish FF (Special Jury Prize), New York Polish FF (Best Film)
films.awardsNominated: Cleveland IFF (Best Feature Film), Seattle IFF (Best Actor), Polish Film Awards (Best Cinematography, Best Production Design, Best Costume Design , Best Sound), Montclair FF (Best feature film)

films.title: BHAKTA KANAKADASA
films.synopsis: Thimmappa Nayaka, a fierce warrior and chieftain, renounces his worldly life after a divine intervention by Lord Krishna during a battle. Transforming into the saint poet Kanakadasa, he faces severe caste-based discrimination. His unwavering devotion eventually leads to a miracle at the Udupi temple, where the deity turns to grant him a vision through a crack in the wall.
films.cast: Dr. Rajkumar, Udaya Kumar, Krishna Kumari, K. S. Ashwath, T. R. Narasimharaju, B. Hanumanthachar
films.awardsWon: National Film Awards 1960 (Best Feature Film in Kannada)

films.title: SANDHYA RAAGA
films.synopsis: Young Lakshmana, from a sophisticated family, dedicates his life to classical music against familial opposition. His musical journey explores devotion, sacrifice, and the evening raga's emotional depth. Featuring legendary vocalists Bhimsen Joshi and Balamurali Krishna, the film celebrates Karnataka's musical heritage through Lakshmana's artistic struggles and triumphs.
films.producer: A. C. Narasimha Murthy, A. Prabhakara Rao
films.cast: Dr. Rajkumar, Bharathi, Udayakumar, K. S. Ashwath, Narasimharaju, Pandaribai, H. R. Shastry

films.title: UYYALE
films.synopsis: The film follows Radha, a woman increasingly isolated by her husband Seshagiri Rao, a professor more devoted to his academic research than his domestic life. The emotional chasm between them widens. Into this void enters Krishna. As a deep, forbidden bond forms between Radha and Krishna, the film navigates the tension between individual desire and the moral structures of 1960s society.
films.cast: Dr. Rajkumar, Kalpana, K. S. Ashwath, T. N. Balakrishna, Jayashree, Papamma, Ramadevi, Premalatha, Baby Girija, Umashree, Malashree, Namdev, Dr. Sridhar, N. K. Narasimhaiah, M. Leelavathi
films.awardsWon: Karnataka State Film Awards, 1969 (Second Best Film, Best Story Writer)
films.awardsNominated: Screened at IFFI (Retrospective Sections in 1992 and 2019)

films.title: SHANKAR GURU
films.synopsis: Rajashekhar, an honest businessman, is forced to flee after accidentally killing a corrupt associate, losing contact with his pregnant wife Sumathi. Years later, Sumathi lives in Delhi with their son Shankar, while Rajashekhar has become a wealthy estate owner in Kashmir. When Shankar is invited to manage the estate, father and son unknowingly reconnect. But Rajashekhar’s former partners return seeking a stolen temple necklace and kidnap Sumathi, forcing Shankar and his twin Guru to rescue their parents and reunite the family.
films.cast: Dr. Rajkumar, Kanchana, Jayamala, Padmapriya, T. N. Balakrishna, Vajramuni, Thoogudeepa Srinivas
films.awardsWon: Karnataka State Film Awards 1977-78 (Best Editing)

films.title: JEEVANA CHAITRA
films.synopsis: Vishwanatha Raya, a benevolent Jodidar of Simhadri village, fights social evils like liquor and gambling while raising three sons. Family rifts emerge as his educated sons prioritize urban ambitions over rural values - eldest loves a liquor baron's daughter, middle son's wife resents village life, youngest defies arranged marriage. After losing his wife and memory in a pilgrimage accident, Vishwanath returns transformed, reunites family, defeats corruption, and ascends spiritually.
films.cast: Dr. Rajkumar, Madhavi, Sudharani, Gurudutt, Abhijith, Balaraj, K. S. Ashwath, Thoogudeepa Srinivas, Tennis Krishna
films.awardsWon: Karnataka State Film Awards 1992-93 (Best Film, Best Actor, Best Music Director, Best Dialogue Writer)

films.title: CEMETERY OF SPLENDOUR
films.synopsis: Soldiers with a mysterious sleeping sickness are transferred to a temporary clinic in a former school. The memory-filled space becomes a revelatory world for housewife and volunteer Jenjira, as she watches over Itt, a handsome soldier with no family visitors. There may be a connection between the soldiers’ enigmatic syndrome and the mythic ancient site that lies beneath the clinic. Magic, healing, romance and dreams are all part of Jen’s tender path to a deeper awareness of herself and the world around her.
films.producer: Charles de Meaux, Simon Field, Hans W. Geissendörfer, Michael Weber
films.cast: Banlop Lomnoi, Jenjira Pongpas, Jarinpattra Rueangram
films.awardsWon: Asia Pacific Screen Awards, 2015 (Best Film), Chlotrudis Awards, 2021 (Best Cinematography, Best Director)
films.awardsNominated: Cannes FF, 2015 (Official Selection: Un Certain Regard), Indiewire Critics' Poll, 2015 (Most Anticipated of 2016)

films.title: MEMORIA
films.synopsis: Ever since being startled by a loud ‘bang’ at daybreak, Jessica is unable to sleep. In Bogotá to visit her sister, she befriends Agnes , an archaeologist studying human remains discovered within a tunnel under construction. Jessica travels to see Agnes at the excavation site. In a small town nearby, she encounters a fish scaler, Hernan. They share memories by the river. As the day comes to a close, Jessica is awakened to a sense of clarity.
films.cast: Tilda Swinton, Jeanne Balibar, Elkin Díaz, Juan Pablo Urrego
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF 2021 (Jury Prize), Chicago IFF 2021 (Gold Hugo - Best Feature)
films.awardsNominated: Indiewire Critics' Poll 2021 (Best International Film, Best Film, Best Director, Best Cinematography), Toronto IFF 2021 (Official Selection), AFI Fest 2021 (World Cinema)

films.title: MYSTERIOUS OBJECT AT NOON
films.synopsis: Armed with a tape recorder, Apichatpong Weerasethakul travels through Thailand inviting strangers to build a shared story. Each person continues the narrative where the last one stopped, creating a collective tale about a young disabled boy and his teacher. The storytellers come from very different worlds, including street vendors, a boxer obsessed with television, a devout policewoman, and a lonely rubber tapper. As more voices join in, the story grows stranger, richer, and more unpredictable. The film becomes a playful portrait of imagination, community, and the many lives that shape a single narrative.
films.cast: Duangjai Hiransri, Somsri Pinyopol, Kannikar Narong, Jaruwan Techasatiern, Daew, Thanit Niyomprasit, Jack, Chakree Duangklao
films.awardsWon: Jeonju IFF (Woosuk Award), Yamagata International Documentary IFF, 2001 (Special Mention: NETPAC Award, Runner-up Prize), Vancouver IFF, 2000 (Special Mention: Dragons and Tigers Award)
films.awardsNominated: Rotterdam IFF, 2000 (World Premier), BFI London FF, 2000 (Official Screening)

films.title: UNCLE BOONMEE WHO CAN RECALL HIS PAST LIVES
films.synopsis: Suffering from acute kidney failure, Uncle Boonmee has chosen to spend his final days surrounded by his loved ones in the coun- tryside. Surprisingly, the ghost of his deceased wife appears to care for him, and his long lost son returns home in a non-human form. Contemplating the reasons for his illness, Boonmee treks through the jungle with his family to a mysterious hilltop cave - the birthplace of his first life.
films.kannadaTitle: ಅಂಕಲ್ ಬೂನ್ಮೀ ಹೂ ಕ್ಯಾನ್ ರಿಕಾಲ್ ಹಿಸ್ ಪಾಸ್ಟ್ ಲೈವ್ಸ್
films.producer: Simon Field, Keith Griffiths, Charles de Meaux, Apichatpong Weerasethakul, Hans W. Geissendoerfer, Luis Miñarro,  Michael Weber
films.cinematography: Sayombhu Mukdeeprom, Yukontorn Mingmongkon, Charin Pengpanich
films.cast: Thanapat Saisaymar, Jenjira Pongpas, Sakda Kaewbuadee, Natthakarn Aphaiwonk, Geerasak Kulhong, Kanokporn Thongaram
films.awardsWon: Cannes FF, 2010 (Palme d'Or), Sitges - Catalonian IFF, 2010 (José Luis Guarner Critic's Award - Best Film), Chicago IFF, 2011 (Winner: Silver Plaque - International Film Poster Competition)
films.awardsNominated: Indiewire Critics' Poll, 2011 (Best Film, Best Director), Independent Spirit Awards, 2011 (Best Foreign Film), New York FF, 2010 (Official Screening)

films.title: PORTE BAGAGE
films.synopsis: When caregiver Noor is offered her dream job as a chef in Paris, she can no longer care for her father Musa, who suffers from dementia. In response, she helps him fulfill his final wish: to return to Morocco. A layered and emotionally resonant family drama about a Moroccan-Dutch family on a redemptive road trip full of emotional baggage.

films.title: NOUVELLE VAGUE
films.synopsis: Behind the scenes of the filming of Jean-Luc Godard's groundbreaking 1960 film 'Breathless' (À bout de souffle). A love letter to cinema and the French New Wave movement that revolutionized filmmaking.
